So rather than letting me clean it up they just decided to kick us off the plane, no explanation, no exceptions whatsoever. Absolute worst airline.

San Diego to Dallas. The worst experience ever. I checked my bag and the bag came back destroyed, ripped with my belongings out in a plastic bag. They offered a new bag which was too small and suggested to put the rest in plastic bags! I refused and I bought a new same size bag at the airport, same size as my old one. They refused to refund for a new bag saying that my bag was improperly packed (not true, never had that issue before and with other airline. and what even that means?).

Flights are always delayed. They charge high dollar for garbage service. We pay $2200 to fly from Denver to Key West just to have the flight delayed we missed our connecting flight by a few minutes because they were delayed and even though the plane was still sitting in the runway with walk way attached they would not let us on. They don’t offer compensation or upgrades or anything for the hassle and wasted money. We also paid top dollar for a house on the beach that we’re no longer staying at. The flights they tried to give us due to the mess up also is delayed and we are unlikely to make the connection again and won’t be making it to our destination unless we want to fly to Miami and try and drive and pay extra money for a car. An awfully expensive trip to just get screwed over. Huge waste of money and a huge waste of time. If you’re thinking about flying American Airlines don’t. You will absolutely regret it and they will not take care of you! Terrible company, terrible people!

Paris to Chicago. The flight in itself was fine. The flight attendants were fine and usually cooperative. However, they needed cajoling as usual to get what you had wanted. i.e. You either had to flag one down as they just walk right by you or corner them in the galley or aisle.  When you or your company is spending thousands of dollars though, you'd expect a higher service level. On this flight out of Paris, the catering or meals were very good. I had the beef which was very tender with cheddar mashed potatoes. The appetizer of shrimp with a spicier sauce was delicious. The Ben & Jerry's vanilla ice cream sundae with hot fudge, butterscotch, whipped cream, cherries, berries and nuts was great. Plenty of en-route snacks like fresh fruit, packaged cookies, chips and so on to munch on. The arrival meal was a lighter smaller beef ale pie and a chicken mushroom one. Also good. What I don't like is when you get a malfunctioning business class lie flat bed or seat like I did, there is no where to move. This cabin was full. This is very annoying and the airline should ensure these seats work each and every flight with their maintenance programs (if they so care). I have to rate this flight 3 stars because of that.

Not Verified | Sydney to Baltimore via Dallas. After flying five hours from Perth to Sydney and then 15 more to Dallas I had an 8-hour layover till my flight to BWI. There was another flight boarding at 234 so asked to get on that so I wouldn’t have wait 8 hours, so I go to customer service and ask and she goes already closed, meanwhile I could see people getting in. I don’t know why Qantas you would partner with such an airline as American. The staff seem to have no idea what they are doing. Their computers say gate closed but people still boarding. Maybe they need retraining.
Dallas to Sacramento. Terrible and unprofessional flight attendant, who was serving beverages on board. Arrogant and impatient to what I asked for.

Embarrassing how unprepared this flight was. Delayed 3 times once we got on, now I am going to miss my connection in Dallas. I travel for work 90% of the year and I vowed I would never fly American again, but unfortunately my company needed me somewhere and the only option was American. They didn’t fail to disappoint however, flight delayed 3 times and now we are sitting on the runway for another 20 min for “unknown” reason. This one and only chance I have to this horrible airline proved everything I have stood for. I will drive across the country from now on before I have to travel with American Airlines again.

Albuquerque to Chicago. My second time riding with American and it was great! My sister and I booked basic economy. Due to our tickets, our seats were separated. Fortunately, one of the flight attendants saw us talking prior to boarding. She offered us an empty row, so we both can sit together. Also, Inflight entertainment was great since I can use AA website on my phone for free to watch live tv or movies.

I was very disappointed with the way I was treated traveling from Memphis to bBuffalo. We arrived to the check in desk in Memphis and the lady was so rude and she told us that American Airlines had changed our flight from fly from Memphis to Washington DC then from there to buffalo to going through Chicago because the Washington DC one was delayed. While you might think at first, this was a good thing and I thought it was to until once we were through security we were told the flight that American had rescheduled us on was delayed from 10 to 12 and then later they delayed it again We did not end up boarding the plane till about 1:30 it ended up being a same three seat 20 row plane which was cramped. Then we missed the connection flight that American Airlines set up for us to get on because our connection flight left at 3:00 and since our other flight was delayed three time we did not even land in Chicago till 3:00 and the next flight to buffalo is at 7:01 you can understand how frustrating this can be. We arrived at the airport at 8:00am expecting to be home around 4:30pm and now we will not be getting home till around 10:30pm that’s a total of about 14 hours I will be spending in these air port.

Not Verified |  If you can avoid flying American Airlines, most likely you will do yourself a favor. They change my itinerary without informing me. They give me a new itinerary that involved 2 days travel plus an overnight at my expense. Baggage needed to be checked twice for the same trip at my expense. They demand payment for my golf bag of $200.00 US. My golf bag weighed 42 lbs. Overall a very bad experience with people in reservation, customer service and the agents and ticketing counters.

Charlotte to Indianapolis with American Airlines. The worst airline of all! Everyday, every flight, they seem to lower the bar and prove they are the worst. Flights are always delayed, service is bad and unprofessional. If there’s a way they can make passengers miserable, they find it and do it. I’ll take a later flight from a different airline as they still get there sooner. Never again!

Nashville to Philadelphia. I had the most wonderful experience aboard this aircraft. I was greeted with smiles from the young lady scanning my ticket to the kind flight attendant whom I had such fun guessing where his accent was from. If you want to have a lovely flight I would suggest flying from Nashville to Philadelphia if this crew is on board. I fly frequently and American has moved to the top of my list for preferred airlines. Thank you for such a great experience! (As a reminder to the public - share your good experiences as much as you share your bad. The world will be a more beautiful place for it)

Not Verified |  Los Angeles to Columbus. This is by far the most poorly trained staff I’ve ever experienced flying. With not much time before my flight I needed help finding the fastest way of getting my boarding pass and going through security. When told I couldn’t check in at the front desk they gave me a late check in slip and told me to go to the security line. When I got to the security line they wouldn’t allow me through without a boarding pass which was not given to me by the American Airlines staff. Due to the back and forth of being pointed in the wrong direction by 3 different American Airlines employees I eventually missed my flight which I needed to make for work. Train our staff for these situations because you clearly don’t understand or seem to care about the impact misinformation and general cluelessness by “professionals” under your company can do to someone.

My friends and I were supposed to be flying to New Orleans but our flight was cancelled due to weather. The airline promised us over the phone that if they flew us to Mississippi instead that they would reimburse us for any car rental costs to get us to our final destination. We agreed to fly to Mississippi because of this agreement. They said we can just call them and they'll walk us through how to get the refund and it will be an easy process. Once the trip was complete I called the airline and they said they can't do anything over the phone and to contact their customer support email. I did so and they said there's nothing they can do and they don't refund car rentals ever. There was a lot of back and forth, I explained that we were guaranteed a refund and they refused to honour that guarantee and kept repeating that they got us to Mississippi and that was their only responsibility. Horrible customer service. Will never fly with American Airlines again.

Las Vegas to Dallas. We boarded on time, things were looking good, and then we sat on the runway for an hour. Then we got off the plane and found out it would be another hour at least(its been 2 now). I missed my connecting flight and had to reschedule but the soonest flight wont get me to my destination until tomorrow mid morning. Wouldn't have been a big deal except I am now paying for a hotel room that I'm not using, missing my husband's graduation from basic training, and paying $300 for a rental car. I would not recommend this airline to anyone.

Not Verified |  San Antonio to Albuquerque via Dallas. I had the worst experience in my 40 years of flying with this airline. Late flights, which caused me to miss a flight, I did get on a flight that put me in Albuquerque at one o’clock in the morning (it was late, also) and to add insult to injury, my luggage was still in Dallas. They had five and a half hours to get their act together and get the luggage in the right place. I am still waiting for my luggage to be delivered to me. I have been told it is out for delivery, but no sign of it yet. They also kept changing gates for the flight that kept getting delayed. The bus would’ve been faster. Nope, not flying American again.

Nashville to Laredo via Dallas. I was supposed to depart at 6:30 AM arriving in Laredo at 11:09 AM for a meeting. Went to bed early for the early to find a text indicated my flight was delayed to 12:00 PM - they rebooked me on the 5:00 AM - arriving 12:39 PM. Every flight I have taken on this airline this year have had at least one leg with problems. When it happens, the indifference their staff showed to passengers was appalling. Their problem started with their people, which explain equipment problems then operational problems

Miami to Georgetown. I am so upset with this airline. They have the worst customer service both in person and on the phone. I missed my flight because they gave me the wrong gate code. The gate code that they sent me via text said that it’s departing at gate E31. I checked on the information screen posted all over the airport and the the same gate was written and said gate E31. There was no recent text or update after that and when I went to the gate, there was nobody there and I checked the online status and the gate change to D60. The person I talked to at the rebooking booth literally told me that I should be checking their online app. I thought that the information provided via information screen all over the airport are updated as well. I also opted to get text notification for any changes but there was none sent out. They wanted me to call the number and the wait was an hour long. They can’t do anything for me. They won’t even allow me to book to the next earlier flight that they have because the connecting flight is not American Airlines. They obviously only want to book it through their airlines. They could have book me a flight to Nassau and got a connecting flight from there but they refused to do so. They wanted me to wait the next day for their airline. I even showed the guest services the pictures and text that I received and yet nothing was done for me at all and I am stuck in the airport for two days. This is the worst airline so far.

Honolulu to Los Angeles. When we showed up to check our bags on our return flight nobody was working the baggage counter.  Apparently this airport in Honolulu baggage claim closes for 5 hours in the morning from 7-12 and American Airlines failed to mention it. When I called they said I didn’t call to check the baggage counter hours so I am to blame. This airline is the only airline to close their baggage counter in the airport. They refused to assist in any way. I will never fly American Airlines again.

Norfolk to Peoria via Charlotte. This is a customer service review, not a flight review. I had military obligations come up requiring me to be on duty for the date of my flight so I would not be able to make my flight. They said I would not be able to cancel my flight or move it unless it was a change of order and first had to contact the commanding officer. Anyone with military experience knows that is unreasonable considering a CO doesn’t have time to deal with moving someone’s flight. They were not willing to assist any further than that. If you’re military I recommend looking elsewhere.

Hong Kong to Tucson via Los Angeles. Out bound was fine, 4-6 hr layover at each airport, but easy to get from plane to plane. Coming back. Land in LAX at the remote international terminal and have to go through immigration (expected that) easy transport to the connecting flight - no. After immigration have to go through security (pretty stupid since I just got seen by 3 immigration people) then I have to walk myself out the building and over to the next terminal, then go through security again because they can't bus you directly to your connecting gate or at least to the main terminal with out you leaving and reentering, then my flight isn't on the board so have to ask 3 different AA personnel who give three vastly different answers on where my flight will be (each answer has me go to a totally different terminal) before my flight is finally put up on the board and I have to take a bus to another remote terminal (at least I didn't have to go through security again). Yes half of this review is on LAX but in reality when the airline leases the gates at the remote terminals they also contract how to get their passengers to/from those terminals and their connecting flights. Especially when the connecting flight is with a partner airline.

Charlotte to Dayton. I rarely fly so I don’t know the ropes. While the staff at the ticket counter were friendly and helpful, the woman at the counter outside the plane and the stewardess were condescending and rude. Such treatment of customers in my business would not be tolerated.

Dallas to Lima via Miami. American Airlines never fails to screw up a trip in every which way, then not properly compensate. I was supposed to be in Lima on this Wednesday evening at the nice hotel I booked, so I could fly to Cusco in the morning Thursday. They were boarding us onto our original flight which was Scheduled for 345 this afternoon From Miami, and as we were boarding they stopped boarding and said something was wrong with the plane so they sent us to another gate. 2.5 hours later they boarded us onto another plane where we flew for 30 minutes before they turned it around for another mechanical failure (one engine literally wasn’t working And we were greeted by a dozen firetrucks all surrounding the plane). We were then directed to the service desk, where I stood in line with 500 other people for 3.5 hours in line so that I could just get a meal voucher and a hotel. I had a flight from Lima to Cusco tomorrow, but they said since I didn’t book the Lima to Cusco through them they can’t help, and they also can’t help that I have to find accommodations in lima tomorrow night because of this. On top of everything, they kept all our bags so there are no clean clothes or toiletries. They made me check my carry on too, so my valuables and medicine are now sitting in the airport for 24 hours. So I lost a day, $600 dollars, sleep. I'm still waiting for the shuttle to take me to the hotel in Miami, and I won’t be there until after midnight tonight The only airline worse than American is Spirit.

London to St. Louis via Dallas Ft Worth. Flight was leaving from a remote stand, so since I need assistance I was delivered to the plane via a lift. After boarding we were put on a 30 minute hold by the tower which is not abnormal for Heathrow. Arrived late in Dallas to find that I was already re-booked and assisted to the plane. The flight from London was wonderful with attentive flight attendants and very good food. The IFE was up to date and easy to use. I didn't try using the Wi-Fi. The flight to St Louis was on a A319 which I find confining even in first class. Overall a good experience; very well taken care of.

Do not fly this airline! Our trip started out flying from Los Angeles (LAX) to Dallas (DFW), then onto Paris (CDG), then to Munich (MUN) for Oktoberfest. The flight from LAX to DFW was ok which is the only reason I gave a 1 out of 5 rating. Where the trip went sideways was during our layover in DFW. We experienced a 30-minute or so delay to board the plane - no big deal, as intentionally purchased a ticket from CDG to MUN with a longer layover in case anything happened. So once all passengers were on the plane roughly 30 minutes behind schedule, we sat there for another 2-hours before actually taking off. After patiently sitting in our seats for about one hour, I knew I had to speak up about our connecting flight to make the American Airline team aware of the situation. The flight attendant assured me we would be taking off "very shortly" and we would "make up time" while in the air, so I shouldn't worry. I was reluctant to believe the flight attendant so I asked if we could exit the plane to catch another flight to Paris. She would not let us leave the plane. Rather than make a scene, which would have been no good for anyone, I chose to sit back down and wait patiently for our departure. We finally took off after sitting there for 2-hours! Of course, we did not make up any time while in the air and I'm almost certain we saw the Lufthansa connecting flight take off for Munich as we landed. Trying to keep my calm, I told the same flight attendant that we missed our connecting flight due to their delay. She said, "you'll need to call customer service and take it up with them." No apology, no help whatsoever with sorting it out. We got off the plane and I immediately called customer service. They shouldn't even have "service" in their name because they didn't do a damn thing to help, they were terribly rude. No empathy, no apology, nothing. Customer service said, "well, you took the flight, so there is nothing we can do." Of course, we took the flight because they wouldn't let us off the plane even after sitting there for hours! Already late to our Oktoberfest plans, I was then forced to spend another 650 EURO for two tickets from Paris to Munich. Called customer service again and demanded a refund for our flight or at least credit towards another flight. Nothing, but rude attendants on the other line saying, "there is nothing we can do".

Not Verified |  Miami to Havana. Terrible experience with American Airlines, supervisor refused to allow me to take my bicycle after I called American Airlines Customer service 3 times before my flight! When she refused me after I had prepared my bike as per the requirements given to me by the customer service at American Airlines. I contacted customer service right there and they told me what they had told me 3 times before and the "supervisor" refused to speak to them. I had been dropped off at the airport at 3:30am! I didn't have anywhere to leave my bike and still the supervisor didn't care. I have never received worse treatment in any airline. I have written a complaint and I hope that someone tries to rectify this situation.

Orlando to La Guardia via Charlotte. American is consistent at one thing: mediocrity. They have a poor understanding of experience, and are seemingly doing nothing about it. Today the delay was poorly communicated (with only 1 announcement and no updates with an over 30min delay), no apologies, zero capability to flight plan, especially with connections. They offered no support to passengers who were delayed and no one took responsibility. Almost every other airline I’ve flown globally have this capability. Customer experience is overtly and embarrassingly low propriety to this profit-focused business. Avoid them!! There are other options, even if it means giving up a lounge access or points, just do it. The stress of this terrible airline isn’t worth it.

Not Verified |  American Airlines will not make any attempt to cover lost baggage.  They also have notorious horrible customer service. Do not fly them if you value your belongings.They lost my bag on a flight from Nashville to Miami in July. After months of time spent filling out questionnaires and sitting on hold they refused to provide any compensation.

Not Verified | London Heathrow to Dallas. I checked in ahead and paid for a premium economy seat. I wanted to be a bit more comfortable on this 10 hour flight. My previous flight landed at London Heathrow late causing me to have to run with my backpack and suitcase to the American Airlines check-in. I check in as my flight to Dallas was boarding! The check-in crew was extremely helpful and directed me to go straight to my gate and not worry about my luggage as they will take care of it. I get to the gate and what do I discover?! Due to my late check in my premium economy seat was given to someone else! I was upset. I paid extra and now I’m stuck with a regular economy seat. I received my new seat an aisle seat just what I like! To my surprise the seat was not bad! It was a 3-row seat and the row behind me was a 2-row seat. I was able to recline my seat all the back knowing that no one was directly behind me. The service by the attendants was amazing! The drink cart constantly moving up and down the aisles. The snacks kept coming. The meal was quite delicious. And the pizza right before landing was spot on. I never felt like we weren’t being cared for. The movie selection was great! A loved seeing newer released movies available to watch. I have no complaints besides my seat being given up. I did, however, receive my money back for the unused seat. I will definitely fly American Airlines again for a long haul flight.

Boston to Antigua via Miami. Absolute nightmare. The flight out of Boston delayed due to maintenance issues. This caused us to miss the connector. As a result, we ended up spending the night in Miami, then wasting the whole next day, spending the night in San Juan. The airline really didn’t seem to care, as a matter of fact, one representative said that this was a good experience to learn how to deal with adult disappointment. Being given to $12 meal vouchers over the course of two days in no way made up for missing two days at the all-inclusive luxury resort I had already paid for in Antigua. Not to mention the issues with my traveling companion‘s luggage. She literally only had the clothes on her back for two days. Definitely stay away from American Airlines. I tried calling the corporate office when we first started having issues only to get a voice message recording saying the office was closed and to call back during regular business hours. This call was made at 3 PM Eastern standard time, which means it was probably around one in the afternoon in Texas where the corporate office is listed. It’s no wonder they’re doing such a terrible job if they close the office before noon on Fridays. Not only did American Airlines rob me of basically the better part of three days of vacation, but they also made me never want to ever fly again. I will certainly never flying American Airlines again. Please tell everyone you know.

Frankfurt to Austin. I had a very humbling experience traveling because I ended up missing my flight and was very disappointed. Your team at American Airlines in Frankfurt were unbelievably helpful! I just wanted to take the time to praise AA customer service! Keep up the hard work, it’s much appreciated!

Not Verified |  San Diego to Omaha. I had a 10:40pm flight out of San Diego. The flight attendant was late, and so the flight had to be cancelled (after we were already on the plane). The next flight wasn't until 3pm the following day. As we were being kicked off the flight, they told us they would pay for our hotel for the night (since there were no more flights). I went to my hotel, and booked a flight with Southwest Airlines at 10am the next morning so I could get back when I needed to. After contacting American Airlines, they said since I did not book my replacement flight with them, they wouldn't cover my hotel room. I expect cancellations and delays with airlines, but when their mistake greatly inconveniences their customers, I would expect them to go above and beyond in taking care of them. I will not be flying American Airlines again.

Not Verified |  Lawton to Oklahoma via Birmingham. This is the first time I have flown American Airlines and it will be my last. Every flight that I have gotten on has been delayed for whatever reason and they have no sympathy for anything. They don't try to fix the issue and I hate their horrible custom service. Spirit and Southwest was so much better. I have learned my lesson. The food was horrible and if I could give 0 stars for the seats, food, and service I would. I'm am not a fat person. I am thick and their was no room to sit comfortably and the seat belts were extremely short. A waste of money.

Not Verified | Charlotte to Port of Spain. This review has nothing to do with my flight this review has to do with our planned move to Trinidad. My wife has been working for six months to transport our husky with us. She has only called American Airlines Animal Transport and to her dissatisfaction. She was told originally (6 months ago) to measure the dog from paw to ear and add 3 to 4 inches of space in the carrier. We bought our carrier based on what we were told. (34 inches tall) Only to call back today a month before our flight to verify everything and find out that anything over 28 inches tall cannot go through the cargo hole which she has never been told on any of the conversations she has had with them! Now with our flights booked, we find that our dog cannot go with us on American Airlines because she’s too tall they will not allow it! Dogs are like children. We need to get the correct answers when we call about them. It’s hard enough flying in with the dog to a foreign country that requires so much paperwork and tests to now have to deal with a non-pet friendly airline! It’s bad enough that we had to make our flights so they wouldn’t get booked but can’t make hers until 10 days before we leave and if there’s no room then we have to deal with changing our flights. Now, this! What a disappointment!

I had tickets on an AA flight out of Tampa this morning flight 1369. It was supposed to leave the gate at 7:28 am. I arrived on time more than 2 hours prior to my flight. They start boarding the airplane about 6:45. I hear the crew saying the pilots are not there yet as I board and they don't know what is wrong. Then they announce that the pilots came in late on their flight the night before so they couldn't leave Tampa until 8:45 am. Well many of us on this flight will not make our 1 hour connections. (especially since now I find out I have to go to a different terminal in Dallas). They will not hold our other American flights for us. Now I am going to visit my daughter in Korea. I haven't seen her in awhile. She wants to show me around for 16 days. Well we even have plans with her friends that next night for dinner and on Nov 3rd we have tickets for a formal tea room. Not going to get that money back. $101. Airbnb paid for 2 nights before I get there. Now I pay for that and she didn't need to get there early then. Then AA says they can send me to Dallas on this flight and they will put me up in a hotel overnight. I say why? I live here in Tampa all be it an hour from the airport so I want to go home to my bed. They refused to send me out on any other flight that is leaving today from Tampa from a competitor. And my bags are now going to Dallas and will be stuck there. Plus I had paid ahead of time for a premium seat to have a little more room for the 15 hour flight by a window. Now on the next days flights they can't get me a window seat in premium. They refuse to upgrade me to business or First class for my problems. This is the big blow now. After I deplaned I am at the desk talking to them about getting me on a different flight and the pilots arrive at 8:15. They say it will still be 8:45 before they can take off. One of the pilots tells the crew there that they had come in late the night before from somewhere so FAA regulations say they can't fly until their rest hours are done. Then he rolls his eyes at them and says, " AA knew this last night." So 12 hours before AA could have checked our tickets and tried to reroute us then. There happens to be a 6:00 am flight to Dallas they have. They could have called me to come to the airport early. But nothing done like that. They just play with peoples lives and don't care. Now if will be up to 60 days before they respond to my complaint online. Yah that will help me. In Europe the EU has passed laws that the airlines are fined $700 euros for doing what they did. This is the second time in a year that one of my flights in the US has screwed me. This doesn't happen when I am in Europe. Shame on you AA. Playing with your paying customer. (so now I leave the next day at 6:00 am and hopefully things will be on time. But no window seat in Premium only a middle seat. Wow I paid extra for a better seat but now get the middle one.

Cleveland to Denver. American Airlines is the most disgusting and inhumane airlines I have ever dealt with. We had a puppy being shipped on a Tuesday and the airline canceled it. Then it was rescheduled for Thursday. The puppy was picked up from the breeders home at 6am and didn't get put on his flight and the airline could not justify why. Then he got put on a later flight which then got delayed and delayed and eventually canceled at 1am. Throughout this time, the airline continuously lied to me and had people from call centers in India speaking to me about my puppy. They lied to me saying the puppy was then taken to "Pet Hotels and Villas" which never happened. Puppy Hotels and Villas never had any record of my puppy going there. So where is my puppy? American Airlines will lie to you until you stop calling them or give up. They leave puppies to sit in crates for 12 hours. Who is walking them? Feeding them? Giving them water? Where are the pictures and proof that my puppy is okay? I would never recommend American Airlines unless you want to be mistreated, lied to, and taken advantage of. This has been an ongoing, 4 day battle with them, and I have still not received my puppy. Who is taking care of him? The airlines has no clue.

Not Verified |  Jacksonville to Charlotte. Worst experience ever. I had a flight that left at around 1:30 pm where I would arrive to my destination around 3:30 pm for a wedding I had at 5:39 pm where I was a bridesmaid. I booked my flight at least 6 months before. The day I was headed to the airport they cancelled the flight with no care of my concern to get to a wedding. I couldn’t believe that they not only didn’t care but didn’t help me get another flight. If I can help it I will never fly American Airlines again.
Communication is horrible. They told us to board and the plane wasn’t ready. Won’t let us wait by the gates and the gate area is overcrowded. They have 4 delayed planes at the same gate

Not Verified |  Fayetteville to Denver. This was my first attempt at using American Airlines. Though I’d heard bad things I still wanted to give it a fair shake. Upon purchase of tickets I got an email instructing me to be there 45 min early for check in. When I got to the airport I was told that I should have been there an hour early and my seat had been given away. I said my wife and I were expecting to land in Denver to meet family so I needed to get on another flight. They said the next two were full and there is no refund. I called customer service and they said there is nothing they could do. AA should be ashamed of their poor service.

Dallas Ft Worth to Phoenix. I bought a $300 one way to get to Oak at noon. Dallas delayed cause the weather, we made it to Phoenix 6 minutes after start boarding the gate was close, airplane still there!!! We were line 9 people all together, wait until 7.36 PM To San Francisco not Oakland - no meal voucher, nothing because the weather; they knew we were delayed - why not wait 5 minutes?

Miami to Denver. I booked a flight from Miami to Denver for November 8, 2019. American Airlines changes the flight to a 7am flight. I call and let them know that I can’t make it, so the lady tells me the only other nonstop is 9.30am. So I agreed to that. When I looked up my reservation I realized that she booked me on a 9.30pm flight! I call the customer service line and when I explain the situation I basically get told that because I already made One change (which I had to because of the change the airline made) that I couldn’t make any more changes that I had to buy a whole new plane ticket and get zero credit towards a new one. Then talked down to me because I bought an “economy” ticket and that’s what happens when you buy “economy”. There was zero effort in helping me with this situation when the airline made its changes. Not only does American Airlines nickel and dime you for everything possible to fly in their poor  aircraft, but they like to make you feel like worthless nobodies for booking economy. I will never book through this airline again. We do not deserve to be treated this way. Giving them a 1/10 and that goes to the pilot for getting us economy people to our destination safely.

Not Verified |  I flew as an Unaccompanied Minor from Phoenix to Philadelphia. Although my ticket was bought only 4 days in advance, and the only seats available were Basic Economy Middle Seats (Which is what i got in the end), my boarding group was 9 but Boarding staff were nice and pleasant, and bumped me up to Group 7. The Flight attendants were nice and respectful. The seat was comfortable, food was nice, on-board entertainment above expected. Seemed to have a better experience on American than Southwest.

Managua to Miami. Awful service. I required a wheelchair and requested one to take me from the arrival gate (Miami International Airport) to Baggage Claim. I waited more than 2 hours  to be picked up. It was just awful service. I called customer service (800-433-7300) and was told that somebody would pick me up eventually. To just wait and call back in half an hour. Worst service ever

Lima to Salt Lake City via Dallas. Leaving Lima the plane was late 1.5 hrs. We all get that happens. But the airline made no attempt to make up time in the air over this 8 hour flight. The flight attendant lied about letting us deboard first so we could make our next flights. Every single employee along this journey was not only not helpful they were rude and seemed annoyed with us attempting to make connecting flights. They didnt care in the least. Never ever American again.

Miami to Cancun. The Captain came out into the cabin to  thank us for flying American Airlines. I have not flown American in over a year because I was very disappointed at previous experiences however I have to say that this flight was very pleasant, the ground and in-flight crew were very nice, polite, and friendly. The aircraft looked and felt new, the business class seat was very comfortable and the amenities were good for a 1 hour 40 minute flight. I will fly them again.

St Louis to London Heathrow via Dallas Fort-Worth with American Airlines. The first flight was almost 2 hours late but I had plenty of time for the connection. The Flagship Lounge at DFW was wonderful with extremely helpful personnel, great food. The flight from DFW to LHR was on-time, the seat was extremely comfortable, the food awful: terrible presentation, overcooked, and tasteless. IFE was great but the remote did not work properly. Wifi was impossible to use.

Milan to New York. Hands down worst business class experience I have ever had. Long wait at priority check in for both legs of the flight, poor onboard service, cranky stewardesses. In business class had to pay extra $20 for WiFi! Last but not least, headphones were collected 1 hour prior to landing!

Charlotte to Albany. Why does an American Airlines separate people when one purchases tickets for two people at the same time? Doesn't make sense to me - especially when you're  not allowed to pick your own seating and they have some excuse as to why they have to pick your seat. Very very disappointing and planes late with no giving reason, just gets later and later. I'll never fly this airline again.

Not Verified |  Dallas Fort Worth to Seattle. This airline is Not worth your business. You spend more money with accommodations and car rentals. Better spend your money on a ticket that will get you to your destination without the hassle and rudeness. Customer service agents are rude and look at you like you’re begging them. In less than three months that I’ve travelled with my new job, I’ve been stuck in Seattle because their flights are delayed, leaving me stranded at the airport or having to rent a car to get home. No reimbursement for these additional expenses. So you pay for a round trip flight and you still end up spending more because of their delays. Go spend your money on another airline. American should just give up instead of offering flights that are always running 3-4 hours behind. And, when you show up to the counter, it’s mid night, no one is available to speak with. When my wife traveled with them in July, same thing happened only worse because she had to wait two days before she could get home. Long story short, she ended up paying for her meals, her hotel, used more time off from work, and leaving our pets boarding for more time than originally planned. Horrible, horrible service. Worst airline ever.

Dallas to Honolulu. First and last time I will fly with American! Not only did my plane get delayed over an hour but when we finally did get to fly out we got about 2 hours away and then had to turn around and go all the way back to Dallas. From there our plane got delayed another 2-3 times. Was suppose to land in HI at 12:36P did not land until 9:36!

Not Verified |  Worst experience ever with an airline. Flight was delayed 8 hours. 8! We paid to go hang out at their lounge only to find out the flight was cancelled overall. We were trying to fly from Los Angeles to Tokyo for our honeymoon. Our paid time off days were on the line here. Did they try to make us feel less panicked? Nope! Talked to one of the reps (who turned her ID around so we wouldn’t know her name!) who argued with my husband and I about how she was not at fault. We understand that personally, it was not on her but as other airlines do- probably find us an alternate way to get there? She was grabbing the ticket from my husband and pointing out the obvious about how the flight was cancelled. Ok captain obvious we get it. But what can you do to help us? Maybe work with another airline? Find us other seats? Something? We have been in the terminal since 6am and it is not 3pm and we just found out your plane was cancelled. We are not oblivious to the fact that others are also facing these circumstances but the least we expect is some empathy and reassurance. The lounge member was super rude, condescending, yelling at us and was straight mean. She tried to shoo us away to another airline eventually, but with no reassurance. Take note, this was with an airline 2 terminals away at LAX. Would you feel ok walking all that way if you weren’t 100% sure? She would not tell us if we could board or not and we tried to ask if they would guarantee taking care of us if we did not make the cut and she would not answer. It took another co-worker of hers to butt in and tell us they would. Super unprofessional, does not care for their customers, rude and not sympathetic whatsoever. I don’t care if I’m saving 1,000 bucks.. I will never fly American again! They ruined my honeymoon.

Minneapolis to Erie via Chicago. Well I didn’t even get on the flight because it was delayed 4+ hours and I wouldn’t be able to make my connecting flight. The trip wasn’t worth it at that point since it was a weekend trip and there weren’t any other options that made sense. I stood in line for about 30 minutes and was able to figure out what I needed to know by the time I got up there and the assistant didn’t know that much anyways. Very disappointed. Luckily got refunded but I’m never booking with American Airlines again.

Dallas Ft Worth to Fayetteville. I never had such a worst experience in my life. To start, when i departed from Fayetteville to Vancouver ; my flight from Fayetteville got delayed by 4-5 hours i had to spent half day sitting at airport and missed to catch up with my friend. From Vancouver to Dallas flight no. 392 was so much congested there was almost no leg space. And the passenger at the front seat was extending their seat to back making it more less spacious. I literally had sore feet because of that and Then to my worst experience when flight from dallas airport got cancelled to Fayetteville. They didnt even provide us any accommodation i hadnt slept for more than 24 hours. They should have at least provide us some place to stay even though it was weather still we paid you and please value our time. I missed one exam already and now have two next day.

Hartford to Philadelphia. Horrible - switched my seat at boarding to the last row of the plane. Told me my carry on was too big as it fit into the measurements. Poor customer service - rude - will not travel with them again.

Tampa to Miami. I fly pretty frequent and I have to say today will be the last time I travel American Airlines. I am boarding flight 2179 to Miami, and my boarding pass says my seat will be assigned at gate. The gentleman who appears to be the captain of flight was very kind and says, don’t worry someone will assist your shortly. The gentleman who’s the counter rep doesn’t acknowledge me while logging into the system, talks to some of the crew members around him, and then asked me what do I want - even a good morning. He noticed I was not pleased and says good morning how are you, this is after he’s ignored me the 10 min I’m standing in front and chatting with crew. Not one person said, take care of the customer standing there being ignored. I’m very much a believer In giving all you do your all, or don’t do it all. And I just think the customer service with American is by far the worse I’ve experienced. Employees are just unhappy and miserable and so I just thought I share my feedback flight #2179 seat 17C.

London to Houston. The seats were so tightly together one could not take off a sweater, tie a shoe, pick up a bag from under a seat in front of the place of sitting. I am a regular female US size 12. I could feel the legs and hips on either side of me of the people who were sitting beside me who also not overweight. One cannot moves legs or shift at all. It is a physical danger of sitting in limited confined spaces for hours on end with no ability to move in any way. I recommend not using this airline.  It is better for an airline to charge a bit more and treat the customers physical being safely than put their health at risks. I was astonished to see the seating set up as it was. I simply do not know how men could sit in the seats when I was having such a hard time in doing so.

Not Verified | LaGuardia to Portland. American airlines is incompetent beyond words. No announcement of a gate change. Horribly rude. Acted like it was our fault that we missed the flight when we were there and checked in 90 minutes before flight time. disgusting disrespect of passenger time and needs.

London to Los Angeles. Appalling. American Airlines got me in an hour late to LAX so I missed my connecting flight. Now I have a 12-hour overnight wait and they refuse to give even a cup of coffee let alone a room for the night.

Not Verified | Dallas to Saint Louis. This is the worst airline in the entire world. I will never in my life fly this airline again and furthermore I will tell all friends and family never to fly this airline. I have flown several times and every single time the flight is delayed 4-5-6 hours. It’s stupid and ridiculous. Trash airline that should be shut down.

London to Raleigh Durham. I bought the ticket on Saturday 7/20/19and travelled on Monday 7/22/19. I did not have a chance to book a seat but was given the only one available (I was told) at a high cost because it was booked in an emergency. I am 75 and was a wheelchair passenger. I was reprimanded by a very unpleasant flight attendant for using the toilet in Business. When I boarded I asked a flight attendant if I could use the toilet in Business, which was near to seat 15E Premium Plus, she said “ yes, that is quite acceptable”. I explained to her I have a weak bladder and have to use the toilet more often. Halfway through the flight, on approaching Business toilets, one flight attendant said to me that I should use the toilet at the back. (This was not the flight attendant from whom I had asked permission). I did not reply but I tried the toilets in the center of the aircraft (which were always busy with passengers standing on the aisle waiting) and I tried to use the toilets at the back of the aircraft but it was too much of a distance for me.  When I next approached Business Toilets the same flight attendant (who had told me to use the back toilets) approached me and said in a rude and condescending way that I should be using the toilets at the back. I told her then that I had asked the other flight attendant for permission when I first boarded and was told I could use the toilets in Business. She looked surprised. I reported this to the Department of Transportation, and to AA but the flight attendant denied telling me not to use the toilets in Business. I would like to say that when booking Premium or any upgrade one should find out where the toilets are and if one is allowed to use Business toilets when nearer to Business than the middle or back of aircraft. It is my belief that AA does not consider the toilets locations when selling seats at a higher priced upgrade. I have since found out from the Department of Transportation that elderly and wheelchair passengers can be exempt from the airline rules that a passenger should use the toilets nearest to their seat.

Chicago to State College. Use another airline! I purchased my flight and had strict travel needs. American Airlines told me that they overbooked the flight and I was denied boarding. Consequently, I had to rent a car and drive all night to ensure I could meet my obligations. Evidently, they always overbook the flights with the idea they’ll solicit some to give up their seats. How can they sell seats they don’t have? Never use this airline! They don’t deserve your loyalty or respect since they give none to their customers.

Not Verified |  Charlotte to Denver. This has been by far the worst experience I have had flying to and from my wedding/honeymoon! Also, due to the delays I don't get to spend the night in my honeymoon suite with my wife but instead on the airport floor and lost my hotel $.

Not Verified | Dallas to Columbus. Would not recommend. Pay up and get a reliable trip booked through another airline. Not Verified | Dallas to Tokyo. On Thursday, October 10, I was scheduled to fly to Tokyo on AA175. When I arrived in Dallas they cancelled the flight 10 min before departure. They did not pay for my hotel in Dallas and they left 300 stranded passengers sitting in the airport lobby with only 2 agents rebooking people. Then every agent left and they told people to use the app or call customer service. I will never fly this airline again, and I have zero trust in American. Please avoid this airline as I ended up paying over $200 in hotels out of pocket.

Phoenix to Boston. American's poor maintenance strikes again. 15 minutes before boarding they delay the flight 3 hours. They just realized the plane couldn't fly. Why they only realized it 15 minutes before boarding makes no sense. Then they delayed another 3 hours - 6 in total - because they couldn't find another airplane. To be certain we don't get too hopeful the customer service person said not to get too hopeful that plane will be cleared to fly to Boston. But they did provide 5 sandwiches for over 100 people and keep updating us on the progress of a different flight out of Portland. We are in Phoenix.

New York JFK to Heathrow. Initially we booked on line and did not get our reservation for myself and my son but they were quick to take the payment On getting to the airport we had to go look for the business check in which was away from the gates and the check in counters for all other passengers. On checking in they had lost my sons booking and his seat he booked was given away and they could not allocate a seat we had to go to the lounge. Crazy they then haul the luggage back to the economy check in while we walk back the same way to go through customs. Customs are rude and obnoxious and do nothing the security search backs up and no one will pick up a tray and tell customers to pack trays. In the lounge No surprise they could do nothing and said we should go to the gate. Well the rudest woman was at the gate that snarled and after standing around for some time allocated a seat that was not a window seat as requested. We fly frequently and America airline ground staff must be the laziest and most obnoxious people around. We will never fly American Airlines again.

Houston to Dallas to Lubbock. Our flight with American Airlines was a disaster from the beginning. Charged $60 to book by phone with an agent, flights were late, airplane dirty, and in the Lubbock airport the gate number was never published on the flight boards and we almost missed our flight because we didn’t know which gate. When I mentioned this to the attendant at the desk, she acted as if she couldn’t have cared less - she didn’t ask me to explain she just acted dumb and confused.

Another poor experience with AAL: again, they refused to check my suitcase through to my final destination under the pretext of "safety:" I do not understand how having two separate tickets endangers safety when more than 700 airlines worldwide regularly interline baggage among themselves. It's really a question of "laziness." Why did we buy two separate tickets? It's a well-known travel agent cost saving measure and we save £900 by doing so. (It was colossally inconvenient to pass through immigration, collect our suitcases, take the train to T5, recheck suitcases, go through immigration & security again.) I flew on Alaska last month to Fort Lauderdale and they without question transferred my suitcase to Delta for the continuing trip to South America. Is American Airlines asserting that Alaska and Delta are unsafe carriers? I purchased a Lufthansa ticket last year from Chicago to Münster with a LH compensation voucher and so the connecting flight to it on United had to be issued separately. Are both United and Lufthansa unsafe operations according to American Airlines? But American regularly disservices the flying public. In August I was denied entry into the Admirals' Club at Roissy because their boarding pass reader wouldn't read my boarding pass (somehow that was MY fault). At my connexion city (London) they simply reissued the boarding pass so that their reader would admit me. But since when are human beings the tools of the computers? When their management doesn't allow them to make reasonable common sense decisions! In August I was charge 50€ for a suitcase to check even though I was Platinum elite and am allowed two suitcases complimentary. The pretext? The ticket was issued by Finnair. I am suing them now and have learnt that their defence will be that I used my Alaska FF account. I only changed from my AA account after they charged me the fee: who wants to patronised a company that rips off their best customers? They are dishonest and deceptive and should be sanctioned and regulated fully by the DOT. I must say I was surprised on board: everyone was professional and courteous - quite a surprise from American Air Lines where most stewardess have chips on their shoulders and check their bid sheets in the galley when they should be working.

Not Verified |  Vancouver to Phoenix. The flight was on-time leaving and arriving. The check in process took too long and was incomplete. Only one service agent was dealing with check ins with a queue that had a family with infants and 3 other service agents dealing with almost no one at the service kiosk. This meant longer wait for the family with infants. After checking in there was no plastic bags offered for the car seats and strollers that had to be checked in. This meant we had to go back to the check in counter after getting told by YVR oversize baggage people that the plastic bags were only available at at the check in counters. By the time we went to the check in counter the counters were not manned by anyone. We however found an American airline service agent at the kiosk area and asked for the plastic bags. There were no plastic bags available as cabinets were locked so the agent had to ask for the bags from Alaskan airlines. The service by flight was very bad. There was no help offered to adults with infants on boarding and during the flight when it was needed most. When flight attendant was asked to assist to put milk in the coffee she was not happy and showed that she was so and warned me condescendingly about scalding the baby with hot coffee - all the rudeness was unnecessary.

Edinburgh to Philadelphia. We decided to Supposedly upgrade our flights on our vacation to Scotland, so we paid several thousand dollars to upgrade our seats for an enjoyable experience. What a huge, enormous mistake! We had one good flight out of six flights back-and-forth to Scotland. The only decent flight was between Phoenix and Edinburgh on a 777–200. Nice business class Seats, good service and average food. After that it all went downhill! I read reviews previous to leaving and was a little nervous about what to expect. I don’t normally listen to negative reviews completely but I should have! These were the worst seats I’ve ever experienced! The planes were old and dirty. The food was barely edible and the seating was extremely bad. I basically paid thousands of dollars to have hard seats that had a little bit more legroom and width. The last flight was over five hours and was the most uncomfortable flight of all! When I got on the third flight of the day and saw how bad the interior of the plane looked and how cramped it was it made me ill. My husband was sick and had to sit straight up sleeping the whole time! He tried to treat me to nice experience and instead we were angry all day about how much money we wasted! We had TV screens in “one” out of six planes. Even the business class had no screens even on the back of the seats. Almost all airlines have screens on the back of the seats even in economy. I had to “pay extra” for Wi-Fi and to download the American Airlines app to attempt to fill in the time when I was unable to sleep. They don’t tell you this until you get on the plane and then you have to rush to download the app and less you’ll have nothing the whole entire flight! Never again will we pay American Airlines for flights to anywhere within the US or around the world. The only positive comment is for the staff on these planes. With people complaining and uncomfortable they maintained their gracious composure. Hugely disappointed! Embarrassed for the people who have to work for that airline!

Shreveport to Dallas. This flight was delayed because the Maintenance inspector did not do his job the night before the 6:45AM flight as he was scheduled and the flight crew was told he was doing. We completely boarded on time just to be told it would be at least an hour and ended up being 2 hours delayed when maintenance showed up for work routinely and did their inspection that was scheduled to be done the night before. This is the 5th flight of the last 6 in 3 months on AA that has been delayed for maintenance reasons. These excuses are unacceptable, unprofessional, and occur because there are no consequences for poor service. This disservice inconveniences thousands of people harms lives (I am a surgeon that AA has caused multiple people in pain to miss or delay their surgery with plenty of prep time for things to go wrong), has people missing important family events, and potentially loses businesses millions in transactions. The airlines should be held responsible financially for the damage they cause others from poor leadership and management.

Not Verified |  Savannah to Las Vegas. Our flight got canceled and we were put on standby. We sat in the first airport for 13 hours then we changed planes two more times total time 28 hours. Rapid City to Phoenix. On Tuesday night our flight was canceled due to plane problems. Which can be understandable. What I do finally arrive for my flight they say it is now going to be another four hours late even though there was one taken off earlier which no one had contacted me or let me have that option. As a service member seeing his family for the first time in 8 months and only having the weekend to spend with them along as with my girlfriend I was bringing with me, I was very disappointed. I am extremely disappointed by American Airlines. They are normally my airline of choice and I have put many of miles into them. That will no longer be the case. I had a connecting flight canceled due to “weather” even though there was a flight going out an hour later? Since it was due to weather we were offered no accommodations. When asked about this they said it was the pilots choice to delay or cancel ... since a flight went out an hour later I’d say that wasn’t due to weather but to crew.... ok but it gets better. We were put on standby on that late flight when we showed up somehow I was five on the list and my husband was 32? So I got called yet was told nothing could be done to get my husband on as well .. even though after I was called a group of four was called together then two more singles. When I asked the customer service desk about this I was told it was the computer. So I asked how the group of four managed to get out on the list together and they said luck of pushing the enter button .. what a joke... then was told since I also had booked an economy ticket it pretty much didn’t look good for me anyway from the beginning so that’s great to know that’s how this airline feels. Such a shame too because they have some great people we have encountered who work as attendant for this airline that this has now given them such a bad name in my book. Long story short I thought this was a great airline and now I have been completely proven wrong and they could care less.

Not Verified |  
Our flight from Quito to Miami on Friday October 4, 2019 (LATAM Airlines flight 6303) was cancelled by American with no reason given. We were offered a flight out on the following Sunday. Dallas to Bogota via San Francisco. None of the second row seats in the business cabin reclined.  There was a partition right behind the second row so there was no way to recline the seats. You are paying a bunch of money and you can't even stretch your legs.

Not Verified |  Pittsburgh to Phoenix. Terribly dissatisfied about the manner in which they regard services for the handicapped. Upon arrival to our destination back home to Phoenix there were no attendants with a wheelchair for not just my wife, but for other handicapped passengers. My wife hobbled the best she could as she held onto the sides of the ramp leading from the plane to the gate. I had both of our carry on suitcases to manage with as well as my backpack and my wife's purse. When we got to the gate to inquire about the wheelchair, the attendants at the gate said they did not know why no one showed up with wheelchairs and had been calling down to the area where the AA wheelchairs are stationed to no avail. Some attendant who was walking around upset and furious scanned my wife's boarding pass and the other handicapped passengers, asking us to be patient and someone would be arriving shortly. Well, after we all complained again, 15 minutes later 2 people showed up but we all could tell they were not sure what they were supposed to do or where they were supposed to go (almost like they were new hires and that was their first day). We had no checked luggage so all we needed to do was to be taken straight to the parking garage to the valet area. My wife, who suffers from (peripheral artery disease) was in great discomfort from the whole ordeal and was in tears. I felt helpless, no one knew why the wheelchairs were not showing up, total mismanagement and disregard for handicapped travelers.

Los Angeles to Miami. By far one of the worse Airlines in the US. The Customer service reps are rude and give you constant attitude. Will cancel my credit card with American and never fly with you guys again.

Charlotte to Providence. Missed our flight by 10 minutes due to car trouble. The airline worked with me to schedule us on the next available flight at no extra charge. They were kind and courteous which I greatly appreciated.

Philadelphia to Seattle. I will never fly American again. My husband and I bought our tickets together do you think we are sitting together definitely not because that would only be smart. Delayed 3 times for morning flight that caused me to miss boarding my connecting flight that was the next gate over, watched my suitcase get put on the plane though. Dallas to Lafayette. Absolute worst customer care of any airline I fly. I fly 3 times a week. They can't control weather so flights get canceled. Salt Lake City to Dallas. The weakest airline I have ever taken. Not Verified |  Lubbock to Charlotte. Going to visit my sister and my usual airline does not fly directly to her home town so grabbed a flight with American Airlines and boy did I learn a lesson. For 6 flights the closest we sat to each other was two rows apart. You can call me cheap but sorry that I paid for a plane ticket assuming things then refused to pay $50 a ticket extra during check in to try to get seats together.

Atlanta to Dallas. American Airlines runs out of overhead baggage space by the boarding of group 4 on any full flight. It increases boarding times and departure time. At this point after instituting baggage fees, they should have enough historical data to implement proactive change to improve onboard baggage policies. Which leads to the 2 on-plane bags policy, which disproportionately impacts women business travelers. As a female traveler, this negatively impacts the needs of female travelers. A male just boarded with a laptop bag, roll-on bag, and shopping bag. A female was stopped and required to “combine down” for a smaller cross-body bag with her laptop, and roll-on bag. Zero-tolerance or full enforcement should apply.

I was flying to Jacksonville North Carolina. I accidentally purchased tickets to Jacksonville Florida. Notice the different states. Yes I know this is my fault however I am human and it was an accident. The first leg of my journey was with Delta. When we arrived in Atlanta and realized we were headed to Florida accidentally Delta took care of us and sent us to Jacksonville North Carolina as I had originally planned. When I called and attempted to change my American Airlines ticket they refused. They refused to make an exception. Very poor customer service and they did not care. They refused to even entertain switching the ticket. I was willing to pay a fee to change it.

Indianapolis to Phoenix. I will never fly on American Airlines again. Their customer service is the absolute worst I have ever encountered and there is no way to talk with anyone on the phone. Despite the fact that there is a "customer service" telephone number listed, I have called it four times and each time I waited over 30 minutes to be connected to discuss my issues only to be told "this is reservations and we are a totally different department, if you want customer service you can send an email, that is the only way to contact them." On one of these occasions (after waiting 40 minutes, I couldn't understand the person when they said their name. I asked him to repeat it, still didn't understand him so I spelled what I though he was saying and he hung up on me! This forced me to call back again and wait ANOTHER 40 minutes. In the end I emailed them and someone finally called me back but when I asked to speak to their supervisor because I was not happy with the resolution or her ability to explain the situation (more about this later) she stated "our supervisors don't speak to customers". The whole issue was a mechanical problem that caused me and the two people I was traveling with to miss our connection and be delayed an entire day (I understand problems happen and that is not the issue) my two traveling companions filed claims for a refund as did I. they both received vouchers for another flight but I did not. When the customer service agent (who I cannot call on the phone) called me she explained that because I have an AAdvantage Account they were giving me 10,000 miles or I could also receive a voucher. So I asked "what is the value of the 10,000 miles versus the $175 voucher my companions received?" She said she couldn't tell me but I could call the AAdvantage program and ask them and I said "but if I do that how will I reach you again to tell you which I want?" She answered that I could submit another email request (which requires phone number, email, flight number and record locator to all be submitted again and wait for them to call me. I told her how ridiculous this was and this is when I asked for the supervisor. In the end I told her to just give me the miles but it didn't really matter because I will never fly American Airlines again.

Worst airline customer service. They simply don’t care! Delayed by 5 hours. Happens, right! But such a lack of communication the entire time. Every single employee seemed annoyed at the questions. Then they boarded us and we sat on the tarmac for another hour! Weak apologies and planning! I will take 2 segments with another airline to avoid American in the future. And I travel for business 3 weeks a month.

Dallas to Reno. How does a standby ticket get a better seat than a paid ticket and is loaded in group 3 with a carry on bag instead of 9 made to check the carry on like I had to? I had to wait until five minutes before boarding to getting my seat assignment when a standby person got a seat assignment 10 mins before I did. The counter agent told me it is a full flight and had to check my bag. When we were loaded, there were several empty seats, so much for the full flight. Now I have to wait in baggage claim when I get to Reno. I can see why American Airlines has such low reviews. Whether I buy a first-class or economy one I should be treated as a paying seat ticket price customer. I'm very disappointed with the service.

Tampa to Miami. This was probably the best 36-minute flight ever. The plane felt and looked brand new, legroom was great, the seat was very comfortable, the large entertainment screen was unexpected but very much appreciated, they gave me a drink and a snack. The crew at the counter and the gate were very friendly, I wish I could say the same for the first-class flight attendant that never smiled at all however was efficient in his duties. Maybe he had a rough morning. Over all, Good job AA!

New York to Chicago. I was worried after booking American for the first time in a decade after reading a lot of poor reviews, but they offered good prices and itineraries for flights from JFK to ORD. However, I felt compelled to leave a review based on my pleasant experience that completely exceeded expectations. There were no bells or whistles to this flight, but the small fee to sit in Main Cabin Extra was well worth it, as I am 5'4 and could stretch my legs out almost completely without hitting the seat ahead. The cabin staff was friendly, pilots upbeat, and the aircraft was actually pretty modern and clean. Bad things I expected based on popular reviews of American Airlines but did not experience: - outdated aircraft interior - delays & cancellations - gate changes - unfriendly crew - tight pitch Things that could be improved: - cheesy smell of the breakfast offered to first-class passengers permeated the cabin and was quite nauseating - had to explicitly ask for the alcohol perks for Main Cabin Extra passengers and wasn't originally offered - rougher takeoffs and landings than any other airline I've flown (felt very rushed on both actually) - no inflight entertainment if you don't have the app on your phone Overall, this was a good flight at a great price point and I would definitely fly American Airlines again for short-hauls.

Not Verified |  Las Vegas to Dallas. Two hour delay sitting on the plane due to air not working. Staff is rude and not helpful. They keep telling us 15 more minutes and we are clearly nowhere close to departure. There have been 7 delays since I have been sitting here. The air is still not working, all the passengers are sweating, and very uncomfortable. I have never had a more horrible flight experience in my life. I will never fly this airline again.

Not Verified |  Tampa to Wilkes Barre with American Airlines. This airline takes no accountability for errors that occur on their end. A death in my family occurred and a change of flight had to be made. I called over 24 hours before the flight was scheduled for and paid $32.00 to reschedule my flight for the next day. I was advised to use the same flight locator/confirmation code and check into my flight and when I attempted to was met with a completely useless ticket representative with no record on the part of American Airlines and was advised my only option was to purchase another $285 ticket! Though I had credit card receipts showing we had paid to change the flight. Worst experience I’ve ever had flying. As a frequent flyer with family across multiple states, myself and family will never fly American Airlines again and recommend anyone considering a trip to do the same!

Not Verified |  Second time flying American Airlines and it's completely screwed up again. Two hour delay due to plane being in hanger and no one to bringing it over. Missed first flight. Also missed second flight out of Charlotte due to delay. Now sitting in airport for another seven hours getting into Erie at 10.20 Monday evening. Keep in mind we left Fresno at 11.30 pm Sunday night. They changed our flights from Dallas to Charlotte and we didn't want to sit in airport for seven hours so we changed flights for a fee and here we are sitting on Charlotte NC for seven hours. Worst airline ever. They gave us free flights for next year because in July they cancelled our flight for no reason and I don't even want to use them because the airlines are such a mess. They ruin the end of every great vacation and we're sick of it. The incompetence of this airline is beyond comprehension.

Not Verified |  Phoenix to Spokane. It is very sad that a company as pathetic as American Airlines can be up and running still with their consistent inability to satisfy even the simplest of needs (including landing within 2 hours of your scheduled time) on an overpriced ticket. I must give props to the staff however because despite the horrible system they still manage to impress with their astonishing amount of rudeness and lack of basic customer service skills.

Not Verified | Washington to Pensacola. We were exhausted after a stay in DC and had to fly back to Pensacola on a 7:30p flight as we have done many times. My husband and I recently married and upon entering the plane jokingly asked, "we're newlyweds can we sit in first class?" The flight attendant was genuinely so kind and congratulated us (along with her fellow flight attendant. That was one of the most fabulous flights we've had in a while. Not just because we were able to fly first class (as we've flown several times), but the flight attendants dispositions and the "on-time", early arrival and smooth flight itself was all first class! In a time where posting negative reviews (myself included) are everywhere, I just wanted to take a minute and thank the flight attendants for her exemplary, genuinely positive and caring attitude she displayed to myself, my husband and others on that flight.

I normally fly Southwest but they don’t fly into Burlington, VT so we bought tickets for a vacation through American Airlines. Overall, the experience left a lot to be desired. We had one layover both ways. Our first layover was in Chicago where we experienced a 4hr delay. The AA employees told the waiting passengers that two crew members were delayed and they were on their way. Every 15-30min, I would receive a text stating the flight had been delayed another 30min but very little communication from the counter and absolutely no apologies. Once aboard the plane, we were told by the pilot that due to another plane delay AA had to get new pilots and that was the reason for the delay. After sitting for several minutes, the pilot came back on to say that due to the delay, the flight pattern had been cancelled. So, there we sat in a stuffy, small airplane for another hour. Do you suppose the powers at be might have known this would happen and allow passengers to wait in the comfort of the airport at least. I am guessing they needed to get the plane off the loading gate. While sitting on the tarmac, I wrote an email to AA Customer Service in the hopes they would extend an olive branch of service recovery on our return flights (a free drink ticket, upgraded seats, maybe earlier boarding). I am in the service industry as well and know how much it means to offer a small gesture as an apology when things go wrong. No one is perfect after all. Someone did email me back, but offered vouchers for my next flight. I responded saying that I was really hoping for something on my return flight since I wasn’t sure I would be flying AA again. The staff member did respond stating that she was sorry I wasn’t happy with what was offered, but AA could not be offering anything else. So AA would rather coerce me into flying with them again with two $50 vouchers instead of providing some service recovery upfront via a couple free drinks or an upgraded boarding status which would have gone a lot further. It is no wonder this airlines falls below Southwest, Delta, JetBlue and others in customer satisfaction. I won’t fly with American again as I do not believe they truly value their customers. I will end by saying the AA counter staff at the Burlington Airport were lovely and very friendly. But the staff at Chicago O’Hare and Philadelphia seem to dislike their jobs or the customers they are there to serve. Or maybe the employees are treated like the customers with little regard to showing care and compassion.

Abhorrent customer service. Delayed out of Knoxville for no apparent reason. Watched in Charlotte airport for 15 minutes before gangway detached from airplane that was supposed to go to Pittsburgh. Forced to stay in Charlotte but no compensation made for hotel or transportation citing “policy”. Rude, uncaring customer assistance. Manager not empowered to address anything and was uncaring and obstinate. Similar experience same evening for my wife but she was flying Delta - they took care of their customer. Simply put don't fly American Airlines.

Not Verified | I was supposed to fly from Toronto to New York today, and then to Boston. After getting on the plane and sitting on the runway, we were told there was an issue with the plane. These things happen, there is no point in freaking out. As the day progressed I became more and more disappointed with American Airlines staff. They rudely told me I was going to have to go to Chicago to get to Boston. As I boarded my plane to Chicago, I was harassed for having a large carry-on bag and not having a proper ticket yet (because the airline didn't give me one after switching me). I was told to give my carry-on bag over to them. I don't have any issues with the logic of needing space in the cabin, but the rude way the staff demanded it was shameful. I was lied to and told that I could get it back in Chicago When I arrived in Chicago, I asked where I could get my carry-on bag. A different staff member rudely told me I will get it in Boston. When I tried to explain that there was some sort of miscommunication, I was told that I am just a poor listener. Finally, It was time to go to Boston, I was called to the stand to get a seat number, when I went up I was asked in a very aggressive voice "why are you up here right now". I explained that I was called and she said: "I did not call anyone, sit down". The other employee had to intervene and remind the lady that she had called me. I really am never someone to complain or to write negative reviews. I was just so blown away by how poorly American Airlines handled everything today that I felt something needed to be said.

Not Verified | Myrtle Beach to Appleton. Flight was suppose to leave at 5:45 am we arrived at the airport at 5:07 which was empty at the moment. Checking in our bags we were told the fight was booked and ready for take off. Said we came too late. So after waiting for the next flight and having a layover of 6 hrs in Chicago. We are told it was our fault for not being there at least 30 min early. Simple math 5:07 to 5:45 is 38 minutes. Flight left with 6 open seats. Never using American Airlines again. Customer service was rude and short. Will be delta from here on out

On my flight from Dallas to Las Vegas (3 Sep), I accidentally left my small pocket Bible in the seatback pocket. I realized it the next day and when I returned to the airport for my flight home, I checked Lost & Found to no avail. At that point, I figured it was gone. I have had that Bible with me twice in Afghanistan and many other places and was sorry to lose it. But when I got to my office the following week, I had a phone message from an American Airlines employee who had found my Bible in Buffalo, NY, and had managed to track me down. She kindly offered to mail it back to me and I received it a few days later, as good as new. She truly went the extra mile for me which I so greatly appreciated and will long remember.

I been flying all my life, I respect and understand that things just happen. Not this case with the most awful and abusive use of the word American.
