There is nothing American about how this airline purposely abuses the power when selling tickets for flights that obviously can’t provide. Once you are in the air on one of their flights you are definitely going to have your connecting flight canceled. It has happened to me of a family member every month the last four months when one of us have taken a flight. The pattern exists. Only to add injury to insult the will give you a $12 food voucher (airport food prices) as if that will remedy the abuse. There has to be a way to hold them accountable to the point to where they respect and show remorse when it comes the consumer. Nevertheless I will never fly with them again. You can’t put a price on time and disrespect. They don’t have planes, they sell flights they can not honor and the staff has to be well aware.

Not Verified | St Louis to Chicago. American Airlines is the worst. They made half the flight check their carry-ons when there was plenty of room for more bags. The plane was trashed. When the pilot came on to make announcements it they made loud screeching noises the entire time. Did they stop and try to fix that? You guessed it. No. This airline clearly gives zero cares about their customers. Fly anyone but American. There are always multiple issues with AA!
Lihue to Los Angeles. Our flight was delayed overnight. We didn't get any reimbursement for stay, food, transportation, etc. American Airlines just ignored us. I would never use this airline again!

I booked in advance a flight with 1 stop from Newark to Tulsa. I needed to change some dates at considerable expense.Through Travelocity, the airline issued a $174 credit (only valid from one year of booking). I wanted to book another flight 12 days later than the expiration date. Even though we did not take our Tulsa flight until April of 2019, the airline said I could not redeem my credit in Feb. 2020 because my booking was in earlier Feb. of 2019. Travelocity tried to advocate for us and I called American Airlines myself. I spoke with Dane, and she stated the airline would not extend my credit. This is the price you pay for booking a flight early! I plan to retire in 2 years and do a lot of traveling, but you can bet I will never book with American Airlines!

Dallas to Madison. What a circus! The flight was delayed from 10:30 am until now - still sitting in the airport at 4:45 pm and they are “hoping” our new plane will be authorized to fly by 5:30. These clowns had us on the plane and partially towed to the runway when one bolt stripped on the part that hooks to the tow vehicle. We eventually deplaned and then waited at least two hours for maintenance to look at the stripped bolt. Fast forward to now and apparently, they don’t have any bolts on hand so they are supposedly bringing us a new plane, at a new gate, but we have yet to see it. Oh, and to add insult to injury, they gave us all a $12 meal voucher for our troubles. That works out to around $2 per hour for our wasted time. Thanks, American! I will be sure to never fly with you again. Oh, let me add that in the short time I was actually on the plane, I looked around to see if it was a full flight (which they always are) as I was smashed between two large dudes. I noticed the two female flight attendants sitting in the back row which was completely empty, save for themselves. I caught the eye of one and mouthed “are those seats open” which they obviously were. She looked at me, glanced at the open seats and looked back and shook her head “nope”! Thanks! I wouldn’t want to intrude on your private flight attendant conversation. Please enjoy the six seats the two of you are occupying.

Seattle to Paris via Dallas. First and last time we ever fly American Airlines. Both flights to and from our destination were delayed. The first flight was delayed “due to weather”, which is ridiculous because the weather was actually fine, the bad weather happened the day before. When we discovered this we told it to the employees and they said they were still catching up, though ALL other airlines were already flying on time. Because of “bad weather,” AA stated they were not responsible for any incurred expenses to us from the delay. We had to stay overnight in Dallas, had to pay for our own hotel, got no reimbursement or even a small upgrade on our next flight. Not even offering us a complimentary drink or anything. Customer service is horrible. On the flight back, there was also a delay and this time NO explanation was offered but they rerouted us which added a 5 hr layover and a longer connecting flight. Overall we lost a whole day on our already short trip to Europe, lost hundreds of dollars from having to pay for a hotel in Dallas and missing a day in our prepaid accommodation in Europe. The trip was exhausting and stressful. Save yourselves and do not fly American Airlines.

Bangor to Albany via Philadelphia. I arrived at Gate 4 at Bangor ME to depart for Philly at 5:10 where I was greeted by 2 people, a female standing at the counter, and a tall gentleman, who had both seen me scurrying toward them after a delay at security in this small airport. When I arrived at the counter the man moved to the open doorway/tunnel to the plane and stated "you need to stay back" . I am 58 years of age, 5'5", 108 pounds. He was very tall and sounded quite aggressive. The female then stated that I would not be permitted to board. I asked her why and she stated "You had to be here at 5:10". I looked at my phone and stated "it is 5:10 (I show her my phone) and I checked in online as well. She then stated "NO, it's 5:11, I have been watching my clock. The gate to the plane was still open, the tunnel in place, and the plane had not left the ground. I explained that I am a caregiver to my ill husband and this is simply not possible as I was checked in online and had arrived within the time limit. She stated, and I quote "no, and my boss was here to see it" (my 5:11 am arrival, she watched her clock!) I was on stand-by and able to leave Bangor at 5:45 a.m. but what ensued, a nightmare. Redirected from Wash/DC to Philly/PA and from Philly to Alb, NY., no flight until 3:30 p.m.I sobbed at the counter, and in panic, searched for an earlier flight from my phone only to find that I could buy a seat from this very same airline on an 11:30 instead of 3:00 p.m. I returned, again went through security, and found someone to help me change the ticket to the 11:30. What happened with American Airlines at Bangor, ME International Airport was despicable. They held me up at the counter waiting for the clock to strike 5:11, which, I surmise, is due to having given my seat away. It created a day of absolute hell for me and my family. Thanks American.

Absolutely horrible service! Many delays and the flight attendants were too busy talking about the airline and how they where they paid and the flight they were scheduled for sucked. This was my second time flying with them as this happened many years ago also. Due to needing a quick flight for a medical emergency and the time that had past since I last flew with them, I figured I’d give them another try - worst mistake I made, and never again!

Charlotte to Cleveland. Boarded at 5:10 PM; it is now 6:55pm. Departure time has changed 4 times; we are told the pilots were not scheduled: and now the paperwork is not legal. Still sitting and waiting.

Not Verified | Greensboro to Wichita. Terrible, absolutely horrible! My brother is a 30-year pilot with this Airlines. That is why I decided to go with it. I have flown with Delta, United even TWA back in the old days and Braniff Airlines. I have never seen an airline change their flight status so many times. Not only did they cancel a flight on me. But they continued to screw around and caused me a great deal of hardship over it was supposed to be just a simple flight from Greensboro to Wichita. They also have cost me over 27 hours due to the canceled flight in Wichita last night. I have been waiting to go back home now 27 hours to Greensboro. I could have taken an Amtrak train and gotten there quicker. My wife it's a first-time flyer. She is totally bombed with flying now! Rightfully so American Airlines really jerking people around. They also owe me two days parking now that I left my car at the airport - that's another $16 plus the $ 40 I spent on food unnecessarily while waiting on my flights. Do yourself a favor - drive or take Amtrak.

Not Verified | Austin to Charleston via Charlotte. Worst airline I have ever seen. Travel time 40 mins and they took 1 hour to find the gate. After going on to the runway they mentioned 2 checkups no been done and after an hour they said one engine is not working. Overall worst experience. Don’t ever fly with American Airlines

Charlotte to Dallas. I was boarding the plane and the lady in the front told me I needed to make sure my luggage fit. So I did that. Of course it dint because no luggage fits on that thing. So they told me they had to take my bag I said it fit on the last plane and that was a small plane so I asked the lady is it a small plane? She said it was - that was a lie it was a big plane which I knew so I said well I want to try it. I then continued to argue with the person who said that since they had already printed out a ticket for my luggage that it had to go (that’s not my problem) so then i was made to leave my luggage. My question now is why does American make me have to check my luggage when all the other ones where my same size and they just don’t have enough head bin space at the top to allow more bags so of course instead of telling you that they would rather lie and come up with an excuse as to why I can’t bring my luggage in.

Not Verified |  American is by far the worst airline I have ever flown. First $30 to check 1 bag. Then I paid a total of $66 dollars to upgrade my seats. Then the airplane is here on time at 2.30pm in Tampa but the crew is not. So I will miss my connecting in Dallas because now they won't leave for another 2 hrs. So now leaving for Philly but not for another 4 hrs. So flight doesnt leave Philly until 9pm, should arrive into Phoenix now at 11.30pm. Just a complete poor show and guess what, on both flights I'm in the very back in the middle. They won't refund for money spent already to upgrade seats. This will be the last time this airline screws me.

Not Verified |  Tampa to Charlotte via Pittsburgh with American Airlines. Flight has been delayed 9 times (so far). We've had to change our connecting flight twice which has put us back 5 hours. No apology or explanation and the staff is rude. They dont care about customers. We are currently still stuck at the airport. I will never fly American Airlines again.

Not Verified | Dallas to Louisville. Worst airline company for wanting to make it anywhere on time. They have delayed both flights, waited 5 mins before flight was to board to let anyone know and then say it’s a 2hr delay. How can you not know something that big of a delay ahead of time? I have none of my luggage because the last flight was full so I had to check it in. Now I’m without
Charlotte to Birmingham. Delayed, delayed, delayed. Hate this airline. Will never use them ever again. They have no scheduling management and can not keep a simple flight schedule on time.

Not Verified |  Amarillo to Dallas. American is terrible. Two (2) flights delayed 2+ hours each; a short flight on Monday and return flight on Wednesday. Both were delayed due to maintenance issues. Thankfully, I had text alerts on the first flight since no one was at the counter to ask what was going on, just kept being pushed back and back and back via text message. There are only 6 gates at the entire airport so if I wanted to talk to an American Airlines employee, I would have to leave gate area to front desks and check back in through security. Luckily, I wasn't needing to make a connecting flight. A 55 minute flight turned into an almost 5 hour debacle. American makes driving to Dallas a viable option rather than flying with them. I will check every other carrier before I ever book with American again.

Portland to Charlotte. American kept passengers on the plane for two hours while they “looked” for a mechanic to check one of the struts. Passengers were told multiple stories about what was going on, each time delaying us further from making other flying arrangements. Flight personnel were busy on their phones not attending to passengers or offering water or any accommodation. Once we were told to change plans at 12:10am, we had limited communication with the flight attendants. At about 2:30am we hit the worst turbulence I have ever encountered- obviously this is not the airline’s doing, but when I started shivering and became ill I went to the back of the plane and asked an attendant (who was busy watching a movie on their iPad) for a blanket and a bag because I thought I might become sick. She told me that blankets were reserved for first class customers and that she needed the blanket on her lap because it was cold at the back of the plane. She then looked for a bag and handed me a warm bottle of water. We finally arrived in Charlotte, NC but those of us who had connecting flights had zero support from staff to communicate with the other airlines or even their own flights. I have found American to be one of the worst airlines I have ever flown. They should be ashamed.

Madrid to Boston. We were transferred to this airline after BA had a strike. The service and flight were fabulous. Food and drink very very good. But what really stood out was the lovely crew attendants, the best ever.

This is the worst airline I've ever flown. Time and time again, I miss my connecting flights because every single flight is always delayed. As a broke college student, I had a job interview scheduled for the day after I fly in, missed my connection by 8 minutes while sprinting through the airport because it took the plane 26 minutes to connect to the terminal after the initial flight was delayed. There's a real potential that I won't get this full-time job because American Airlines is the absolute worst. Thanks for potentially putting my future at jeopardy!

Tucson to Honolulu via Phoenix. Timeline of events: On August 22, 2019, I left TUS for PHX at 1146a. At 1025a, received an AA text message advising my 225p PHX/HNL departure was on time. At 1230p, received another AA text message advising my 225p PHX/HNL departure was on time. At 103p, received an AA text message that my 225p departure was delayed to 254p. Approximately 130p, we were told by the PHX gate agent that our flight was delayed - a bit overdue since we already knew this from our text messages. She anticipated the delay being about an hour. At 328p, received an AA text message that the HNL flight was delayed until 425p. At 344p, received an AA text message that the HNL flight was delayed until 425p. At 427p, received an AA text message that the HNL flight was delayed until 530p. At 5p, received an AA text message that the HNL flight was delayed until 6p. This was only the second time we heard from when the gate agent advised this was a mechanical delay and it would be a further delay. They were getting a part for the plane. At 532p, received an AA text message that the HNL flight was delayed until 630p. At 543p, received an AA text message that the HNL flight was delayed until 830p. At 558p received an AA text message that there was a gate change for our HNL flight. At 637p, received an AA text message that the HNL flight was delayed until 9p. At 640p, received an AA text message that there was another gate change for our HNL flight. At 735p, received an AA text message that the HNL flight was delayed until 931p. At 751p, received an AA text message that the HNL flight was cancelled! At 755p, the gate agent announced the flight was cancelled and advised us to go to the Customer Service counter and handed us a “Let’s get you back on track” card. After standing in line, with Customer Service, I was given two vouchers one $12 food voucher and one hotel voucher, for the Hampton Inn. They also rebooked me on a Hawaiian Air flight, leaving the next morning, August 23, at 8a. The events of August 22 certainly could have been handled better. We barely heard from a person on all these delays but text messages were almost every 30 minutes, but no updates from AA employees. When I asked (as well as other travelers on the same flight) the gate agents for updates, they just said they knew nothing. I tried to use my “meal” voucher twice, with no luck! Both McDonalds and coffee kiosk told me they did not take the meal voucher, so this went unused. When I called my hotel in HNL, they were able to hold my reservation, but I would have to still pay for Thursday evening. After over 9 hours in the PHX airport, I finally just went to the hotel, grabbed a bag of chips and fell asleep. When I asked American Airline to reimburse me for my missed night in Hawaii, which I had to still pay for, they advised they were 'fair and reasonable' in providing the hotel accommodations in Phoenix and then got me to Hawaii the next day. Definitely no longer 'something special in the air'!

Not Verified |  Charlotte to Lexington. First of all when my flight landed in Charlotte, NC we sat on the runway for 45 minutes before we could get off, then had to go through the slowest customs lines and missed my flight home. This isn't the first time that has happened. I wouldn't recommend anyone to fly to Charlotte, NC if you want to get home at a decent time and not have to miss flights and end up sitting in the airport 4 to 5 hours waiting on another flight.  American airlines need to get their schedules together so you won't miss your connecting flight. American airlines knows the process of going through customs and shouldn't have planes scheduled to take off so fast before you can get through customs. People's time is valuable and don't want to spend a whole day trying to get back home

Not Verified |  Salt Lake City to Dallas. Horrible. I caught an earlier flight planning on catching the flight back. They cancelled both. Even though I called before. So I had to rebook the same flight for $500. When I called in to fix it after talking to the supervisor he said he would check something then put me on hold for 20 minutes just because he could. I fly this route with them monthly. Will be Delta from now on.

Not Verified |  Seattle to Atlanta. Wasn’t pleased with this flight. We had a layover in Charlotte. Then from there went to Seattle. On this flight there was no tv. The snacks were limited to just cookies and you had to pay for additional food. If a flight is 5-6hrs I think the expectation is that there should be entertainment and a few snack options. In addition at the end of the flight we had to catch a shuttle to the airport. Mind you this is a 10pm Landing. The plane smelled and my husband and I didn’t enjoy the experience.

Tonight’s lack of customer service is despicable. My boyfriend and I flew home from Alaska and had different middle flights from Seattle to DFW. His plane was late departing making his already close call to near impossible. The plane then landed with 20 minutes to spare before our gate closed and there was no gate available for them to dock the plane so they stayed landed and unable to get off the plane for 30 minutes. Management refused multiple times to hold the flight for the 15 American Airlines who were stuck on that plane due to their error and unable to make the last flight to Jacksonville for today. 15 passengers are now stuck in Dallas because they refused to delay the departure of 1 flight to give good customer service to customers who were delayed due to their error. To top it off .. they will not even provide hotel to those they have screwed. They now have to wait in DFW for the next flight out tomorrow morning at 7:20.  Shame on you, American Airlines. I will never fly with you again and I’ll do everything I can to make sure others don’t also.

Orlando to Dallas. American Airlines staff are great, however, their company runs a terrible business. For my honeymoon, my wife and I took 4 American flights which we booked together. The airline separated us for 3/4 flights and even with checking in 24 hours in advance there was no unpaid option for seats together. The airline was trying to force us to pay for an upgrade to get seats together. The American Airlines front desk admitted this is what they are doing, but could not help us. I have flown on over 12 different airlines and American is the only one to treat me this badly.

Not Verified | Phoenix to New Bern. This is the 3rd flight this year that has been delayed over and over. Worst airline ever. If Southwest flew here I certainly wouldn't be flying American. My last flight I spent half the night in Boston trying to get home. Always the same thing they don't have a plane. Get it together AA.

Flight from CLT to CLE booked through American - they suggested this connection at Reagan. The flight from Charlotte to Reagan sat on the tarmac waiting to take off for at least 20-30 minutes. I asked the flight attendant when we would make it in and whether I would make my connection. He said “yes! You will have plenty of time to connect. The flight is only an hour.” I finally get off the plane in terminal B and check the monitors to make sure I have the right gate for my connection (35X). There is one very small sign that says you have to take a shuttle to get to terminal C/X. I almost exited the airport because I passed it. Now, I don’t travel every once in awhile - I travel for business 2 out of 4 weeks a month. Get to the shuttle gate and the bus just leaves. I walk over to the closest gate and ask the attendant if she could help make sure the flight doesn’t leave without me. She says she can’t help and they always leave on time. I finally get down to my gate at 4:49! I looked at my watch as soon as they said the flight was closed. My flight was scheduled to depart at 4:59. I was there ten minutes before the flight was to depart - I should have been permitted on the flight. The staff at the gate were not helpful nor apologetic. If someone would have just said “sorry for the inconvenience” I don’t think I would be so upset - but nothing! I work in retail - I know things go wrong, mistakes happen ... but if one of my customers was inconvenienced with my product - even if it wasn’t my fault particularly, I still apologize. American has definitely lost a customer and I plan to spread the word.

Our flight from Charlotte to Des Moines was okay, but a little frustrating. Very friendly staff at ticket counter, at gate and on the flight. We were able to board early with our infant and get settled. Waiting on the tarmac for 45 minutes before take off was not ideal. We technically still made it to Iowa on time so that means the 45 minutes wait time was built into the flight. If that's the case, state that so I can book with someone else. The plane was small. My husband and I are not small in width so trying to juggle an infant and having to pump, we were miserable. The Des Moines to Charlotte flight was not a pleasant experience. The lady at the ticket counter was great as well as staff on the flight. The lady at the gate was awful. Very rude. They boarded a handicapped lady so my husband and I head up to board early with our infant and was told "you are in group 7 and it is not your turn. We do not allow families to board early. You'll have to wait". No "I'm sorry" or anything and with a snarky voice like we should have known this. I have never been on a flight were families weren't allowed to board first. So trying to walk down the aisle with our bags and an infant, bumping into other passengers and disturbing them was not okay. This needs to be addressed.

Not Verified | Chicago to London. I flew to London with American Airlines and it was a comfortable flight. The staff were sweet and helpful. They always checked on everyone, making sure everyone was happy and taken care of. The flight was smooth and quick. The inflight movies and WiFi made the flight so much more comfortable and quick. I will be flying American again.

Not Verified | Gulfport to Portland via Phoenix. 6:10 am flight cancelled late night. Changes to an earlier departure with a lengthy connection. They could care less. Missed business appointments and left with a middle seat. Will do everything possible to never fly this airline again. Beyond anything, I could imagine. The worst. No empathy no offer for assistance. A “whatever” attitude. There are options

Not Verified |  My flight was returning at 9.00 pm from Philadelphia to St Louis last night. I upgraded my seat to be closer to the front of the plane to not get stuck near the bathroom where I was. This cost me $21 which I chose to do willingly at check in. When I boarded the plane it was a 6 seat across aircraft but I don't remember the model. It was mostly empty so when I saw how empty it was I asked if I could move anywhere I wanted to and the Stewardess said anywhere but the emergency exit seats or first class. I get the first class thing but the emergency exit seats? Seems like they'd want someone there to handle the doors for emergency purposes but she said they are premium seats and its against the rules. I think I could do a good job with the seats since I am 6'2" 210 lbs former Marine in shape. She did a good job and was very pleasant so I don't fault her. American Airlines has a silly policy is all I think. All those emergency exit seats were empty so there was nobody there to man the exits. Seems dumb. Like a governmental bureaucratic policy deal. Everything else on the flight was fine.

Dallas to Corpus Christi. Worst customer service ever! Bought 2 tickets for $400 each. No seats. Got to the airport early to check-in (even checked in online 24 hours prior). Told we had to wait to get our seats after all customers had gotten theirs because we had Economy Class tickets. Have to wait in line again. Will never fly AA again. Will pay extra for any airline that treats customers better. Cannot imagine Delta doing this.

Atlanta to Miami with American Airlines. The worst service ever. Here’s what went wrong: 1) The person boarding was mean and horrible (I wonder how a person this unpleasant is allowed to be in any passenger facing role) 2) The manager was mean and horrible 3) They let me know that they needed to check my bag. When I said that I would like to speak to a manager because I am not comfortable with that, they were yelling and said I had 2 minutes to get on the plane. Their first move was to give an ultimatum. I would have understood had they asked nicely, but their terrible attitude really didn't help.

Not Verified | New York to Rome. I am an American Advantage Gold member who has flown to Europe multiple times using AA and its British Airways partner. In July, I purchased a Business Class ticket for 9/19 through American Express travel that was billed as British Airways #1585. I checked in at JFK 3 hours before the flight to learn that it was actually AA #236. That didn’t seem to pose any problem since my Business Class ticket was in AA’s system I was given a boarding pass for a Business Class seat 10A around 2:30 pm for my 5pm flight. Sometime during the next two hours, while I relaxed unaware in the Admirals Lounge, I was bumped out of my seat to a “Premium Economy” seat. I received no email notification nor was there any notification on the AA app. When I arrived at the gate expecting to walk into Business Class I was stopped and given an ultimatum and five minutes to decide whether to board and take the downgrade or roll the dice and fly the next day, losing a day of vacation. Of course, AA already had my luggage on the plane. The explanations I was provided for this incident were conflicting but none of them is acceptable. I was told I had purchased thru British Airways. Why should this matter? If BA premium tickets are subject to revocation then the partnership with AA is a sham. I was also told by an agent on the phone that there had been an equipment change a few months ago resulting in fewer Business Class seats available. If so, why was I issued my Business Class boarding pass at check-in, and why wasn't I notified in advance? I was also told at the gate that American had simply “oversold” Business Class and that even though I’m an Advantage Gold member I was first on the list to be downgraded. If so, that is a despicable practice. Passengers at the gate and seated around me on the plane were equally appalled. No one had ever heard of such a thing. I have been offered a voucher for future travel but I promise you it cannot begin to compensate for the ruining of the start what was supposed to be a dream vacation. I now will spend the next several weeks dreading the possibility that the same thing could happen to me on my return home from Rome. If Business Class seats mean nothing and can be downgraded what is the point of having them and what is the point of spending all that money? I was then told that I would be afforded “Business Class” treatment and amenities in my downgraded seat location but (no surprise) that was also a failure. I have been an American Advantage customer for over 30 years. This is by far the most disappointing experience I have ever had with any airline. I have lost faith in this airline.

Not Verified |  Washington DC to New York. Absolutely the worst airline to fly with and the customer service representative was cutting me off as I was speaking while I was trying to explain my situation. Typically with other airlines I'm given a confirmation email that I'm checked in after checking in online, but I was not given one so I called customer service to verify. I had already screenshotted the website saying I'm checked in. The 1st customer service rep put in my confirmation number and said I was not checked in. So I told her I had clearly checked in online and she said "Well, I have no answers. You can take it up with our web services. I have no idea why you're not checked in." She switched me over to the "web services customer rep", who when asked said "you're checked in" without asking for any confirmation number or my name. So I explained that the other customer service representative had put in my number and specifically said I'm not checked in, at which point this customer service rep cut me off and said "you're checked in. I don't know what else to tell you." and when I asked her how she knew I was checked in if she hadn't received my information, she said "You're checked in. I'm giving you a straight answer that you're checked in. You can go to the airport now and verify if you want." Is that really the answer AA gives to its customers when their own employees are giving customers inconsistent answers? Never flying American again.

Dallas to Laredo. Worst airline, horrible service. They changed our gate and never told anyone.  10 of us all stranded. We even made the gate before they closed the door. They closed the gate in front of us and said sorry flight closed. Seriously. Not a single notice, text alert or announcement. We sat at the wrong gate for 20 minutes without a single notice then ran to the other gate when another passenger his flight was just changed to our gate. Customer service agent working gate 23. Horrible. Wouldn’t give us the name of the gate agent because was worried the agent would be fired and she wouldn’t be able to find another job.

Omaha to San Francisco via Dallas with American Airlines. This airline is a disorganized mess. Do whatever you have to in order to not fly this airline. They overbook flights and beg paying customers to wait for additional delays due to their poor planning. Besides being generally disorganized and thoughtless with customers valuable time, they waited until the entire plane was boarded to inform us that we were delayed by an hour and would have to wait in the plane as they did not have a runway for us to take off or land on. They had us board so they could trap us on the plane with no choice but to wait. This is ridiculous.

Baltimore to Phoenix via Fresno with American Airlines. Started off poorly. Upon arrival at BWI, received text that flight had been canceled but rescheduled at Reagan Airport, in another state. No comp offered even though the wait was 5+ hours. In Phoenix, boarding agent gave us a red tag. Discovered we had to attach to bag and give to crew at airplane door so they could handle due to lack of space. When we took off, we counted no less than 4 completely empty bins overhead. Upon arrival, bags arrived on ramp and just passed around among the waiting passengers. Coming back from Fresno, through Phoenix, the flight was delayed while they tried to find their pilots, per flight attendant's announcement! Top prices for tickets no longer mean good service with American. Very uncaring, unprofessional airline. Their rep as an airline always on time, and the top of the heap airline is gone, gone, gone. Would recommend choosing another airline unless you have no choice.

I flew from MSP to NYC with a connection through Charlotte. The weather in Charlotte was bad (obviously not anyone's fault) so I ended up having to fly the next day. Then, on my flight back to MSP that connected again to Charlotte, my flight was bumped up 2 hours earlier without any notification whatsoever, which I didn't realize until I tried to check in to my flight. The AA representative in New York was incredibly helpful, rebooked me though Chicago asap and personally escorted me to the front of the TSA line so that I could make the flight that was currently in the process of boarding. I somehow made that flight, only to be stuck on the tarmack once we landed in Chicago because no gates were open. Because of this I ended up missing the connecting flight into Minneapolis and having to stay overnight in Chicago airport, as was the case with multiple other passengers on that flight. AA didn't offer any further accomodations other than rebooking, which I guess is just the price you pay for trying to travel if you're poor. The frontline staff who work for American Airlines are nice and helpful and I'm sorry that they have to stand by their disorganized company that clearly doesn't care about its customers.

Seoul Incheon to Tucson via Dallas Ft Worth. Worst airline to fly with. I had to fly home from Korea on emergency leave because my wife was giving birth to twins. I had a flight booked with American to fly from Korea to the US. based on the due date. She had to have an emergency C section and i had to change my flight. Changing a flight has been a nightmare since it began. I no longer needed my departure date since i had to leave earlier. I just wanted to use the return portion of my flight. American didn't want to change my flight at all. I was told i had apply for a refund and cancel all flight arrangements. Ok, a little dumb but, no problem i did that. Then i tried to schedule my return flight to Korea and was told that i have to leave from Korea in order to use my ticket. But i am already in the US and was never told this before. The person on the other end said "I'm sorry those are the rules for international flight". When was i going to be told about this rule? Apparently after they are have my money and there is no possible way of getting it back. I will never fly this terrible company again.

Miami to São Paulo. I was not given the standard service when flying with this airline. I was ignored and just didn’t feel welcomed. Staff had terrible attitudes especially when I asked for headphones and I was told by a staff member that he was busy and I was ignored by the other staff who were not willing to assist me at all. I’ve travelled with other airlines a lot and I’ve never been treat this way. I wrote the review the same day I travelled with this airline but I got no response. Hopefully I hear something back this time.

This is the worst airline experience I have had with American Airlines (AA). On my connecting flight, they downgraded our airplane to a smaller one without telling us until the last minute of the flight. I was forced to stand in line over 20 minutes for them to tell me that there was a problem with my ticket. They then put me in another line (30 minutes) that was for people who didn't have a seat assignment. After standing in this line, the same person that told me there was a problem with my ticket, issued me a new one. Why did I have to stand in line an additional 30 minutes for this guy to give me a new ticket? Needless to say, we were over an hour late getting into Chicago. On the way back from Dallas to Jackson, AA gave us the worst commercial plane I had ever flown on. Paint was peeling on the interior of the plane, the windows wouldn't even stay up when we tried to block out the sun, and when we hit a little turbulence, the entire overhead bins vibrated so loudly, almost everyone on the plane was alarmed. This is truly, the first time that I have flown, that I was scared. I flown to Japan several times and that was a 10 hour flight. Nothing rattled me like the 1 hour and 15 minute flight from Dallas to Jackson. I will never fly AA again!!

Indianapolis to Chicago. If I could leave 0 stars I would. First and last time I'll fly. Didn't check my luggage all the way through my flight and then blamed me when I arrived in London without my luggage. They knew my bag was in Chicago but couldn't be bothered to send it to me without a three page form that asked the most ridiculous questions. I'm sure it was to discourage anyone from making a claim. I mean who keeps receipts on all the prescription medication they purchased?

Not Verified |  Boston to Los Angeles on American Airlines. The ticket prices were reasonable, and the ground service was acceptable. The seat was also fine, but could use some improvements. Some of the cabin crew were rude and had a unpleasant attitude. The ground service was better at least. Only beverages were free, food costed money which was annoying on such a long flight. The entertainment was fine, but it needs improvement as well. I would choose another option next time if I have one, but I wouldn’t avoid this airline altogether.

Not Verified |  Thank you American Air Lines for saving the day. On August 10 my 17 yrs old daughter was traveling alone from Hartford to San Juan, Puerto Rico leaving Hartford at 6:00 am but got late to the airport missing her flight by few minutes. The customer service representative at the gate knowing that my daughter was a minor traveling alone went out of her way like no other airline has  done for my family. She made every possible thing she could have done to get my daughter safely home to us She gave snacks and drinks to my daughter while she reassured her that she’ll find her another flight so she could get home. She did everything in her power to help my daughter and I’m truly thankful of her efforts cause I was home worried sick of thinking that my daughter was stranded at the airport and I couldn’t help her. I’m so thankful of the rep at the gate who made sure my daughter get home that day, whoever you are thank you so much cause now I’m at peace knowing for next time too American Airlines got my back and will do whatever it has to do to keep my kids safe when traveling alone .

Not Verified |  Took a flight from Phoenix to Charlotte with American Airlines. Flight left at just after 2pm and arrived in Charlotte around 10pm yet only crackers and beverages were offered. We finally get to gate and the actual pedestrian bridge won’t turn on so we wait for 25 minutes before they finally get it working. By the time we all make into the terminal a majority of us have to run to make our connection. Of course, even if there had been time to eat, no restaurants are open at this time. Eventually make it on to my connection but sit there for over 30 minutes because some genius decided to schedule multiple departures at 10.20 pm on a Sunday night and the taxiway is clogged. I wish this was atypical but just the usual.

Not Verified |  Los Angeles to Dallas Ft Worth. This is possibly the worst airline we have ever flown. The plane itself is very nice but the customer service is awful. The people are rude and disrespectful. These people look like they hate their job and after talking to them you will leave with a bitter taste in your mouth.

Asheville to Indianapolis via Charlotte. I had to take a small plane out if Asheville because there are no direct flights. In Charlotte I gave the bagger my ticket outside plane and was given a different bag. It looked very similar to my bag & I did not notice until I got all the way home & my keys were not in the front pocket of my bag to get into my house several states away. From Charlotte to Indy: I was in seat 9F which is 2 seats behind 1st class. However, I was boarded last & all overhead bins were full. I think the airline should assign the luggage spot with the seat.  Nothing offered to lower class citizens.

I have yet to be on an American trip that at least one segment didn’t involve ridiculous delays or maintenance issues, or both. And here I am, again. Shame on me. Unreal, yet they continue to get away with it.

Not Verified |  Tucson to Richmond. We had a change over and the arrival plane was late and the connection closed early so we missed our connection. This airline is terrible and I will never fly it again. The plane was old and not updated. They showed a children movie in these tiny monitors that spans over 3 rows. The worker managing counter had no knowledge and ignored me when I tried to tell them door closed 15 minutes early. It has been the worse flight yet! I will never fly America airlines again.

Not Verified |  Orlando to Dallas. I will never fly America Airlines again. They delayed the flight like 8 times and I have sat in the airport for 6 hours and when I asked questions nothing but attitude. American airlines suck and I will never fly them again.

Las Vegas to Los Angeles. Was expecting more inflight service than a drink and packet of crisps for a First Class fare. The seat was big and comfortable, but service lacking for the price paid. Crew were functional at best, no warmth or sincerity. Arrived early, but this was negated by the hour long wait for luggage in LAX.

Dallas to Reykjavik. American Airlines did a wonderful job in business class. The flight attendants were friendly, helpful, and attentive. The food was excellent especially the salmon. The movie selection was great. Sound system was wonderful. They kept the toilets clean. I normally use foreign carriers when in business, but I have no complaints about this airline. Plus they arrived on time.

Salt Lake City to Dallas Ft Worth. Horrible service with very old planes and high prices compared to competitors. My last 4 flights with AA were delayed due to something being broken on the plane. Previous flight was first class and no TVs in the first class cabin. American Airlines planes always seem to be dirty and I need to wipe down the seat and tray areas personally. Definitely a substandard airline in all aspects. Online checkin / boarding pass system is often broken.

Phoenix to Reykjavik via Dallas Ft Worth. Great experience with this airline traveling to Iceland and return. No issues whatsoever. Lounges in Dallas were great, especially at D terminal, in which it is new.

Chicago to LaGuardia. Check-in was ok, slightly grumpy but warmed up. Security was awful: a supposed priority lane took 45 minutes to clear - the slowest crew ever. Flight was delayed which, I could see, was due to a plane switch. The original incoming plane had landed on time but we then were switched to another. Pushed back about 45 mins late. Crew were invisible so no pre-flight drink whatsoever, whereas both Delta and United offer this service. Drinks eventually came, with a cheese plate which was fine. Arrived at LGA 30 minutes late. The terminal is awful and the Uber parking lot even worse.

Albany to Charlotte. Was talked to like a dog from lady at the gate and then made me check a bag when I was carrying a book bag. Will never fly American again,  I asked why and she responded with none of my business. I was not asked if I would like a drink or snack anything, very dissatisfied with everything!

Miami to Houston. I would like to make mention of the incredible service the passengers in first class have been extended meanwhile the remaining passengers (I paid for priority and am seated in 8F) have to beg the rude cabin flight attendant for water. While I do not expect first class service I do expect to have some level service. The gentleman in first class has exceptional customer service and should be commended as such. I would like to call out specifically the male flight attendant offering service in the back cabin for his rude behavior. When I approached the back of the plane and asked if we could be provided service the woman flight attendant asked what I would like, I stated a glass of wine. The rude male attendant chimes in no wine ... literally that short. So then I say how about a cup of tea, as the plane is cold and we at this point have been boarded since 9:45ish and it’s clear after 10:40 pm- please note our original flight was to land on HOU at approximately 9:45 pm. He states you can have water ... so question one, why ask what I would like and then speak harshly to “the customer.” After another series of it will be another 15-20 minutes, I push the attendant button and ask (again speaking of the rude attendant) if he would ask the captain to make a special accommodation as we were to arrive in HOU at 9:45 pm for a cup of tea. He loudly states, in an inappropriate and quite honestly embarrassing manner to the cabin, she originally asked for alcohol. I do not accept being humiliated or shamed when the airline is at fault for my inconvenience. Flight number AA 2475 was to depart from gate D36 (after arriving from Curaçao (AA 2739). As I reached gate D30, I received a notification that the gate had changed to D10. We arrived at the gate and boarded the plan. Slightly after the plane is fully boarded the pilot comes on and states there are mechanical problems and that it will be about 20-30 minutes. And then states we would need to deboard. In the terminal we are told that we would have some information no later than 11 pm. I ask to be moved to the 10:05 pm flight and the gate agent tells me it would be better to stay on this flight as they were going to take the 10:05 pm plane and give it to us. This later proved to be false. I have so little confidence in the American Airlines team. We are then told to go to E9 for immediate departure (9:45 pm). It is now 11:43 pm and every 20 minutes or so we are told that we will be departing. It’s paperwork, it’s pictures. But here is the problem. I’ve asked several times for something to drink. We know it is permissible because the people in first class have had multiple rounds of cocktails. So tell me water is the only  option after several hours, is yet another lie by your very rude flight attendant. While I understand mechanical issues, the problem here is the inconsistent information, half-truths and more importantly the lack of attention given to the passengers not in first class. It wasn't until I asked for the second time that we (non-First class attendants) were even offered water after boarding, deboarding, reboarding and waiting for hours.

London to New York. Traditionally I have flown BA first class across the Atlantic but this trip I decided to try American to compare. American check-in was fast and efficient. The President's Lounge was, comfortable with adequate food but not as well-appointed as the BA Concorde lounge. The American open 'suite' (seat) was in my opinion more comfortable than the BA equivalent - they have proper leg rests that BA does not have and the ability to swing the chair onto a working desk if required. The bed was spacious and comfortable. The in-flight food was good with a reasonable choice. The wine list was not impressive but then neither is BA's. Oddly, AA charge first-class passengers for wi-fi connection! In my opinion, there is not a great deal in it but the American seat probably tips the comparison in favour of American in the air but on the ground BA have better lounge facilities.

Not Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Guatemala. One day before my flight as I was checking in, I saw the message that said that the flight was overbooked and $175 individual vouchers were offered to anyone with flexible schedules who were willing to change their flight to 2 days later. I was unable to check in online because I was traveling with a minor. The morning of my check-in, I arrived at the airport to find that the gate number on my original receipt was closed and after walking around for 20 minutes we finally arrived at the counter. When we were at the counter, I heard an airport employee say to another traveler that the American Airlines flight had been cancelled. I chose to disregard the airport employee and go to the counter because after all he was not an American Airlines employee and they should know better, right? I checked my bags in, printed my tickets and headed through security. As soon as I arrived I noticed a long line of people waiting to talk to the customer service rep at the gate to re-schedule a flight because the flight had been cancelled due to an "operational decision" whatever that means. I called the customer service line and they told me that I couldn't change the flight with them on the phone that I had to wait for the person at the counter. After 1 hour of waiting, I finally spoke to the person at the gate counter. He printed some "tickets" for me and told me that I had been re-booked to another flight the next day at 1:00 pm. I took his word for it. Later that morning I called the customer service line, because I had a feeling something wasn't right. After I talked to the person on the phone they told me that I wasn't on the 1:00 pm flight that I hadn't been re-booked. I tried to explain that person that I had tickets and an e-mail that said that I was on that flight but she kept telling me that I wasn't on their system. I got upset and asked for a supervisor, she had the same empathetic attitude as the first employee. I asked for my flight to be booked the next day and she was able to find me a flight for the same time as before. When I asked to change my returning flight to the next day in the afternoon she told me that she could price those out for me. I told her that given the circumstances and the fact that it wasn't my problem that plans have changed she should consider changing my flights at no cost. After a lot of back and forth she finally agreed to move my flight. I had to pay for seats on my returning flight because originally, my wife, my daughter and I had seats next to each other. On my departing flight we did not get seats that were next to each other because the flight was full and we had to rely on the generosity of another traveler to allow my wife to seat next to our daughter. We had to pay a very sketchy Uber driver to bring us back home that morning after losing sleep, time and going to tears from our daughter because she wasn't going to see her grandma that day. Our parents had to lose another day of work, lots of sleep and time to bring us to the airport yet again the next day. My mom in Guatemala had to make another 3 hour unnecessary trip to the Guatemalan airport because I didn't arrive on the day I was supposed to. We had to pay more to change our original car reservation because of "high demand" To top it all off my bag was damaged on my returning flight which to be frank I don't even understand how that happened because the bag was damaged from the zipper.

Barcelona to Chicago. Very rude and unprofessional Flight Attendant, in all my years of travelling I have never had any one treat me like that. It started with me saying "excuse me" (because I had a question) She turned around and said in a rude manner "What do you want?" I was shocked and I said "I'm sorry did I catch you at a bad time"? She then raised her voice and in an exasperated tone stated 'what do you need sir' at that point I said "you know what nothing from you" she said "suit yourself" and walked away. things went from bad to worse from there. Another incident was with the food she did not like the way I opened my tray and said "I am not putting up with this I will call the Captain on you" I said "please do call him I would like to speak to him". The FA said " I will call him for me but I am not going to waste his time calling him for you" - she told my wife I was rude, my wife told her she was rude first she walked away.

I flew from London to Greenville via Chicago in July with five children (one being only 2 years old) when we arrived from London in Chicago, our flight was delayed twice and then cancelled. How did I know it was cancelled? The staff at the desk unplugged the monitor and went home. Already having been delayed twice we had been sitting in the airport for a while. I couldn’t move easily because the airline had my stroller. I couldn’t find a member of staff to help me or advise me at all. No idea when my rebooked flight would be, where I would sleep the night. Legally I couldn’t really leave the airport without a car seat so I’m stuck in a town I don’t know, with five tired children snd not one single member of staff to assist. I don’t even know when the next flight will be ! This is disgusting service. I had to go find a taxi that would take us without a car seat, help me find a hotel that could accommodate and pay for this all myself. When I complained to the airline they said they take no responsibility for anything that happens to passengers if they cancel a flight. So I highly recommended never flying with this airline as you could just get left mid flight in a random location without any support or assistance. And guess what!? They don’t care!

Washington to Tampa with American Airlines. The flight was heavily delayed. No proper information was given. Ground staff didn't look interested. After seating we had to wait another 45 minutes til take-off. Flight was ok. Arrived almost midnight. Altogether a rather bad experience.

Huntsville to Dallas. This is the third week in a row flight 5903 has had long delays and last week was cancelled. It is unacceptable for an airline to have this kind of performance. Last week they cancelled all flights due to weather even though the weather cleared up by 8:30 pm. I travel exclusively on American but am doubting my loyalty. It seems like it’s so much harder to be platinum and don't know if it’s worth it when you travel primarily national flights. I have over 1.3 million miles on this airline. I think other airlines have better seats and some better service. Gives me pause to continue my loyalty. Plus this route is crazy-expensive $700 to $1100 every week.

Not Verified |  Flight cancelled or delayed most of the time at the last moment. New excuses every Weekend. 1) Sometimes the flight doesn't have fuel, 2) flight door is not closing. 3) Pilot changes at the last moment. 4) Trash not cleared by seats, and they need time to clear that. These excuses come when passengers are already on board. Crazy - don't care about passengers travelling and impact on their entire journey.

I was flying from Canton, OH to Myrtle Beach with a connecting flight at Charlotte. I was traveling with two fourteen-year old girls. Once our flight landed in Charlotte, they issued a two hour delay. An hour and a half into the delay, they completely cancelled our flight at 11.30 pm. I was told by the ticket agent that our particular flight was cancelled due to a maintenance issue. Their only offer of a solution was to get us on another flight two days later, which would entail a seven hour trip (flying up to Washington DC, then back south to Myrtle Beach). We would not arrive at Myrtle until 7.00 pm two days later. Our family drove there and were waiting for our arrival. We would have missed out on two of our five days there. I told the agent this was not an acceptable option. So, at midnight we were rushing through an unfamiliar airport trying desperately to get to a rental car agency to secure a car rental. After being up 18 hours at that point, we rented a car from Hertz for a 24 hour period $292.66. I drove four hours and arrived at Myrtle at 4.00 am. It was not a pleasant experience. I called the AA customer service by 10.00 am and was told to submit all of the receipts for the costs I incurred because AA cancelled our flight. I was assured I would be reimbursed for the rental car because the flight was cancelled due to maintenance issues, not related to weather. I filed my request to AA on July 9th. I submitted all receipts on July 16th. I wrote to them again on July 31st because I had received no response. On August 1st I received a generic letter stating they would refund each of us $87.02 for the portion of the flight that was cancelled. They gave each of us $150 flight vouchers, which I will not use. I wrote back on August 1st and 2nd stating I needed my refund for the rental car and that the vouchers were useless to us. They wrote back on the 2nd stating they will not refund me and continuously ended each letter with "we're eager to serve you again". I filed a complaint with the DOT and a month later received another generic letter stating that they gave me a refund for the cancelled flight portion and a voucher. They refuse to reimburse me for the rental car. They stated they offered another flight (this was available two days later). They actually expected a woman and two 14-year old girls to accept a flight two days later and to just hang out at the airport? I will never attempt to fly with American Airlines. There is no phone number for a supervisor. I was told "we do not escalate our customer complaints to a supervisor". They did not treat us as paying customers, only as numbers. Their responses were all generic. They did not treat us with the respect we deserved.

Not Verified | Nashville to Antigua via Miami. American Airlines no more. I travel frequently for both business and pleasure. Due to both budget and schedule constraints, we flew American Airlines from Nashville to Antigua and back. The premium economy seats were comfortable. The service was very poor. On the two outbound flights, cabin service was non-existent. On the return flights, cabin service occurred but was conducted by one very rude stewardess. The price for the seat did not include equitable benefits to what is provided by other airlines of equal class. The wifi was good enough to connect and submit this review. The food (for purchase) was stale.

Los Angeles to Miami. Every time I fly American there is so type of problem due to incompetent employees who don’t know what they are doing. We have flown American about 4 times and the first time we flew them we signed up for their Aadvantage card thinking it would be worth getting the miles. On our most recent trip our flight on Tuesday Sep. 3 was canceled due to the hurricane back home in Florida. They let us pick which flight back and only had one Thursday with a layover. My boyfriends sister was flying back to Miami the same day which did not get canceled. That night we called American to get on that flight back so we could just drive home and not be stuck in LA for three extra days. The lady on the phone told my boyfriend that we can’t change our flight to land into another city because we bought our tickets using the points from our AAdvantage card?  What ever, that night we booked two extra nights on a hotel that was over 100$ a night because we were going to be stuck here. The next morning I got a notification letting me know there are two extra flights available to take Tuesday morning that would land us in Melbourne Florida and not Orlando which didn’t make any sense considering the worker said there are no flights for us besides Orlando. We call in the morning again to see about getting on the flight to Miami yet again and the lady on that phone said we could do it. So she put us on that flight so we could get home that day. We did not have enough clothes or even money to be able to spend two and a half extra days in LA between the hotel, rental car, gas etc. Of course the hotel was non refundable and we had to argue with them to get our money back. BUT all of this could have been avoided if the employees knew what they were doing. So we get to the airport Tuesday morning to head on the Miami flight which the app told us that we had to go to a counter to check in. So of course the workers holding the line up asks us what we are doing which we show them the phone and they go “well did you try the kiosk” I said “no because it says right here we have to check in with a person and not online. So of course he said to go wait in that line to see -  after 10 minutes of waiting I get to the kiosk to just get told by the machine to check in with the counter. So we go to the counter desk and a huge line that we waiting in for 40 minutes .. after getting to someone they clearly didn’t know what they were doing because two employees just shoved us off to the next employee .. some guy in the Miami airport counter just clocked in and two employees just told him to figure it out. They were telling us that the lady we spoke to on the phone this morning did not change our ticket in the system yet we had a confirmation with seat numbers to our email. After about an hour of all this we finally got our tickets. I never have any problems with any airline but this one.

Not Verified |  Atlanta to Dallas Ft Worth via Salt Lake City. I can't say i have heard anyone speak of of this but my comment pertains to the noise level inside the cabin during flight. I made a recording on my last flight, 8/28/2019, that averaged 105dB. At this level serious hearing damage can occur within 8 hours. I find this quite alarming.

American Airlines canceled their flight from Columbia SC to Washington DC (Regan) - Flight was to take off at 7:40pm then delayed multiple times. Ticket policy is they are not obligated to compensation if caused by weather, which is true! At issue is that their own plane took off after the weather delay for a leg to Washington (Regan) then was to return for a 2nd leg that was canceled with no further weather issues, leaving us stranded until the next morning. This was not a weather issue it was a business decision not to send the plane back for the final leg of their days flight, the claim that it was weather related was to not obligate for compensation. The secret is that pilots and flight crew have union and FAA limitations on how many hours they can fly in a given day / time period by not sending a replacement crew (the good old days) and claiming the cancellation was due to weather and not mechanoical - my position is crew unavailability is mechanical (compensation due) and not weather. Only compensation was completion of the flight the following morning (presumably the same aircraft which was delayed to get the aircraft back into the normal flight rotation "back and forth between the 2 airports) After requesting a credit or a ticket at a future date as a courtesy American Airlines customer relations rejected twice. Poor customer relations leaving passengers stranded then dodging their obligations.

Not Verified |  Albany to Nassau. My wife and I booked a flight on aa.com. We booked an all inclusive resort called the Melia. This was the most relaxing vacation we have ever taken. Caught a 3-30pm flight from Barcelona to Chicago with a 2-year old. There were several families with small children on the back of the plane. Not Verified |  Dallas to Albuquerque. This is by far, the worst airline. We sat on The tarmac, for over two hours with no water, even available to the passengers. Dallas-Fort Worth to Seattle. I just wanted to say that I was very pleased with one of the flight attendants on this flight. Philadelphia to London, please think twice before booking American Airlines for your travel needs, especially from Philadelphia Airport. On Monday 8/19/19 we had a flight that was suppose to depart at 10pm. Around 8pm (2 hours prior) we already received the first delay. This went on several times until 4:15am when they finally had us board the flight. Once boarded it was announced that it was now cancelled. My husband and I were traveling internationally with our 10 & 7 year old kids who were sleep and exhausted. I don’t understand why they didn’t just cancel it earlier .. felt strung along not knowing what’s going on from 8pm to 4:30am. If you ask them they just kept saying “mechanical issue.” If they had made a decision earlier instead of holding us all night we could have had more options for switching and rebooking the flight. So at 4:30 am we have no idea how we are getting to LHR and the worst part was the aftermath. Dealing with AA’s ticket agents and customer service was terrible. Not only to us but to others on that flight. No comfort, no apologies, no care. Just pure rude like it was our fault. No one went above and beyond to assist us with our issue. We were talked down to and in front of our children. I mentioned to one woman that “you have no idea what we have been through this evening so maybe a kinder tone would help.” As we try to explain what happened they reply “ we already know your situation!” Eye Rolling, argumentative, “this is all we can do,” dismissive attitudes while stuck in airport. Getting the hotel vouchers we were told “well you can try but they will probably make you check out at 11am.” They showed that they didn’t care at all what we went though and it was not there problem. To them it happens all the time, but they should be trained to have a more understanding attitude to customers going though stuff like this. Our flight was rebooked through AA over the phone since no one at airport had a care. Marriot at the airport is where we slept and showered an waited for our rebooked flight which left 8/20/19 at 7:30pm (which also had a delay). Marriott staff were the only kind ones we dealt with. What was really crazy is we don’t even know how we got on AA. This flight was booked through Expedia and was for British Airways. British Air is who charged are card but we show up and we are actually with American who “services” British Air 🤷🏽‍♀️ I have contacted them and sent email and hoping they will offer something for that mess they made.

Flew AA in paid first Austin to Palm Springs via Los Angeles, returning via PHX back to AUS. On time and quick flight to DFW, pre-departure beverage and another once airborne. DFW to PSP clean Boeing 737-800 with at seat entertainment. really nice breakfast from very friendly crew. We travel to Palm Springs every other month and simply love the high spirits on these flights. All flights on time with spot on crews. We always find AA consistent in Premium Cabins.

London to Chicago.  I was worried about a supposedly imminent British Airways strike so switched to American Airlines. Pros: new aircraft; comfortable seat; quiet engines. Cons: loud crew who spoke incessantly across the galley to one another, not service oriented or discreet like staff on BA or Swiss; food sub-standard compared to foreign airlines; a bit surly to the point of my wondering whether they were taking out their frustrations with management on the customers (they mentioned upcoming contract negotiations). American Airlines should learn from the competition and improve its training of stewardesses. Perhaps they should be better paid so customers wouldn't have to put up with loudmouths.

New York to Reno via Los Angeles. Indifferent customer service. Delays on every flight and diverted to LA without seats to get back to NJ - even though I was booked first-class 2 months in advance to have direct flights from Reno to NY. Please avoid this airline.

Not Verified |  I flew with American Airlines to Europe to spend with a family friend and others. The flight  was wonderful, smooth takeoff and landing, friendly staff and a wonderful selection of food.  However upon landing in Germany we discovered our luggage had been left in the states. It was a full week before we got some luggage back and 2 more days before I received mine, despite us both coming from the exact same place to the exact same place. Despite a wonderful flight, due to this horrendous mismanagement of our luggage I will never be flying with American Airlines ever again. Fresno to Memphis via Dallas. Worst airline ever. Never flying with American Airlines again or recommending this airline. Horrendous customer service. We had booked our trip through American Airlines from PHL to CHA. Not Verified |  Oklahoma City to Seattle. Garbage. Slightly better than Spirit and Frontier but honestly just barely. Checked in 3 hours after open check in and zero seats available that aren’t over $40 per seat for some decent but still ridiculous leg room.

Mexico City to New York. Never flying with American Airlines again. They continuously leave my partner and I stranded due to them never making their connecting flights. Seriously they will miss their connecting flights due to needing to land the plane at a different airport to get fuel and somehow tell you "well we didn't make the connecting flight due to weather and that just isn't our fault" and then tell you they have no more flights until you hound them and still the wait will be over 8-9 hours. This disgustingly unprofessional airline isn't worth the trouble and even when their connecting flights seem like a steal price-wise you end up paying for it when they don't make it on time and they leave you stranded.

San Antonio to Chicago. Majority of the time my flights and everyone I know that has flew American has a delayed flight due to maintenance. The new aircraft have more narrow cramped seats with no leg or hip room. I'm small compared to most adult so that is ridiculous. Also the seats are tilted forward which make you feel like your sliding out of an already uncomfortable seat. 1 out of 2 staff is rude and in accommodating when trying to change to an open seat that no one will be flying in. Yes people pay more to ensure they have a reserved seats of their preference but if it's empty just prior to boarding why not allow others to take an open seat. I will not choose to fly American if I have other options.

Paris to San Francisco via Dallas with my daughter. West Palm Beach to Dallas. Wish I never dedicated myself to this airline. You spend as much time on the ground experiencing mechanical issues, gate issues and lack of crew showing up. Chicago to Dallas via Salt Lake City. My recommendation to military members traveling on airlines with government contract rates is to avoid American Airlines completely.
