We had to wander aimlessly and ask an AA representative, who was rude! All representatives were rude! We were told we could not board the plane after first class was called. (We had a service dog and a stroller). We were VIP seating! We were unable to access the AA WIFI once aboard the plane. Being in VIP seating, we asked if there was a charge for alcoholic beverages. We were told, yes! (On our return flight from LAS to CLT, we asked the flight attendant if there was a charge for alcoholic beverages. She also said, yes! The passenger sitting next to us, in the aisle seat, told and showed us that alcoholic beverages are free!) We don’t appreciate being lied to! Once we arrived in CLT, we were told there was a 3 hour delay! We had pre-paid tickets for a show in Las Vegas at 9.00pm that cost us $204.88 and were non-refundable! We understand that weather conditions are not in anyone’s control, however, we were not offered any compensation for the money and our valuable waiting time that were out! We encountered the same no WIFI and no alcohol from CLT to LAS! What happened to the good ole days where there were screens to view movies (with provided ear/head-phones), actual meals and a variety of snacks (that were included, not a charge for) as well as friendly and calm flight attendants? We flew with this airline this past Easter and had a positive experience. That is why we chose to fly with AA again. Bad mistake! Wish we flew with Southwest! This truly was the traveling nightmare we had to endure!

Paris to Los Angeles via Dallas. They just cannot get anything right. Flew from Paris to-day but couldn't check-in and spent one hour over the telephone while they figured out how to reissue the ticket (schedule change). When I checked in again this problem and even though I am AA Platinum elite they charge me 50€ for my suitcase even though am supposed to get two complimentary (https://www.oneworld.com/travel-benefits). Because I couldn't check-in of course got the lousiest seats. Why because the computer told them to collect it and they cannot override the computer. It seems that the computer is not their tool, but they are the tool of the computer. Upstairs was treated abrasively by a 22-year old boy in the Admirals' Club - why does American continue to hire people who do not wish to serve the public? In my opinion AA is deceptive & dishonest and now they do not honour their pledges regarding elite benefits. I plan to sue them in Superior Court for the $55 just because someone has to send them a message that they cannot walk all over people. It is astonishing though how they cheat everyone even their best customers.

6:40 New York JFK to Austin flight delayed 80 min. Since it was taken off after 8pm they did not serve dinner! Same thing on the way back to New York happened. 6:30 flight delayed 90 min and announced dinner will not be served but snack meal. Waste of time and waste of money. Last time flying with American Airlines. Not recommended at any time.

Ashville to Philadelphia. Worst airline ever. Our flight was randomly cancelled due to air traffic where other flights were flying as scheduled to Philly. No compensation for money lost on fuel and hotel bookings. Avoid this airline! They had it planned and let it happen at the last minute. They could find an alternative solution. Avoid!

Not Verified |  On our way there, our boarding passes said to go to the kiosk for seat assignments. At the kiosk no one acknowledged us for 30 minutes as they were talking amongst themselves and finally when someone looked up they asked “are you looking for your seat assignments” we stated yes, and the reply we got was “well so is everybody else”. Absolutely terrible. Then on the way home, our flight got delayed. The delay would cause us to miss our connector flight so with everyone else we stood in line to talk to the employees at the kiosk. While in line, a member of American Airlines passed out a number to call. We called the number just to ask about flight changes and if we could get a refund how that would work. The women on the phone informed us that we would have to do that online which we said we would wait to talk to the employees first. After standing in line for 2 hours to talk to the person at the kiosk about our options, they told us we had cancelled our flight by talking to that women on the phone. The man at the kiosk told us “there’s nothing I can do” and “I wish you wouldn’t have called them”. So we walked away with no flight home, no one to help, and lord only knows if we will get our refund. This is so ridiculous. Awful airline and will never fly with American Airlines again.

Received morning email that everything was good to go. Went thru security at 7.30 for a 9.30 flight to Dallas FW. So the nightmare and incompetence begins. The flight was cancelled. Everything was rescheduled. I would now fly to LAX at 5.30 pm, an 8 hour delay - they gave us a $12 food voucher. I went to the American Airlines counter to tell them I would miss my flight in Manila and they just basically said it was my problem and I would have to call the airlines. My flight in Manila was scheduled for 7.5 hours after I was supposed to arrive on my American Airlines booked trip. Now in LA, I am put on Philippine Airlines, which runs about 30 minutes late after another 2.5 hour layover. So, now I am in Manila, at the wrong terminal, as I was supposed to be on an American Airlines flight that arrived at the correct terminal. Its not really a big deal as I don't have my luggage. 3-4 day delay and I have to go back to the airport to get it! Never again American Airlines. 33 hours and now I'm sitting in a bus terminal at the airport waiting to go to the correct terminal hoping Cebu Pacific takes pity on me and gets me to my destination cause American Airlines did absolutely nothing for not only me but their other customers on that flight. Pathetic.

The service on board was surprisingly and completely unexpectedly quite good. However, the managing of bags was terrible. I checked two bags in LA at the same time and when arriving in MEX only one was there. At first at the AA baggage loss counter, they seemed very sympathetic and gave the impression I might get it back in 24 hours as they say in most instances it is the case. But after calling each day with the same promise that the baggage was scanned and in LA, they promised it would arrive in MEX the next day to no avail. On the 15 August, I was told by one staff of the lost baggage phone line my luggage was already on the plane and would arrive at my doorstep by 8pm. At 9pm I call just to be informed that my bag was still in LA. That is not incompetence, that is plain lying. I have to wait until 18 August to receive it back and no compensation was granted. It goes without saying that this was the worst customer service I have ever experienced from any airline.

Not Verified |  Denver to Philadelphia. Arrived at Denver Airport 1 1/2 hours prior to 5:24 am departure. Stood inline for nearly 55 minutes at self service checkin. AA counter was moving people from the back of the line to the front of the line in order to keep them from missing their 5:00 AM flight (this caused us to have to run to our gate missing any chance of getting food before boarding). We were sitting near the back of the plane, by the time the service cart got to us, they had one sandwich and two fruit trays left. My son and I originally wanted a sandwich each. He pulled out the sandwich and the fruit trays. I said I would take one of both. The flight attendant from the front of the plane came up and asked for the two fruit trays, my flight attendant literally gave her both. His explanation was the “front of the plane” has priority over the back of the plane. This is absolutely unacceptable. I sent a note to AA and have been ignored. Bottom Line, if AA think they are a doing a good job, they are not. I will continue to tell people my experience and steer them away from flying American Airlines!

Philadelphia to Las Vegas. Pay more and take a different airline. Sat on the plane for four hours and then flight was cancelled. Rescheduled for a flight 24 hours later. One day out of a three day vacation gone. Next day flight had a three hour layover that turned into four because of a delayed flight. People coming off the flying were running each other over trying to get to connecting flights only to be told the flights took off and they needed to go to customer service to reschedule. No organization with the airline staff or traffic control in Philadelphia. Will be waiting for compensation after this. Will never fly with AA again!

My daughter and I were about to go to Miami see a specialist for my daughter’s condition. The ticket agent said we had time to run to the bathroom, but when we returned, that same ticket agent watched us approach, rushed to shut the door to the ramp and almost gleefully told us “sorry, you can’t board.” We inquired as to what to do next, and she said we could go stand-by. After waiting through 3 over-sold flights, we realized that there was no way we would board a flight to Miami going stand-by. We called American and the agent offered us two new flights at almost $400 a piece without any credit for the more than $300 we’d already paid for the original flight. I called United and a great guy got us on another flight the following morning for only $140 total for the two of us. While in Miami, my daughter became very ill and was hospitalized for 4 days. The doctor would not release her from his care in time for our flight. I called American and explained the situation. They offered to “help” us, but they would have to charge a “change’ fee to the tune of $480! After many failed conversations with American Airlines, I gave up. I felt like we were being extorted. We were stranded and nearly broke through no fault of our own and they would not budge an inch to give us a reasonable flight. I called Southwest airlines. They gave us a flight home for little more than $168 a piece, which was much less than American’s “change” fee. When I complained on Twitter, they began to direct message me, (anything to keep my more than 3000 followers from knowing how awful we were being treated.) The last one read, “We’re very sorry for the situation. We feel it was outside the norm and for that reason we hope you’ll allow us another chance in the future.” Still no offer of compensation for the more than $700 they pocketed from us. And, when I read other former customer’s experiences, it seems this is exactly their norm! I will never fly American Airlines again. Their staff, especially their O’Hare staff, are obnoxious and rude. I can’t remember being treated so badly by a company whose service I paid for! Deplorable customer service!

Not Verified | Phoenix to Houston IAH. My back still hurts from flying yesterday. These are the most cramped seats and without back support, I've ever flown in. Pay a little more and fly another airline

Dallas Ft Worth to Chattanooga. My flight was scheduled for 8:27pm. I get to the gate at 8.20pm to find the gate is closed! I go to customer service and they said "oh, flights leave 10 minutes ahead of time " I go where does it say that? I've never heard of this? " Its common knowledge" Airlines know who is supposed to be on the flight, you know you are missing someone but you leave early anyway? The worst part was their attitude! I asked to speak to a supervisor and he was unprofessional. I said nothing I had says flight leaves 10 minutes early, I looked at departure time on kiosk, 827!  He said the kiosk says it, I went and looked and took pictures, it does not say to be there 10 mins early. I have never seen anything like this.

We bought some tickets from Boston to Washington, for a flight scheduled at 8.00 pm on 08.15. Two months before our trip, we received an email saying our flight will be at 9.00 pm. First bad news. The day of our trip, we received an e-mail at 8.30 pm rescheduling our flight at 10.30 pm. All night long, we received 8 e-mails rescheduling our flight! And no information at all from American Airlines crew at the airport! We didn't know anything : nor why it was delayed, nor why it was rescheduled every half hour. It was freezing in the airport because of the air conditionner, and nobody gave us blankets at any point. We were just waiting and waiting for the next bad news and the next email in our mailbox. At some point, my friends and I went to look for some company member but nobody was at the desk, although it was 11.35 pm and the flight was supposed to leave. We finally managed to find someone who explained us there was no pilot for our flight. How can it be possible? Our flight finally left Boston at 1.30 am with more than 4 delayed hours, and the staff told us there was nothing they could do for us. Even one of the employees was chocked by the situation! This is how American Airlines treats their customers. Because, obviously, customers didn't receive any compensation for all the troubles caused. Just a "we apologize". We lost 7 hours at the airport and we lost a lot of money because our Airbnb in Washington couldn't wait for us all night long.

Hartford to Miami. Brand new airplane. They waited until all were seated. Upon pre-flight inspection, they discover that there’s a flat tire and they had no replacement. They announce that they are trying to borrow from another airline and that flight is delayed 45 minutes. Original departure time was 6am. Ten minutes later, stewards said we have no information so please do not ask us. 5 minutes later we get text message saying departure delayed until 9:30 am. Ten minutes later they say they still have no tire and no info but will need to deplane for repair. They also said “make one line in front of gate counter if transferring in Miami. We will hand you a card with a phone number to call regarding your transfer flight. When you deboard do not speak with other AA staff as they are busy with other flights”. Mind you, they are holding our luggage hostage so that we can’t make other arrangements. As we are deboarding, the sign at the gate changes to departure until 11:30. No one makes announcements from gate. Only announcement made was “If you’re not making a transfer in Miami get out of line! This is the only flight to Miami we have so you just have to wait” This is how they were speaking to us. No apologies, no kind words. Now, I had to get up at 3:00 am to make this flight. I booked an early flight because I was surprising my daughter on her birthday and had a whole day planned for celebration. As it is, I will only have 3 days with her counting today. I haven’t seen her in almost a year. She had a very difficult week which made me decide to bite the bullet and pay this high priced ticket for just a few days which is now turning into a nightmare. It is 7:30 am and still no announcements. I appreciate the safety check and making the necessary repairs, however, a new plane should not be without a spare tire and neither should the airline. This is what is causing the major delay and I do not appreciate the way we are being treated not to mention that I paid almost $500 for disappointment, a day lost, and complete rudeness! Not so much as a food voucher was offered. Next time, it’s Delta for me.

New York to Miami. If you want to pay for American Airlines and get Spirit Airlines service thats the only way you should travel with them. Delayed at every single flight no exception between 1 and 3 hours, no water no snacks, no going to the bathroom, just sit strapped in your seat until you get to depart, if you ever find out since the crew does not communicate with the passengers. This is my last trip with American Airlines, will change my miles membership and credit cards too, this is a absolute no no company to travel with. Sadly they have been decreasing quality since past 4 years, but the delays are just too frustrating.

Not Verified |  Washington to Kansas City. Does American Airlines now have a policy to punish those who are not willing to pay for an earlier boarding? Sure seems that way. Went to board my plane yesterday, when group 7 was called to board, they suddenly had no more room in the overhead bins. They checked our bags at the gate. When we got onto the plane, there were empty overhead compartments everywhere. There was plenty of space. It seems as though you must pay to board early or you now have to face the fact of going to baggage claim to get your luggage. You certainly cannot risk complaining, what would happen if you did? You will be removed or arrested? I am not poor, but I was poor at one time and did not have the money to pay for 'boarding earlier'. There is something sickening about this unethical behavior.

Worst flight ever. When you use your miles with them they sit you in the back row next to toilets and next Non-parented children. Stewardess was flirting with man in front of us, but what’s worse is that she wasn’t keeping the two non parented 7-9 year old children who were so out of control. Kicking the seat, throwing food, snatching our phones from our hands, and just all over the place. Bad bad bad! Don’t fly this airline.  Not flying this airline again.
Terrible airline. Delay after delay after delay. All accompanied by their ‘we are sorry for the inconvenience’ email. They’re not sorry. They’re laughing all the way to the bank. Never again.

Worst airline my family and I have ever been on. Delays going to our destination and delays on the way back. They have no care for customer convenience, the crew was late and therefore delayed two hours. Then again on our way back home there were other unexplainable issues causing further delays. We had to sleep at the airport overnight and they could not/ did not want to accommodate us at all. Also once at Dallas Forth Worth, they kept changing our gates from one end to another, we kept having to walk up and down like 4 time! Worst flight experience ever. Get more for your money and fly another airline, United is the best.

Miserable experience on AA133 from Dublin to Dallas/Fort Worth on Sunday, June 9, 2019. My fiancé and I sat in front of a2 year old who kicked our seats and screamed for 6 of the 8 hour flight. We were very sympathetic to the mother of the child and asked crew to move to a wide open row toward back of plane but were told it was blocked for them to rest. I understand that particular aircraft has a separate designated crew rest area. Why would they also block an entire row? This is but one cause of my eroding confidence in our future travel with AA. On our way to Europe on the flight from DFW to New Orleans on AA (BA5269) May 23,2019, our AA flight attendant appeared angry and spoke to flyers as little as possible. She was abrupt and outright irritated when I asked for water during normal service times. Contrast this is the cabin service we received on BA and then Aegean in Europe and it provided a strong reason to look elsewhere when flying. Upon return, I sent a message via twitter and AA’s response was outright dismissive. After asking around to frequent business travelers, I was told AA has the reputation of terrible customer service. I’m now actively avoiding AA.

Dallas to Boston. American Airlines has the worst customer service I’ve ever experienced. I’ve had issues flying with them before but never anything bad enough to write a review. My flight was delayed and I was reassured that all flights from DFW were also on hold. I arrive at the gate only to find that the plane has actually left early!! Not to mention the gate had changed without notice! I tried to remain calm as this was my first missed flight ever but the gate attendants were unbelievably cruel to me in my panic. They hatefully pointed me toward the customer service area and I waited in line there for a little over an hour and I was simply given another flight  standby with more rudeness from the attendant because I had questions she couldn’t answer. I personally will never fly AA again but good luck!

Miami to Nashville. I have always had a terrible experience with American Airlines. My wife has been asked to give up her seat and be left behind while we were already sitting in 2015. I am currently writing this review while waiting on a flight that has been delayed 5 different times and have been sitting here for 4 hours on a 45 minute layover. They gave us some free crackers to apologize. I have had a pleasant experience a time or two, but unfortunately this seems to be par for the course for those of us that give this airline second chances.

This was a flight from Dallas to London as part of a Sydney-Dallas-London-Sydney trip on One World. AA have lifted their game (in my opinion) and the flight was smooth, on time and totally uneventful. The IFE is really great so made use of it a lot. The FA's are best described as courteous but not warm. Swift in getting things served up for the overnight leg and then retired not to be seen again. No matter. Had eaten in the lounge so did not eat anything on board which looked pretty much regulation fare. Comfort wise it was OK and decent leg room for an economy cabin. AA get a bad rap but here is a big shout out for them in all regards from check in through to getting off the plane.

I’ve never been more upset and disappointed in an airline. Ever. I’m a regular flyer but this is my first time flying American. They didn’t have great reviews but I thought, hey, this is a straightforward flight in the middle of the summer. Nope! I was delayed at SLC due to something in Chicago that passed in 15 minutes but delayed us for an hour and a half. I missed my connecting flight by 10 minutes. The girls and the counter had no idea what was going on or how to help me and the flight attendant when I got on the plane was absolutely clueless too and told me to call customer service? In the air or? It was a small flight (less than 20 people), they could have held the plane or at least tried. When I got to Chicago, they told me they couldn’t put me up for the night and to use a hotel discount. The discount was available / didn’t work and I was on hold for 30 minutes before I just got my own hotel! Then, in the morning, I finally board my plane and am headed to my destination. 20 minutes of sitting on the plane later the captain gets on the speaker and says the plane has maintenance issues and we have to get off and wait another hour and a half for a different plane! The front desk and flight attendants didn’t even know what was going on. I go home every 3 years and had an extremely important family event to attend, and missed it completely. I’m so upset at American. This flight was very expensive and I paid readily so I could get home on time. Shame on you for not giving any cares about the actual people who try to support your flights.

I don't normally leave reviews, but my experience was so awful that I felt compelled to write something. I had a flight leaving from Toronto to Richmond, for which I had no checked luggage. I was unable to check in online and had to do so at the Airport. I got to the Airport with 45 minutes left before check in closed and tried to use my passport on the self serve kiosk, which took forever to process and kept giving me an error. I tried a few more times and kept getting an error before one of the attendants said i should go to the desk for processing. I had to wait in line for what seemed like an eternity and once I got to the desk I was told that final check in time had passed and I could not board. I was shocked, and explained to the staff that I was here before check in time and had tried to use the terminals and was eventually sent into the line, and that normally my passport works at the kiosk, so this was my first time with any such issue. I asked if there is anyway that an exception can be made, I still have 45minutes before the flight boards and I need to make my flight, it was not fair that I cant board when I was here before check in time. The attendant was unsympathetic and very rude and basically said no there is nothing we can do, you're supposed to be here 3 hours before your flight and its too late to board as per her discussion with her manager. They told me I can rebook but it would cost me $800 to leave the next day but that all they can do. I had to rebook myself on another airline, but the only silver lining here was I did request and receive a refund from American Airlines for my missed flight. However, I do not intend to fly with them again anytime soon.

Not Verified |  I have never been treated so rude in my life. My family flew into Lake Charles Louisiana for a family reunion on August 9th and we were scheduled to fly out of Lake Charles on August 11th at 4:25pm. We were lost and ended up getting to the airport at 4pm. There was no line and no wait being that it was a small airport. There was no attendant at the check in station. I immediately ran to security to get help as they had not started boarding our flight. The security guard came and informed us to go back downstairs to check in and that they would send someone to help us. They deliberately waited until the plane left to come help us. The attendant was very rude and told us we had cheap tickets and we would not be able to rebook them. She showed no sympathy or compassion. The attendants at United were more helpful than she was. I called the customer service line and the supervisor told us that we could not get a refund. My family including my 85 year old grandmother in a wheelchair now have to rent a car and drive all the way to Atlanta because there was no more available flights leaving Lake Charles for 2 days. I feel that the situation was handled poorly and that we were treated unfair.

My flight was cancelled and I was only notified at the airport at self check in. I was rebooked for the following day and got a very insensitive attitude from the American Airlines customer service. Not an airline I will recommend based on customer care.

Athens to St. Louis via Chicago. American canceled our flight with about 6 hours' notice. The representative put us on another flight, but she failed to secure our tickets and within about 30 minutes, that flight was oversold. Another American rep put us on a different flight through Tel Aviv, JFK, Charlotte and finally St. Louis. However, she also failed to tell us there was absolutely no way the connection at Tel Aviv to JFK would be possible with the timeframe. We ended up (thankfully with about 11 others from the same flight) stuck with Israeli airport security overnight - who were not at all interested in providing any assistance. We finally were able to get on the phone again with yet another American representative who got us on another flight (all economy - when we paid extra for premium economy) to the states. We ended up spending 48 hours in airports - all to come back and find American isn't the least bit interested in providing any sort of customer service to try to make things better. Not good business at all.

Dallas to Miami. Truly the worst airline. They don’t care if you have to change a flight (just buy a new ticket duh). There alre always delays. It’s not a friendly atmosphere and the flight attendants always look miserable. I always dread flying with them. I fly SW whenever possible. AA, time to consider your customers. Getting too big for your britches.

Phoenix to Sacramento. On our original flight to our destination our plane was switched gates six times and it was delayed 4+ times and resulted in us missing our connection flight and our cruise. On our flight home our gate was switched another 3 times to completely different terminals across the airport and delayed two hours. It was the worst experience we ever had, will definitely NOT be flying American Airlines again.

Honolulu to Los Angeles. We had a flight canceled and they rebooked us on the next mornings flight and gave us a hotel, meal vouchers, and taxi cab to and from the airport. It was a really nice hotel too.

Not Verified |  I've never been a big fan of AA, but after my most recent experience I'm absolutely disheartening and disgusted. For those that don't know, the company policy is to shut off the boarding system 30 minutes before take-off. I usually fly out of a small town airport, so it doesn't take me long to get through TSA and boarded... So I got a lovely surprise when I couldn't get on the plane. Apparently, I was just cut off by a couple of minutes. And instead of helping me reschedule my flight (even to another day), the lady had to put me on standby (another company policy for 'missed flights') - so I wasn't even ever guaranteed any flight and had to sit in the airport for hours waiting, continually going back to the desk to get a new standby ticket for a new flight. This policy is not okay. Plane tickets are expensive and people's time is priceless. In addition, when all the hullababo was over, I still could have gotten through TSA in time to get on the flight. That was the most heartbreaking part. In addition, the woman next to me was also late, and the clerk at the desk was absolutely rude to her. He spoke in a very condescending tone of voice. He said things like: "you missed the same flight yesterday," "I guess it just wasn't meant to be then," and "you need to understand that you should be at the airport ready for your flight two hours before!" (Note: usually I agree with this advise-- but not in a rude way like the clerk said it or for a very small airport like Bangor!). I get it, it's not an easy job and people are annoying-- I have worked in service, too! But if you can't handle people without being mean, find another job! It was super uncomfortable being next to her and having to listen to his rudeness - imagine how she feels! Rude service, bad policy, and a generally uncomfortable flying experience. It's with the extra money for Delta. Treat yourself and avoid the hastle!

Harrisburg to Albuquerque. Extremely rude from check in to flight attendant. I just want to go back to Southwest. I have to take 2 more planes on this airline before I get home and I’m dreading it. A nice word or a smile goes a long way. These people don’t care.

This is the worst experience I have ever had flying, hands down the worst. I arrived at LaGuardia in NY at 7 am and had a connector flight to Richmond, VA. 30 minutes before boarding they came over intercom and said that the flight was completely cancelled, not delayed but completely cancelled. The reason, because the had to much air traffic i.e. they overbooked. They put me on next flight, at 9 pm. I asked for other options and they give no one options. They were very unprofessional throughout the whole process, laughing and joking with each other. When asked for a meal ticket they were reluctant to even give me that even though it was there fault that they were over booked. This happens apparently 4 times a week on this connection alone and yet American continues to screw people over with no remorse. One of the customers had to get his 10 year old son to doctor in Richmond and they still didnt make accommodations for him. Now it is 9 pm and we were supposed to board at 8:45 pm but low and behold it is late and wont be here until 9:36 pm. This airline is pure trash and I dont recommend.  I hope the upper management reads this and strongly looks at how they choose to operate their business and not continue to screw people over. I will never ever never ever use their airline and I hope that jobs are lost over this post.

This was the worst airline ever. They change my times eight times at least before we got to get on our flight in one day. When we finally got on our flight the plane was sitting there for at least 30 minutes. They said it was due to weather but the weather was up north and the airport was still clear. I had a connecting flight in Chicago and the Chicago plane was with American Airlines again and they were an hour late so my new time to fly was 9:02 and we arrived at 9:20 and I saw my flight still at the gate but they wouldn’t let me in because they close the gate. They told me that I can reschedule to tomorrow since it was too late at night. They wouldn’t pay for a hotel or they wouldn’t even pay for a little bit for food. They didn’t even apologize or anything they just told me that it wasn’t their fault. It was not a good customer service and i was really disappointed.

Seoul to Dallas Fort Worth. I contacted the customer relation and been emailing back and forth with them regarding the situation that my family and I had came across on July 30,2019. All we get back in response was an apologize and a reply kept saying thank you for our feedback and they will use this feedback to improve. I am very disappointed with AA. When we arrived at ICN airport from Vietnam, we were greeted by ICN staff at our gate as we landed. The staff helped all the passenger that is flying to Dallas on the flight AA0280 to get to the gate as soon as possible so we wouldn’t be late for our departure. There was 29-39 of us running across every terminals along with the staff trying to rush. The staff even called AA staff from the gate to let them know we’re on the way. As we arrived at the gate with AA0280, there was about 25 more minutes to departure but AA refused to let anyone from our flight onto AA. Their reasoning was unacceptable! They said we’re late and we have no document from our previous flight stating why we were late. There was other individuals passenger from a different flight was still able to get on board with AA. They allowed those individuals but not anyone from flight KE0686. We were not late for our flight with AA and their gate was still open. We were treated unfairly and their reasoning was unacceptable. My family and I brought our tickets with AA with a reserved seats. They had no reason to refuse to let us on unless they gave up our seating without our permission. AA is known for overbooking passengers on their flight.  The flight we brought is from Korean to Dallas but they exchanged our ticket from Korea to San Francisco to Dallas. We had to recheck all our luggage again at San Francisco. All the trouble they put us through was not right. We did not brought our ticket to go through all this trouble. We were suppose to work that morning that we arrived on 7/31/19 but because we were so overwhelmed and exhausted from all the trouble that AA put us through we were not able to make it to work. AA is not taking responsible for their wrong. They said our flight was late, which it was not late for AA. If we were late, why are other passengers able to get on 10 minutes after us? Something doesn’t sound right. “Under the federal rules, passenger is entitled to cash compensation, not just a voucher, and a seat for a later on flight. The fit was a bit tighter than I'd have liked, but that's the drawback of booking economy. What I want to actually review is the fact that they were super accommodating just this week as I tried to change my flight. I planned on heading out the week after but an unexpected death in the family changed my plans. The airline was willing to work with me to move up my travel date without any cancellation or other fees, as I'd originally booked under basic economy. There was a small upgrade fee, but nowhere near as much as we'd feared it would be. I'm just happy I get to go to the funeral and that they were able to work around various schedules to get me there.

Flying both in and out of country has been a nightmare that can only be attributed to American Airlines. I had 3 connecting flights with them, and only 1 has gone as it should. My first flight was delayed due to emergency on the runway, that’s fine, what isn’t fine is being pushes aside for a rebooking the day after and getting the worst customer service I have ever received in my life. Then, the flight the next day (they rebooked) they were delayed about 2 hours because their plane wasn’t loaded with oxygen tanks for the pilots and they had to go get them. Threw off all pickup timing and car rentals. To rewind, Dallas has some of the worst reps I’ve ever spoken to and push any question you have away, from hotel stay to rebooking, to make you call their website. Pretty much useless and immediately dismissive. I will call and try and work out something but this was my experience so far and I would hate for others to go through the same ordeal. Will update if anything changes.

Not Verified |  Lynchburg to Dallas via Charlotte. This was my first time flying American and there were several concern and problems. I brought a medical device and they made me check and pay for my carry-on. When I arrived at baggage claim there was a text saying it was at the baggage service desk. When I got there, one person said it was lost and another said it came early at another terminal. After waiting to see if it came with my flight since there was confusion, I had to go to the other terminal. I asked it they could bring it to me as I have a bad back and they said no. All in all, I was not happy with this airline. And they made me check my medical device at the plane. They labeled it fragile and watched the man bounce it up the stairs to the plane.

Not Verified |  My flight from Baltimore to Charlotte was delayed by 2 Hours and my return flight from CLT to BWI cancelled (Monday morning). I was supposed to go to work on Monday morning but missed because of flight cancellations and reschedule. I opened up a ticket with customer service to get a refund as I had to incur loss of pay. After few days I got a call from AA customer service, lady on the phone started conversation with a lie that my flight was delayed only for half hour when it delayed for more than 2 hours and didn't even mention about cancellation, on top of that she says she is doing me favor by adding 750 miles to my account. I am the one who suffered with the delay and AA customer representative says she is doing me favor. In total my whole journey is better stated as a bad experience, no value to customers, flight delays and frustration.

Boston to Los Ángeles. This has been the worst airline experience of my life. American Airlines made me miss my National Soccer tournament and the customer service was absolutely horrible. The airline did not help or give any reassurance that I would be able to make my games on time and I did not make them thanks to their lack of support and failure to help me find a new flight. Never flying on American Airlines again and recommend other people read this and follow my steps. Thanks for nothing American Airlines you really know how to ruin someone’s day!

Columbus to LaGuardia. Completely and utterly disappointed at the complete lack Of customer service interaction with American Airlines. Over the 4th of July my wife and I flew from Columbus, Ohio to LaGuardia like we do every year, non stop. The night before our fight is to leave our flight gets canceled. After spending over 3 hours straight on hold and still not a live person, we hung up after finding out we weren’t able to get on another flight to go home until the day after we were suppose to leave. Even though we booked non stop flights not only did they book us on connecting flights, but they had us flying out of Newark. Needless to say we ended up canceling our flight and renting a car to just drive home. Unfortunately it doesn’t end there. Now my wife is back in New York with our youngest son and stuck at the airport! She was suppose to fly out last night but the flight got canceled. So now after sitting on the runway, literally, cause they were told they’re waiting on pilots, before literally taking off they announce they’re having engine troubles. So now they’re heading back to the gate and she is going to have to try and arrange something for tomorrow now because like 2 weeks ago American booked her on a connecting flight instead of non stop and now she has missed her connecting flight. Who knows when she will be able to catch a single hour flight to come home, because American has treated this flight like she’s flying halfway around the world. Bottom line, there’s not a single person in this world that could GIVE my wife and I a free American Airlines ticket to anywhere in the world! Your customer service is by far the worst we’ve ever experienced!

Not Verified |  Tampa to Syracuse via Philadelphia. As I write this I am spending the night in Philadelphia's airport which is supposedly an American Airlines Hub. I flew from Tampa to Philly for a connection to Syracuse Thursday July 18th. My 9:52pm connection to Syracuse was cancelled at 3pm as I was walking into Tampa's airport due to "weather". I knew then I was going to have to drive to arrive in Syracuse for a Friday morning Funeral. What I didn't expect was a rude desk attendant at the gate and at customer service in a Philadelphia airport surrounded by a beautiful sunset - no apparent weather issues in sight. I spent over $250 on a one way car rental (and an hour trying to find a one way car rental) and drove the 5 hours to arrive in Syracuse at 2:30am. American Airlines booked me on the first flight to Syracuse Saturday the 20th at 3:20pm. Fast Forward to today, July 22nd and I am scheduled to leave Syracuse at 6:57pm, delay till 7:20 ... 7:31 take off. Preparing to run to my connecting gate but - no need - when we hit the ground I get notified my flight is delayed until 11:06pm. And then cancelled. I immediately call and am offered the first flight to Tampa 10:30 something am - nope wait can't have that one, its booked. The next I have available is 4:06pm! I asked if there was an any other flight to any Florida airport in the morning - no. Great, I am booked and get to spend the next 18 hours in an airport. I get on American's Website and find a 6am flight to Orlando and purchase - then call to have the associate fix this mess and she scolds me for booking the flight - saying I should have just called them for help. Wait - while I am going thru this mess my Mother is stuck overnight in O'Hare with a similar American Airlines epic-mess and has to go through the same thing. American will not reimburse the car I rented, they will not pay for me to have a hotel room tonight - there are "snacks and cots" available in the airport. Gone are the days of vouchers, this is all "God's will" and "weather related". Going forward I will pay twice as much for a plane ticket from another airline, I will never fly American Airlines again, if it is the only flight available I would rather rely on my good old fashioned feet to get me there faster then an American Airlines Plane.

Not Verified |  Bangor to Washington. Terrible customer service. Flight got cancelled, stayed another night in Maine, come to the airport at 4am for the flight to get delayed so badly that we missed our connecting. Had to get home for family emergency. Last year we flew American to Utah and had a connection in Dallas where our flight got cancelled. It was Christmas Eve. Our group divided and didn’t get home until Christmas Day. They cancel flights often and good customer service does not follow.

This has been my first ever experience with American Airlines and it was not a good one. My first leg of travel from Erie, PA (ERI) to Tampa, FL (TPA) via Charlotte, NC (CLT) was uneventful and smooth. I arrived on time with my baggage and was quite happy with the service of the agents, flight attendants and crew. My journey home was another matter. First let me begin by saying that I understand that the airline industry cannot control the weather. Mother Nature decided to throw a fit and cover TPA in thunderstorms and lightning for several hours causing the airport to close which resulted in my missing the connection in CLT to ERI. No worries. I contacted the gate agent who quickly re-booked me onto the first flight out from CLT to ERI the next morning at 11:30am. As I had arranged hotel accommodations in Charlotte, I inquired as to how I could retrieve my bags upon arrival in CLT. She told me to simply contact the gate agent upon arrival and my bags would be retrieved for me to take to the hotel. This is NOT what happened! Upon arriving at CLT, I did contact the gate agent about my bags and was instructed to go to the baggage claim area and speak to the agent in the baggage office. I did so. There were a few people in line ahead of me inquiring about the location of their missing bags and I could quickly see how one agent was doing everything in her power to locate them, while my agent seemed to feel that the passengers (including myself) were simply a nuisance to her existence. Without effort in actually locating my bags, she informed me that she had no idea where my bags might be and did little to attempt to locate them. A baggage handler in the office was looking over her shoulder at the computer screen, asked me if my flight had landed yet! then shrugged his shoulders like, “Oh well” When I told her that I had hotel accommodations and simply needed my bags retrieved from the plane I just de-boarded so that I had clean clothing and toiletries, she handed me a complimentary American Airlines toiletry bag (which is its own review). The following morning, I arrived at the airport at 9am, passed through TSA screening and arrived at my gate with time to spare. Our plane was boarded and all passengers and crew quickly assessed that the air conditioning wasn’t quite up to par. We were de-planed and told that the air conditioning would be fixed, or another plane would be provided. Our flight was now delayed. Approximately 2 hours later, we were again seated on the plane only to be told that, again, the air conditioning was not functioning correctly and the crew was “timed out”. Our flight was now cancelled. There was one more flight to ERI from CLT that day, but it was full. I was able to arrange for a seat on the next flight to Cleveland. This meant that I had to impose upon a relative to drive 2 hours to Cleveland and another 2 hours home. Upon arrival at the terminal for the flight to Cleveland, I quickly noticed the difference in accommodations for passenger travelling to Cleveland versus those for passengers travelling to Erie. The seats in the waiting area were more comfortable and were equipped with charging stations for personal electronics, while Erie passengers were seated in worn, cramped, and uncomfortable seats with smaller charging stations (with access for 6 devices) in the waiting area.

Not Verified |  New York to Pittsburgh. Being a nervous flyer already, our Pilot was exceptional at LGA airport flight 4600 on July 21st. He cracked jokes as he prepared us to be sitting on the runway for quite some time, he updated us as status changed and throughout the flight. He was so down to earth and keeping us in the know helped calm my nerves very much !! He was the best pilot I've ever had. The seats were great and comfortable, I was overall very pleased.

Norfolk to Phoenix via Charlotte. Check in at Norfolk was easy. Staff were helpful. We do not usually expect much. Flights loaded easily and departed on time. Service on board was efficient. We did order a sandwich and it was not very good. Seems like that shouldn't be that hard to do as the prepackaged foods in the airport can be quite good. Overall, everything was very smooth. The worst part was that we actually arrived in Phoenix early (!) but could not get to the gate because it was blocked by equipment.

Weather delays, cancellations with no assistance with rebooking, cost more to book new flights, wasted food and beverage coupons, no concern with my safety or well-being by stranding me in the airport over night by myself, then more delays, missed flights, and total inconvenience of 14 hours and hundreds of dollars. Just in case you were wondering what American Airlines response to their terrible customer service on July 18 -19th. Please free the read and share. Be cautious when using them in the future ladies and gentlemen, they don't care about you. You are just another number.

Los Angeles to Kona. American Airlines has horrible service! My family and I flew to Kona Hawaii (flights 59, and 58). On the way there we were told that the flight had limited food items, and it would not be a sufficient amount to serve everyone. This was proven, as every item on the menu was not available. Also the flight attendants seemed bothered when asked for service/assistance. Once we arrived to Kona, we discovered that all of our new luggage was damaged (deep scrapes and scratches, and a thick black tar substance that would not wipe off). I was told that I would need to file a claim, which I did (including photos). I spoke to a supervisor in the baggage department of customer service. He asked that I reply to his email with photos for a second time. He stated that he would review the information and contact me with a resolution, of which he never did. I called to follow up with him, and was told that he was on another call and he'd call me right back. As of the writing of this review, he still has not followed up with me. On the flight home, it was the same issue, not enough food for everyone. They did not have any of the requested items on their menu. Furthermore, the plane was nasty and it appeared that they did not clean trash left from several previous customers. I would not recommend AA.

New York to Atlanta via Washington. I was flying from NYC with 2 children, one of whom has severe eczema and mild allergies, and whose meds wasn't allowed in the carry on and thrown in to the trash by TSA. Our nightmare had began. So, I was on a deadline to get home in Atlanta. Then, the gate attendant informed us that there is no more space in the overhead bin that we have to check in our carry on. We touched down in DC under sunny skies with 40 minutes to make our connection flight and immediately the pilot announced that all outbound flights are grounded due to incoming inclement weather but no to worry about connections since everything is grounded. Meanwhile I have not any updates from AA trough text, Although we signed up for it. The nightmare got worse when a dozen passengers or so going to Atlanta were prevented from boarding the shuttle (a 2 minute bus ride) to the next concourse, where our flight was still waiting, due to adverse weather conditions. We were directed to customer service desk. What occurred there is a classic example of how AA employees treat customers with disdain and condescension. I was informed that I would be put on a flight for the next morning although my flight still on the ground. When I asked her if she could find alternate route for me to get home the same night, she sighed, rolled her eyes, and told me step aside since I didn't want to be helped. I was also informed that the airlines will not help with hotel or meals and that I and the kids were on our own. This is the 3rd time AA has done this me and one of those times I was in a foreign country. I've come to believe that these aren't isolated incidents but inherent to the way AA does business. As much as it is under my power, I will not fly with American Airlines.

Richmond to Salt Lake City via Chicago. I was to leave RIC at 0740 EST and arrive in ORD at 0853 CDT. Then from ORD at 1030 CDT with an arrival at 1223 MDT in SLC. Because of weather my flight to ORD was delayed. They automatically rebooked me because the delay was until 1228 EST. Which would have caused me to miss my original connection flight in ORD to SLC. They booked me to go to DFW. But, I wasn’t given a seat. I was told to talk to someone in ORD to get my seat. Then from DFW I was connecting there to finish up in SLC at 0032 MDT. Which was 12 hours later than the original final destination arrival time. Well I got to ORD to find out they canceled my flight to DFW. They rebooked me from ORD to SLC at 2045 CDT. With an arrival of 2230 MDT. I was delayed again. I finally left ORD at 2130 CDT and arrived in SLC at 0002 MDT. Just to find out my luggage was missing. Didn’t know where. They said they would call me when it is found. I understand weather is uncontrollable. However, American Airlines didn’t try to make me comfortable. I sat in the airport for over 12 hours not even knowing if I was going to get home. The gates kept changing. The flights kept changing. And, I was so lost. I was scared and upset. There was no communication except through email. Customer service was definitely not around. And, on flights pretzels and soft drinks are not acceptable as the only option. Especially when you know people have been shuffling around with no direction. Also, my seats were bad, the air didn’t flow, and it was extremely tight quarters. Old plane. Not fun!! Let’s just say, I did not enjoy my trip with American Airlines.

New York to Cincinnati. All the time this airline has delays, today is 2 hours, I swear that this is the last time I use this garbage of airline. And the customer service is the worst - nobody knows anything.

Salt Lake City to Oklahoma City via Dallas. In Dallas / Fort Worth airport: I had to check in my carry on because I was told there was no room in the overhead storage bins (they were all full). As the flight was preparing for take off, I noticed that four storage bins were completely empty. I was not happy. On my return trip, I had another layover at the Dallas/ Fort Worth airport. There was a problem with my ticket as I was trying to make my connecting flight. I told the person at the information booth upon leaving the airplane about my problem. She was impatient with me and told me to go to the boarding gate. I went to the gate as instructed with 36 minutes before boarding. There was no one at the booth. When I went to board with my problem ticket, the person checking tickets was irritated with me telling me I should have talked to someone before boarding. I was tired from the previous flight. I did not need to be treated this way.

Greenville to San Diego via Dallas. Worst experiences with this airline and i’m done with them if I can ever get off this tarmac. On my flight out here i had a one hour layover that turned into a 4hr layover. I didn’t end up to my hotel until close to 1am and had to get up for work 4hrs later. Now on my way back to San Diego I had a one hour layover again and i’ve been stuck on the plane on the tarmac for 2hrs with no end in sight. They told us at first we didn’t have pilots and then that we had a bad tire. They also oversold every plane I was getting on both ways and EVERY trip was delayed at least 30 mins just trying to get people to sell their seats. They offer a voucher for about $450 and just wait. If people don’t take it after 10-15mins they up they voucher offer. I seen this go on for 45mins. Did I talk about how I got my luggage back minus the handle i gave it to them with?

Salt Lake City to Orlando. I fly once a month or more for work. Occasional plans change and I change or cancel my reservation. I’ve never had a problem canceling and receiving a refund if I cancel it within 24 hours of when it was booked. I needed to cancel an American flight within 5 hours of booking they cancelled if just fine but then refused to process my refund. I was stunned I spent 2 hours trying to get ahold of someone but they refused to help me and best they were willing to do was rebook it. I’ve canceled well over 10 flights within the 24 hour window and this is the first time I’ve been given grief. Very frustrating. I would like to say I’ll never fly American again however sometimes it’s my only option. But I will say this they will be the last option for the indefinite future I’d even choose frontier and spirit over them.

On July 15th, flight #1835 C17 from Dallas to Las Vegas has been cancelled after delaying for 2 hours. We got passes for waiting list for gate C29 where all the unprofessional behavior started. The supervisor started yelling to us why we went there and we have to remain quiet without asking questions! Of course we have not been in the second flight and when we asked what is the next step, the supervisor of AA said that she will call the police! She said that she’s working for 12 years at the AA and no one will touch her for her behavior! Finally we left unhelpful from C29 and went back to C17 where an agent gave us new boarding pass for another flight after 3 hours. Total delay 6 hours. But the point is the unprofessional and unacceptable behavior of the supervisor who believes that she owns the company. I have never dealt with a worse customer service and worse employee in my life. What a disgrace for the company keeping people like her dealing with customers. Never again with AA we are family of 4.

Pittsburgh to Montego Bay via Charlotte. Cancelled , delayed flights rebooked not till days later return flight worse delays circling airport flew to Raleigh for fuel back to Charlotte to circle more landed sat for 20 minutes till gate disembark no food available, no customer service. We flew out of Jamaica at 12:30 pm arrived at Charlotte 8:00pm ( that’s 7 1/2 hours it’s a 3 1/2 hour flight) left Charlotte 10:00 pm arrived in Pittsburgh at 12:00 am . no customer service no food given to us the entire trip This trip took longer than it should have we traveled with a child. No excuses would not recommend American Airlines

Across 6 flights I had an issue every time! 1st flight: seat didn’t recline and tray table didn’t stay up 2nd flight: was charged for baggage twice and never refunded, was told the matter was closed and I would not be compensated 3rd flight: i booked these flights for someone else and they had to be changed. 36 hours, 4 phone calls and a visit to the help desk at the airport (was told to do that) saw me having to forfeit the total cost of the flights. Not one person wanted to help, they kept pointing me in another direction until it was impossible to change anything due to the time. 4th flight: what was meant to be a 90 minute flight was a delayed flight that had me sitting in the aircraft for 8hours! No food was available due to it being a ‘short haul’ flight. 5th flight: my partner had a direct flight from NY to Miami at 7:30 am, with no notice they changed it to a connecting flight to Atlanta at 2:30pm, this flight kept getting delayed and no one wanted to help him get to his destination without being stuck in Atlanta. He eventually got on a 7:30pm flight! 6th flight: the power point in my seat didn’t work. The response from ‘customer service’ is appalling! I was overcharged and treated badly.

Washington to Charlotte. The customer service was disappointing. The customer rep from DCA to CLT was more interested in others conversation than to me, who was in front of her, talking to her. In addition, the look she gave me, was like I was bothering her, although I was paying for an upgraded seat.

Boston to Cancun via Philadelphia. American Airlines sent me a text at 5:45 pm on Saturday July 6th telling me my flight at 5:15 Boston to Philly was cancelled but the flight Philly to Cancun was not. They put me on hold for hours, missed my friend's wedding reception. We left from Boston and flew 6:30 and we would leave Miami at 3:15. That also got cancelled. We had an 11 hr lay over and not slept so we got a hotel to sleep for a while. We spoke with a pilot who was called in to fly another flight to Cancun and he looked into it and told us it was a crew issue. He said they did not have a crew to fly the plane. We got to the resort at 10:00pm and lost a whole day. American Airlines Customer service are telling me it was weather related and will not compensate us. I will never fly American again.

Manchester to Quito via Philadelphia / Miami. A 3-leg journey supposed to take 18 hours. First flight (MAN-PHL) ended up delayed by 2 hours as we had to return to gate to rearrange the luggage due to an issue with "centre of gravity". This meant I missed my connection in Philadelphia (and consequently all of my subsequent connections!). Airline staff were pleasant and organised me a hotel for the evening and replacement flights for the following day. PHL to MIA was very successful with the flight fulfilling my very basic requirement of travelling from one place to another relatively on time. Miami to Quito however was not so successful. It was announced 10 minutes prior to departure that there was going to be at least a 2 hour delay due to waiting for a replacement pilot! This time got gradually later and later. Finally arrived in Quito however at this point had missed my ongoing flight. As this had been booked separately from AA they offered no help for me to rearrange. Only positive about this airline is the really helpful flight attendants who I would commend. Nearly every review talks about delayed and cancelled flights - really take this into account, especially if you have transfers! Definitely worth paying a bit more to go with a more reliable airline in future.

Not Verified |  Atlanta to Dallas via Corpus Christi. The staff refused to help my partner and I with Hotel accommodations that ATL promised us to due to our delayed flight caused by mechanical errors. Told us we could camp out in the terminal until the next day and mentioned we could go online to find hotels without means of transportation. Finally spoke to someone from AA Customer Service who did, in fact, confirm that mechanical errors automatically provide paying customers with hotel accommodations. By the time we reached the phone agent, the staff literally left the premises and did not return to us and left two of her desk agents to help us out. What a sorry excuse of a Supervisor.

Not Verified |  We booked flights in January 2019 to Fairbanks for June 23 and a return flight from Vancouver for July 7. In late January or early February 2019 the return flights were cancelled, likely due to the grounding of the 737 MAX planes. We got those flights re-booked and about three days later the departing flights were cancelled and also had to be re-booked. This made us very nervous. The new flight times, the connections and layovers were much worse than the originals but the seats were good. Very few options were offered so we took what we could get. A delay was encountered on June 23 in Chicago. No food was on board and our Seattle flight was delayed for an hour. Thanks to a Seattle layover this did not cause us to miss a flight. When we showed up at the gate in Vancouver on July 7 we were directed to a gate agent who offered another change to Greenville with connections through DFW that they said would be great and save us a connection, a long layover and nine hours. We jumped at the chance to get home early with the understanding that the flight was not overbooked. We were then directed to get seat assignment at the gate. The Vancouver to DFW seating was terrible (last row, 30 A/B). The Greenville seats had me in 30F and my wife in 21 F. Those were great seats. Not. We were deceived at the gate by a the agent and his supervisor. The Vancouver to Dallas AA 979 leg on the return of this flight boarded and was ready to take off when the flight crew again announced that they did not have enough food (best guess soft drinks) on-board. The flight was delayed for over one hour while the crew waited for the caterer. This delay almost made me miss my connection to Greenville SC. The flight attendants handed out soft drinks like candy. The rest room lines were long and disruptive. We have never been so glad to get off of a flight in our lives. After being asked the flight attendants reluctantly asked passengers whose destination was DFW to stay seated so those with tight connections could disembark. Some complied, others did not. WHAT is going on at American? They seem to have cheap flights but not much else. They claim to be the largest carrier in the world. They need to concentrate on customer service and satisfaction.

San Antonio to Dallas via Indianapolis. I don't like American Airlines. I have always found them to be rude and unhelpful. Checked in online before I got to the airport. Went to the rude ticked counter agent who told me I had to check in again. She refused to print a boarding pass. So I asked her what she was there to do. Apparently it was to put my bag on a conveyor belt. So whatever on that. Can't fix rude customer service people. I feel it in my heart that she had something to do with my bag getting lost. She had a spiteful attitude about her - if I pay 30.00 for my luggage I expect it to arrive with me intact. I left from San Antonio to Dallas. The gate where we landed was C11 and I was flying out of C10 to Indianapolis. 30+ minutes in between flights. I get to Indianapolis, no bag. I did receive a text from American saying that the bag was lost. I was not able to talk to a lost bag clerk because I had a shuttle waiting for me. I then go to the link in the text and start to fill out a claim-  link is not working. I call 30 minute wait time. I guess this is how American airlines likes to operate. I only flew them because the company I work for bought the tickets.

We booked our honeymoon flight to Orlando with American Airlines and we were truly disappointed. The flight itself was not bad. However, seats are not assigned but rather purchased at ridiculous prices at check in. We forgot to check in 24 hours before our flight home and almost every seat was taken by the time we realized we hadn't checked in. Our only option to sit next to each other was in the emergency exit row and pay $81 each! If we didn't want to sit next to each other, we would have to pay $78. Why are we paying for a seat? Isn't that what the ticket was for? Checking in early allows you to pick a seat at $15-$20 but why were we "punished"? We will not be flying AA anytime soon.

Not Verified |  Do not fly American Airlines! Our trip to and from Myrtle Beach was a disaster! They cancelled our flight home, we ended up having to spend the night in a hotel ($160 which we had to pay for) and flying to an airport two hours away from home. We then had to rent a car (another $165) and drive home. The AA representatives are extremely unhelpful and rude. I have flown other airlines and have never had an issue.

Kansas City to Charlotte. The flight was on time and soon as we are supposed to be boarding they pushed the boarding back 15 minutes talking about its a storm so they will let up know something at 5pm then text messages come to my phone saying departure is at 515 and then another came through shortly after with a departure time of 530. Once again shortly after that another message comes through saying that departure at 8pm then someone comes over the speaker stating that know there is maintenance issues and the flight is cancelled and we need to make are way to the outside counter to reschedule the flight because they was closing their counter. Rescheduled my flight for 12hrs later and they did not provide hotel or anything for the inconvenience if it was a maintenance issues as they stated. Definitely will not fly with them if i can help it.

Philadelphia to Chicago. Never again will this airline get my business. Delayed 3x and then cancelled with NO help for accommodations from the very airline who caused the problem. NO weather problems. The return flight was delayed, bumped, and finally my seats were given to standby with the call center saying we were checked in and ready, and the counter agent saying another. Absolutely zero help in any way. Their solution? Sleep in the airport. With my kids?! I found another airline with the route we needed standing right there at the American check in counter. Will I see a penny of these cancelled and delayed flights? I doubt it, so as far as I'm concerned, this airline is run by thieves.

Houston to Los Angeles. In Houston airport for 25 hours, they keep changing the depart time and no explanation. Not even once they explained whats going on, not even one of them asked if we need anything, its 10 of us and they keep delaying our flight.

London to Columbus via New York. I landed into JFK on time. While waiting for my connecting flight to CMH, it was delayed twice, then cancelled. I was rebooked the following day and had to pay for my own hotel since it was claimed to be 'weather' despite the fact that other airlines did not cancel the same route. I woke at 3 AM for my rebooked 5:45 AM flight to find that it was cancelled as well and rebooked for 2 days after the original flight. I was forced to rent a car and drive 9 hours to Columbus, OH in order to make a very important appointment on Tuesday, July 9th when my flight was originally scheduled for Saturday, July 6th. I am ashamed that in the future, I will have to fly a foreign airline in order to ensure that I get where I need to go. I will not risk flying with American again. This event overshadowed the fact that the seat was uncomfortable, the cabin staff rude and the food disappointing. This was a truly horrible experience.

I will never buy a ticket again with AA! I don't care if I pay more but I will book with an airline that really cares for people. My husband (in the navy) made it to the USA for his birthday, but thank you to American Airlines we could not be together, my flight was cancelled. It is not just today! In the last 2 months, my flight was cancelled twice. Last time it was cancelled in Boston. I missed two days at work (but AA seems does not care ).

Left Jackson, MS at 4.30pm and was scheduled to land at DFW with connecting flight to Burbank, CA. We got about 175 miles out of Dallas and were told there was a big thunder storm and we would have to circle. All departing flights were cancelled. After about 30 minutes, we were diverted to San Antonio for refueling. We sat on the tarmac for almost 2 hrs, were not allowed to deplane. The crew provided little or no information about other connections, but they were very clear that American Airlines would not cover overnight stay. We finally reached Dallas at 9.30pm. There was no one to help us reschedule our flights or help with hotel rooms and the ticketing counters were all closed. Passengers who checked their bags in the jetway (for no cost) were able to retrieve them. Those of us dummies who played by the rules and paid $30 to check a bag were told our luggage had to go all the way to the destination. I argued with an AA "Customer Service" agent in baggage that I needed the cpap machine in my bag, but she just quoted airline policy. I made my own hotel reservation, paid $50 for a taxi, repeated that the next morning, and flew back to Jackson, a flight I arranged on my own from my hotel room. No one from American Airlines tried to be helpful or provide any information, even to the poor young woman whose 1yr old baby was crying from hunger. Never again.

❎ Not Verified | Myrtle Beach to Charlotte, via San Francisco, was delayed due to weather for about an hour and a half. So some genius decided to keep the connecting flight from Charlotte to San Fransisco in regular schedule despite connecting flight from Myrtle Beach to Charlotte was delayed. Instead of delaying the flight from Charlotte to San Fransisco to allow passengers to get to San Fransisco the same night, we were scheduled to catch the flight going out the next day. Now that's flight management.

Flight from Charlottesville to New York. Starts with 2hrs delay, at the airport they notified other 2 hrs, 10 minutes before boarding time they canceled the flight! I lost my connection to Europe putting me in a lot of troubles and they didn't care at all. Staff rude and incompetent. They usually cancel flights without any notification. I will never fly with them again!

Not Verified |  On the morning of June 21st, I booked 2 tickets on my computer. I choose the date of June 23rd as our travel date. I clearly saw June 23rd on my screen. I checked my email inbox for ticket confirmation directly following and for the next 10 or 15 minutes. I did not have time to keep checking as I had to leave for a funeral. The tickets were $385.20 total, $192.60 each. We arrived at the airport at 5am for our 6:08am flight on June 23rd only to be told we had no flight scheduled that day and that the flight was scheduled for July 14th! We were in total shock! We explained to the counter woman that there must have been a computer clitch and that we would not just show up for a flight three weeks early. To our additional shock, she did not care whatsoever, told us it was our fault, that our ticket was non refundable, and that it would now be an additional $501.60 each to fly. With the long line and having to be on that flight for a business meeting, we gave her our credit cards. As a flier of AA for 35-40 years we were shocked and upset to be treated this way. We explained to multiple people at the airport and on the phone trying to get help and no one would help us. It's been weeks since we emailed customer relations with no acceptable response. We are now at a point where we believe AA has created a system to intentionally lock out customers from getting timely help and a way to steal money from its customers. AA does not care about us as people or future customers. It's hard to believe AA would be ok with its good customers paying $694.20 each for a ticket that should have been $192.60 each for a computer clitch. If at all possible, do not fly American Airlines!

Phoenix to Philadelphia. My son and I were scheduled to fly to Philadelphia in May, 2019. The night before, my son came down with severe stomach flu, throwing up a dozen times in just a few hours. Our flight was booked to leave at 6 am the next morning and there was no way my son would be able to make it. I called AA and was told that unless his illness was critical, I would have to make the flight or lose my $800 air fare. I stated that I was uncomfortable subjecting my son and the passengers to this flight. I was then told that I could take my son to the gate and have him evaluated. I couldn't believe it. Their solution was to have me get my sick son up at 4am, go to the airport, go through checkin and TSA, and finally get to the gate and have airline employees evaluate whether my son was too sick to fly. I was shocked. I chose not to subject my son to the flight, and the passengers to the stomach flu and I lost over $800 in airfare. I'm an Advantage member and I sent an email to AA about this situation. I received an automated email stating that I would get a response back from AA within 10 days. At the time of this review, it has been over 3 weeks, and no response.

Chicago to Sacramento. We had 3 delays and once the plane arrived and de-boarded we were told a half hour later there were no pilots. We then had to wait an additional hour and by the time we actually took off we were stuck on the runway for another hour. We had a ride in Sacramento that had to wait until 11 pm to pick us up. No voucher or anything for constant delays. We fly out of Dubuque to Chicago and its constant delays or cancellations, passengers are often bumped for more important John Deere executives. This flight we had to either choose a 1hr layover (which would never happen) or a 5hr layover which turned into an 8 hr layover. Profits over people seem to be the norm. A little pre-planning and routing logistics could solve that problem, it's just you don't care and there is no governing body that cares. Were hoping the possible Amtrack that is in the future will eliminate the use of flights, at least there on time. That or drive to Madison and take Frontier, they are always on time.

Springfield to Dallas via Phoenix. This airline is consistently behind and what's worse is how little they seem to care about how they drastically affect people's travel plans. There announcements lack clarity or empathy. We waited for 2 hours 10 min. and 1 hour was simply because they did not plan adequately for a pilot. Similar scenarios have happened to my wife and I often. We have flown Delta with far fewer issues. It really seems like AA is a minor league team trying to play in the big leagues. They could learn a few things about customer relations and service from Delta and Southwest.

Dallas to Vancouver. They cancelled my flight 6 hours before departure, rebooked for 4 days later nothing they could do about early flight. We end up going home one day after with another company paid for a last minute one-way ticket way more expensive than our original tickets. So after a month fight with American Airlines they finally approved a partial refund for the service they never realized. The only problem they did a partial refund to a Mastercard. I do not have, never had a MasterCard. Even so, I already told them 9 times I do not have a MasterCard they keep telling me there is nothing they can do because by regulation they must refund the money to the same method of payment. I paid with the only credit card I have, a Visa, but no one in America Airlines can understand they have a problem on their file.

Changed Flights multiple times then at last minute they send text that we will not have time to make the connecting flight to Tennessee. Rescheduled flight to Tennessee and instead of originally flying right out of Charlotte we had a 4.50 hr layover. Had to change our rental car pickup multiple times and it ended up costing extra due to all the changes. Now flying home they give us 30 min to try and get from terminal 5 to the Commuter terminal at LAX and if you have tried that it’s very unlikely. Will not change flight to something with a reasonable connecting flight unless we pay 50000 air miles each. Worst customer service I have ever had with an airline! Will get rid of the air miles AA Advantage Card and card and stick with our other airline! Called multiple times to try and resolve this issue and like I said before they wanted 50000 more air miles to change flight or a lot of money! I would love to see them consistently make the transfer from terminal 5 to the Commuter terminal and to deal with all the flight change BS and extra costs to the consumer! Unacceptable

❎ Not Verified | Dallas to Fayetteville via Charlotte. A warning to soldiers and their families transferring to Ft Bragg. Do not rely on American Eagle between Charlotte and Fayetteville. They are consistently inadequate and they lack accountability. I recommend using another airline to travel to Raleigh Durham and driving in.

Not Verified |  Greenville to Phoenix via Dallas. I have flown throughout Europe, the United States, and South America, and they are by far the worst airline ever.  I have never seen such rude, incompetent staff in my life and you cannot trust anything they tell you. I opened a credit card and paid $2000 for a discount credit and bonus miles. But if I'd known I'd be spending the credit on a hotel due to my second canceled flight with American, I never would have opened it. On top of this, they did not give me my bonus miles for spending the $2000 and gave us no compensation for hotel or food when our flight was canceled. They misplaced our luggage on both legs of the trip, and due to maintenance issues on our first plane, we missed our connecting flight. They rerouted us to the smallest airport imaginable in Durango, CO for an extra 3 hours while we tried to make it to Phoenix, although we were promised a direct flight when arriving in DFW. Another AA staff member told us her boss would hang her if she messed up at her job (when trying to book us new tickets for our canceled flight - this also took 40+ minutes). If that is how they treat their own workers, it is no wonder the customers receive such horrible service as well.
