I made the claim about what happened to American before leaving for Bogota on May 13th, by phone at 6:00 am, and through passenger service staff at gate 14 at Miami airport. In both cases I was kindly treated and informed that I have to make the claim through customer relation “aa.com/refunds” attaching the receipts and any relevant document. As I mentioned, all this situation has caused me significant losses that I asked them to be compensated by you as soon as possible but still nothing.

Not Verified |  I have had awful experiences with this airline and will most likely never travel with them again. Back in April 2019 I was traveling to see my family up in Boston. I was 28 weeks pregnant at the time. I was in the airport for 7 hours! My first flight was delayed due to wind (which was understandable). The second flight, everyone had gotten on the plane and after we were all boarded was told that we had to deplane due to the toilet not flushing. So then the third time around we got fully boarded again and then was told they had to inspect the plane(which took 45 min). After that, once again, we had to deplane and were also told that they had to find a plane and weren’t sure we were going to get one. We were told we were going to be fed but never were given anything. Then on the final flight we had to wait 25 min before we could takeoff waiting on other planes to take-off. I wish this was the end of my awful experience with this airline but it isn’t. Now, my sister had booked a flight for July , paid $60 per ticket for ticket changes and $40 for insurance for her and my moms flight in case I went into labor early and they had to change flights. Well, I ended up being diagnosed with icp and need to be induced June 17th. So, since my sister paid for ticket changes she called them to try and change the flight but was told that the $120 that she paid for was “just to skip the line and get on the flight quicker” and because I “wasn’t in the hospital right then they couldn’t make any exceptions.” If I were you I would pick a different airline, they are the cheapest airline around for a reason with no courtesy for any of their customers.

Philadelphia to San Diego. I always forget how much I hate flying American Airlines. They separate you from people you book your flight with on purpose so that their customers have to pay to switch their seats. Then they make me check my bag when there is all this extra cabin space. I’m just annoyed and frustrated at this whole experience. This is why Southwest Airlines is taking over.

Los Angeles to Buffalo via Chicago. What a terrible treatment of passengers. The flight attendant yelled at me for drawing her attention when I asked her a question and she passed me by for water/snack. This is the only airline that has their crews completely ignore the passengers when during leaving the plane. Customer treatment by the flight attendants is ZERO. American Airlines treat passengers like trash. I will not fly American Airlines again.  The Aircraft got delayed, at 1AM departure time, by 30 minutes apparently because it changed to a different runway. At 1AM! Is the Airport busier at 1Am than during the daytime? Because of this 30min delay, we are waiting 7 hours for the next flight home. We are even lucky to have this flight. Another lady has no flight today, and tomorrow she has only one flight where she can do standby. What a terrible airline.

Los Angeles to Buffalo via Chicago. I will never buy another American Airlines ticket. If there is only AA available for my schedule, then I will change my schedule to find another airline. If the price of ticket of another airline is $200 more each way, I will gladly pay extra to avoid American Airlines. This trip, I and my wife are spending the whole day in the airport because the pilot wanted to use another runway to take off from LAX. That delayed the arrival by 30 minutes which made us miss the connecting flight by 10 minutes. The next flight was full, so they put us on standby and there is only one seat available. SO we need to wait another 3 hours. The flight attendants treat the passengers like trash. Thy yell at you. My dog will be staying the whole day alone -- we were supposed to take care of her in the morning. We can not find another dog sitter until we get home ourselves. So, folks, if you purchase American Airline ticket, factor in another full day from point-A to point-B in your itinerary because American Airlines will have delay or cancellation or something, always.

Thank goodness for a short flight from Nashville to Chicago. We were initially sat next to each other, but then on check-in at the gate, the agent asked if we would volunteer to take the next flight an hour later, for $$$ compensation. We agreed, but then on boarding, they announced that they did not need volunteers after all. However, they separated us in different rows, and I was given a middle seat in the last row near the toilets. Thanks for nothing American Airlines, and their attitude was tough luck. There is surely a lesson here. Never volunteer for anything from an airline that charges you for everything. Also, the economy seats on the B737-800 have to be some of the most uncomfortable in the airline industry.

I'm writing this scathing review after 3 back and forth emails with AA's customer disservice team. When your flight matters, when you have a vacation on the line or a critical meeting, and something goes wrong - don't expect AA to lift a finger to make it right. The policy they have shared with me is "If we make an exception for you, we have to make an exception for everyone" - Well that's the point! You should be making things right for every passenger you screwed over on this flight. My flight was AA515 Cancun to Phoenix, final destination Orange County CA. That's ONE connecting flight. Our flight was turned around mid-flight - the captain came on and explained we had mechanical issues. This is terrifying to hear. There was no mention of "this is a minor issue and we are not going to crash and die". People were panicking, praying, crying with stress and panic. We were told we would not receive an alternate flight that day and we would be sent to a hotel and be given dinner and breakfast. Bottom line, the transportation from/to the airport, the hotel, and the food was all unacceptable. We were herded around like cattle with no explanation of what was going on. When we were bussed back to the airport we encountered AA employees who had no idea what our situation was, and when we explained things they didn't care at all. "Next!" So instead of getting another flight set up to handle a full flight of people whose flight was cancelled, they just tried to put everyone wherever they could to fly out of Cancun. We ended up forced into a flight plan that didn't even get us home until the next day! After already missing a day of work over this, and begging our dog sitter to stay another day, we HAD to get home Friday. Their suggested route was Miami/Orlando/Phoenix/Orange County (Saturday). At the ticket counter in Miami, we spoke with the dumbest customer service employee I've ever spoken to, who spoke to himself instead of speaking to us, and he couldn't produce any flight solution that got us within 50 miles of home (that's 4 airports) on Friday. After we worked on our phones for a few minutes we found a flight that he missed and were able to convince him to get us on it. That's literally the rebooking agent's job - and he couldn't do it. Fast forward to Phoenix customer service desk and we realized the whole trip we hadn't sat next to each other - we went to the clerk and asked her if she could help us, after the day we have had, and waive a seat change fee (~$12). NO, she said plainly. This small gesture of courtesy was not even considered. This would have gone a long way in simply showing they care. But they 100% do not care about any of us. When we finally arrive in OC, surprise, or baggage was lost. Speaking to customer support we were told AA was not responsible for any of our $200+ in incidental unexpected charges (receipts provided) for the extra day of travel. They still wouldn't budge on the seat change fees, and now a random unexplained $12.87 charge is on my card that they won't address. They force you into an email only conversations - they claim their structure prevents the need for a supervisor to be involved. That their email team is the highest escalation possible. Speaking to someone in person is not allowed. You will take what they give you and you will like it! Genuinely disgusted by their service and handling of a tough situation that they could have easily rectified.

Savannah to Frankfurt via Charlotte. It has been a week and I am still missing my luggage! Luggage agents stating that there is no communication between the baggage claims at the airports? Switched luggage tags, not booked through destination - too much to all write down! However, sorry to say, incapable personnel, no real communication with the customer. Return calls are under a private number, emails are from unmonitored mailboxes. Sorry AA you need to do better. I am outraged!

Las Vegas to Lafayette. Terrible customer service. Rude, cold agent who refuse to help after flight was cancelled. Sat around the Dallas airport waiting for twelve hours. Had to pay $400 for a hotel. They don't care about anyone. Cold and rude agents that just act like they are Superior to everyone.

Austin to London via Dallas Ft Worth. I have been a very long American Airlines (AA) flyer (since 1993), an American AAdvantage member since 2001, and an AAdvantage credit card holder since 2011. I just went through the worst flying experience I’ve ever had and as a result I’m going to try as hard as I can to avoid AA in the future. This all started with a canceled flight (AA1373) due to weather that actually didn’t impact the flight path at the time. I understand safety concerns, but canceling a flight that’s part of a larger booking literally hours before without a better solution than moving to next day is just not acceptable, and having some of the most incompetent customer support didn’t help our overall situation either. It was a flight from Austin to Dallas as part of another booking to Europe. The reason I know the weather didn’t impact the flight is because I wound up getting a rental car last minute instead and drove the 3 hours to Dallas to make the connecting flight. The communication of the canceled flight was literally hours before the takeoff. My wife and I were lucky enough to find a rental car in time, and after 2-3 hours on the phone making sure we could fly from Dallas (our connecting airport), AA decided to cancel and rebook the flight for the next day mid-drive! Thankfully we were able to get the issue resolved during our drive and at the airport. So, $140 later for the rental car, around 3-4 hours on the phone, and a 3 hour drive later, we made our connecting flight (operated by British Airways). We thought we were done with the horror of this, but on the return flight AA incompetence struck again. We had to wait at the customer assistance desk for BA (who were very helpful) while their ticketing support was on the line with AA for over 45 minutes. AA noted that I had already flown the flight we were at the airport checking-in to. Apparently I am now a time-traveler. We were at the airport over two hours before our flight. However, we didn’t get checked in until 15 minutes before boarding at LHR which is one of the largest airports. We managed to drop off our luggage under 5 minutes before cut-off time, and we made barely made it to our gate despite going through security after our boarding already started. This was all due to our persistence and BA customer service help. The entire trip was stressful, hectic, and AA left us with a horrible taste for their service. We received no refunds for the cancelled flight, no upgrades for having to rent a car and drive instead of flying our initial leg of the journey, nothing for having to be on the phone literally for hours trying to make sure we can fly and fixing the rebooked cancellation, nothing for messing up our bookings while on the phone trying to fix their mistake, nothing for stressing and spending a lot of time at service desks at airports, nothing for running through airports instead of spending quality time and enjoying our trip, no apology, nothing at all. The only silver lining is that we actually made it to where we should eventually and with our luggage, but that was only due to our persistence and BA customer service and help. Since all the years of flying with AA I have seen service degrade while other airlines have only improved theirs. I feel really bad for countless other people who didn’t have the know-how and persistence that we did to fix AA’ mistakes. I hope this review at least shines some light on the incompetence, and hopefully helps others in to make a decision when flying.

Indianapolis to Washington Reagan. Everything went wrong during our team travel to the 2019 NCAA Rowing championships. Wichita to Knoxville with American Airlines. This airline is terrible! Flight delayed at midnight due to something with crew. Of course would never make connection. Wife called and was told nothing they could do. I called back irate and finally the got me on a flight. Upon arriving to Dallas they changed gates 3 times! Not Verified |  Chicago to Los Angeles. I know that inconveniences happen and I try to be patient. However, the lack of service or genuine care from American Airlines is ridiculous. This travel day started fine, but our flight was delayed over 10 times. It resulted in over 24 hours of delayed time. The flight attendants were rude and quoted over the speaker that they had worked a long day too so please don’t be upset. We tried multiple times to refly into Dallas, and eventually ended in Austin. Once there, we were given no guidance to our flight, and the lady at the front desk was stressed and complained to us that they didn’t know what was going on either. Overall, American Airlines has been extremely unprofessional and unreliable, and I will never willingly choose this airline again.

Salt Lake City to Nashville via Dallas. Got up at 0330 to make our 0600 flight. Our first flight was delayed over two hours because some of the flight attendants stayed overnight at a hotel that lost power (um ok). We missed our connecting flight due to this delay. The connection we ended up getting on was cancelled (right after we boarded in the last group) due to some mechanical issue. We somehow managed to get onto a third aircraft that actually got us to our destination. Do you think our checked luggage made it? Nope. Still waiting to have our bags delivered. Fun day all around.

Lihui to Los Angeles. The title pretty much says it all. My husband and I went on a honeymoon to Hawaii. Of course, we were so excited but on the way there, our first flight was delayed, and we missed our connecting flight by less than 5 minutes. As in the plane was still there but they couldn’t let us on. Can they not hold the plane for 5 minutes to let their passengers make their connections? Very frustrating. Then we were told that we couldn’t possibly get to Hawaii for 2 additional days. Luckily, one customer service agent pitied us and managed to get us there late that night (the only nice thing I will have to say about American). Fast forward to the return trip. The same thing happened. In fact, we arrived to LAX with plenty of time to make our connecting flight. However, we were stuck in the plane on the tarmac for an additional 30 minutes and then finally arrived at the gate to find that they had just closed the doors to our connecting flight. So here we are, stuck in LAX all day, and I’m sure it will end with us being screwed yet again by them. Pick another airline, especially if it’s a special trip. Because they will ruin it.

I travelled from Memphis Airport on May 03, 2019. American Airlines prepone my flight from Memphis to Chicago. I missed my flight but staff cooperation was very poor for alloting me new flight tickets. I have noticed that there was no coordination between American Airlines and Qatar Airways with whom I was travelling from Chicago to Delhi. I will never recommend to travel with American Airlines.

Philadelphia to Cancun. Horrible experience. The airline had serviced the plane prior to boarding, then had everyone wait on the plane 2 hours before taking off. No food beverage or ability to get up and stretch was offered. With the competitive prices and horrible planning/service I would not recommend this airline to anyone.

. I was originally supposed to fly from the BWI to STX with connecting flights in between. I showed up at the airport super early because I’m a very punctual person. They cancelled my first flight with no explanation whatsoever and my only option was to find someone to drive me 50 minutes from Baltimore MD to Virginia (DCA airport) to catch a flight from there to MIA (Miami) and from Miami to St. Croix Arriving STX, they didn’t have my bag. The American airline people said it was still in DCA but will arrive the next day. At 3:51pm they called it had arrived. I don’t have a car here and had to wait for a ride. We get there at 6, they people left. Nobody to open the door for me to get my bags and they won’t even answer the phone. What stopped these people when they called to say “your bags are here but we leave at this time”. Now I have to wait till next day again. I literally have nothing to wear. I had a backpack with me with there’s nothing in there to wear outside the house.  I cant even go out. I’m basically stuck inside the house. I paid for my ticket way ahead of time and I paid for my bags. I shouldn’t have to drive an additional 50 minutes to a different airport. I shouldn’t have to wait days for my bags. The last time I fly American is when I return to the states.

Palm Springs to Austin via Phoenix. Every time I fly with any version of this airline there is always a major issue. Sitting on the tarmac for hours and told we have to pay for food and that it’s only free after sitting on the plane for 2 hours. People needed food. It was a 6 hour flight. Right now I’m at the airport and a bunch of us missed our connecting flight by 3 minutes because their first flight was delayed by almost 2 hours. In addition, they wouldn’t take us to the next flight at the other end of the airport. Yet, others were cruising around on the carts in the airport from the same airline. Why? To get them to their flights. I asked. So, when we got to the gate we were told “sorry” and proceeded to watch the plane sit there for another 15 minutes while they booked everyone on another flight. I’m just praying that this next flight which is 4 hours later is on time and not as filthy as the last one. First Class with them is a joke. Greedy, filthy, and lots of untruths.

London to Los Angeles. Unless you overpay for your flight, they assign you the worst seat available such as a middle seat between two vacant aisle & window seats. If you ask for a better seat, they want $55. IFE was out on my May 8th trip and twice before on other flights. At LAX they park their a/c at Terminal 4 and then expect you to walk a mile through a tunnel to the International terminal for customs inspection. In my judgment, if they are going to land at terminal 4 they'd better hire immigration officials to process their planefuls of passengers. Staff are hostile and discourteous. My last three flights on a 777 were less than 1/2-full. They will realise when it's too late that if you do not treat the traveling public with courtesy and respect they will no longer have a public to serve.

Tampa to Santiago via Miami. I had been a loyal AA client for decades but rethinking my plans now. Booked a trip of a lifetime to Chile, business class all the way so we wouldn't arrive "broken" for our hiking adventure. The shortest flight (tampa to miami) was delayed 3X the actual length of the flight. Promised a cart to take us to gate in Miami, even though we were already doomed for connection. Wheelchairs showed up! We could run faster. Missed connection and with standby, stuck in middle seats in economy bulkhead for next flight. Luggage lost for 3 days, including hiking clothes. In spite of this, accidents happen, .but was shocked at refund for change in class of service! I cannot get an AA human being to explain rationale for paltry refund. Would prefer future upgrades on a flight but no one will discuss with us - not in customer service, not in support line, not through credit card! frustration level is through the roof. friends flew on same days, bought tickets at same time, flew economy down/business back and spent $3000 less! We got 10% of that back. a planned do-loop to make sure i go away without any answers. so much for spending the big bucks on a great flight. promised calls back and received 0. will look at other airlines in the future that treat customers right.

I just experienced a recent American "Trip from Hades" leaving the Rapid City Airport (RAP) to fly back to RDU via ORD. We were scheduled to leave on Monday 05/27 after 11:00 AM - the flight got delayed so many times I quit counting. We did get on the plane in the afternoon and sat on the tarmac for 2 hours (the 1st hour was spent without air conditioning or water) only to have to return to the gate (the excuse was related to weather but we are thinking it had something to do with the flight crew exceeding their time limits). The flight finally got canceled after we spent the entire day at RAP. The funny thing was there was no communication from the American gate during this time while the other airlines were constantly keeping their customers up-to-date via the airport's intercom (this is a regional airport so you could hear all the gate communications). We ended up spending the night at the airport since the flight was rescheduled for early the next morning (no vouchers for hotels offered of course!). When we called American customer service early the next day, there was no confirmation that Flight 3098 was scheduled to leave at 7:00 AM on 05/28 so we decided to get rebooked thru DFW. This was working great until the agent at the gate announced that American was offering $600 vouchers for people to take a later flight (they overbooked the DFW flight, of course!). We got a call on the intercom to come to the gate. The gate attendant basically moved us back to the ORD flight without our agreement (we had assigned seats BTW), lied about the weather at ORD and refused to honor the $600 voucher. After 32 hours, we finally made it back to North Carolina. Lessons learned: 1) Avoid flying American at all costs. 2) Stick to major airports so you have options. 3) Avoid holiday travel on airlines. 4) Consider driving an RV to see all the US parks.

Not Verified |  Washington to Dallas Ft Worth. We originally selected Main Cabin Extra seats, as our flights weren't long flights. After our first flight, IAD to DFW, we realized that the extra money we paid for those seats was ridiculous. They were just as tight and uncomfortable as coach/economy. We tried to upgrade to business class only to be told that it would be an additional $645.00 each for a 2:45 minute flight. Even after paying a great amount extra for main cabin extra seats, all you're entitled to is a drink and tiny bag of pretzels. There is no seat back monitor/tv and it made for a boring/uncomfortable flight. Also the attendants were not very friendly and although I go out of my way to be be a polite/friendly person, it seemed to make no difference.

Lexington to St Thomas via Atlanta. Stranded in STT airport for 48 hours by American Airlines due to hydraulic leak, and passengers left to their own devices to find a way home. Detailed version: AA flight 1195 on 5/22/19 had a mechanical problem we were told should take an hour to fix. After a couple of hours, we were told to board the plane. The pilot said there was a hydraulic leak, and a patch had been made. I could see the copilot standing in front of the wing watching as the pilot tested out the patch while we were all seated on the plane. Suddenly, the copilot made a frantic gesture moving his hands across his throat ("cut it" signal) to tell the pilot to stop testing. The pilot said the patch had blown, and hydraulic fluid was all over the ground. It seems unsafe that passengers were on board the plane while this hydraulic patch was being tested. The AA staff held us at the airport until 9pm when they finally started distributing vouchers to a musty, dirty hotel. We finished eating our voucher dinner at 11pm. Before leaving the airport, AA staff told us to come back for an 8am flight the next day, 5/23. At dinner we were told our flight had been delayed until 2pm on 5/23. Before we checked out of the hotel, we found out the flight was delayed again until 6pm. I immediately called the AA booking hotline to get another flight. I spoke over an hour with a manager who said there were no seats on any flights from STT that day, even on other airlines. So we were stuck waiting to see if our AA plane had actually been fixed. On 5/23, we sat in the airport all day, watching other AA passengers arrive on a different working plane and fly off to Charlotte, which was our destination. They would not allow us to board the working plane, though we had been waiting 24 hours. We were stranded since we were "assigned to" the broken plane. The gate agents told us they had no info about when the plane would be fixed. They were waiting for information "from above". Many people asked to speak with the AA manager for STT airport. The AA clerks radioed him over and over, but he stayed outside on the tarmac so that no one could speak to him. Some people had run out of medication, and others with special diets like myself (Celiac disease) were feeling faint from a lack of gluten free food. At 7pm they began handing out hotel vouchers again, and released us from the airport with no information about when our flight was rescheduled. We spent another night in the hotel. We called the AA booking phone number for 3 hours talking to various agents, who said they could not transfer us to a Delta flight that showed seats available online since it was overbooked. Finally, we were passed to a manager who said he found two "reserved operations" seats on an AA flight to Philadelphia used for situations like this. I asked why I wasn't offered these seats earlier that morning when I was on the phone with a booking manager since it could have saved me 24 hours of delay! We went to the airport for a 3rd day in a row on 5/24. We finally made it home at midnight on 5/24/19, which is 48 hours after our original scheduled arrival time. Due to the 48 hour delay, our pets were held at the kennel 2 days past when we were supposed to pick them up. We incurred extra fees for the kennel, as well as airport parking, and my husband wasted 2 extra "vacation" days spent all day in an airport. I will never fly with AA again.

My husband and I departed from Cincinnati for our honeymoon in Cancun, Mexico and we had a connection in Charlotte. Every flight was delayed - without notice, as per usual. We arrived at CVG before 7AM for our 9:30AM flight... only to be moved from one gate, to the next, back to the original, and THEN find out the flight is going to be delayed for minimum 40 minutes because they oversold it & no one was budging. Next, we arrive in Charlotte, and another delay. Once we finally arrive in Mexico, we are scouring baggage claim for our luggage, only to find out it did not leave Cincinnati. It took them over 12 hours to get the bags to us and they gave us no update about the progress. Each time we called the 1-800 number for an update, we were placed on hold for over an hour, and then were told basically "the bags will get there when they get there." Needless to say, we ended up spending basically our entire honeymoon budget on clothing just so we could enjoy our first day.  Finally, around midnight, the bags show up. Unfortunately, my bag was soaked. Thank goodness our resort credits covered laundry services. The flight out of Cancun was delayed, with no notice. Then, on board the flight someone had a medical emergency - nurses & a doctor on board the plane recommended landing for patient treatment & the pilots kept on.  Finally, we make it to Charlotte, and are delayed. There is no update to when we would possibly take off, there never is. After waiting over 2 hours, and too many gate changes to count, we finally took off. I have already cancelled the credit card we earned points with. Flyer beware, if you want to have a miserable time, by all means book with American Airlines. If you want to actually enjoy your trip, choose any other airline.

No es la primera vez que viajo por esta linea y siempre tiene retrasos, no la recomiendo, esta vez fue un retraso de 7 horas, ni siquiera crédito dan para comida, solo te ofrecen comida chatarra, durante las 7 horas de espera me cambiaron el gate mas de 5 veces. En otros viajes me han perdido la maleta dos veces. Realmente pésimo servicio.

Not Verified |  Be advised if you have never booked code share, do not ever do it. We booked on AA (million mile + traveler) code share with Iberia. Miserable experience on the behalf of Iberia, which makes it an AA problem. There is no accountability between the airlines. We booked business class tickets and Iberia changed our flight from to go via Delta through Atlanta with no notice and no reason. We got bumped for Iberia frequent fliers not AA status fliers. Return trip, same! Iberia put us on standby for business class from MAD to ORD. We paid for these tix last January! Iberia has no accountability to American and American can enforce nothing with Iberia. Code share = broker. Book your flights direct. I will be moving to Delta and or United, whomever will match my status.

The trip out to my destination was an absolute nightmare. My first flight (which I was up at 6 for) was cancelled on short term notice. The flight I booked after that was delayed by 2 hours. Wound up sitting on the plane at the terminal when it landed for another 2 hours because none of the terminals were open. My layover flight was continuously delayed in 30 minute increments (at 1 am mind you). The plane was even there and ready for boarding. Flight was finally cancelled. The staff there wouldn't even keep us notified on why it was delayed or the progress on leaving. There was another 2 hour wait in line to rebook. This was on a Saturday and they said there were no seats available until Monday or Tuesday. I went to check for myself and there were a couple of flights for the following day. Overall, this airline was completely unprofessional and seemed to care little for their customers. I won't be booking with them again if I can help it. I'd give them a zero rating if I could.

I traveled with American Airline from Fort Walton Beach (FL) to Santa Ana (CA). I’ve bought for me and my wife first class ticket for flight AA 1538 from Fort Walton Beach airport (FL) to Dallas FT Worth (TX), and AA 1524 from Dallas FT Worth (TX) to Santa Ana (CA). When I’ve checked in at Fort Walton Beach airport, the staff arranged me and my wife to economy seats on the flight 1538 without any explanation, neither warning. Weve expected it only when we’ve got in flight. I’ve ask 2 stewardess, why I’ve bought first class, but now I have to sit in economy class. They were vexed, and indicated me to talk to a man, who seemed be a chief of crew. When I told to that man, the man said, that he doesn’t know it, that I can complain to American Airline. That time was very close to flight time, so I had to flight with economy class. I think, what happen with me and my wife on flight AA 1538, shows, that American airline disregards customers. Or American Airline discriminates me and my wife, the foreigners, even we pay for first class ticket. In the other side, American Airline staff are not well educated, neither in customer service, nor in attitude. I think American Airline deserves 1 point in your scoring

Not Verified |  Tried to do an online check in for myself and my travel companion and my locator was not available and hers was, but we were unable to complete the check in just kept indicating an error. Called reservations and they were able to get my reservation reactivated, but my travel companion they said the only thing we could do was to check in at the gate. Every time I have had to fly American there is always issues with them for reservations and most of the gate agents and flight attendants have a less than helpful attitude. I have never had these issues with Southwest or Delta. I try to avoid American Airlines when possible, they make the travel experience unpleasant and frustrating.

I had a reservation to fly into Yuma from Charlotte with a layover in Phoenix. I arrived on time to [email protected] 9:30. Once we arrived there was a plain stationed in our bay so we were told it would be a delay. The American Airline passengers did not bother to contact the connecting flight to Yuma and tell them we were in phoenix. So once we got off of the flight and were going to B5 to catch the connecting flight it was closed and we were advised to go to customer service. Once we got to customer service the line was so long, it took an hour to get to the counter only to be told that the customer service closed at 11:00 and we needed to go to another customer service Kiosk on the other side of the airport. by this time, I was tired, had been up since 5:00 in the morning east coast time. I called customer service and was asked if I wanted to be reimbursed. I explained to the agent that this wasn't a pleasure trip, I had flown here for a funeral. she then said, well I can send you back to Charlotte and give you a full refund. I just hung up. Once it was my turn in the customer service line. I was told that i had to spend the night at the airport and the next flight was full so I would have to take the next flight at 10:52. I then became loud and explained to her that thus was of no fault of mine and I should not have to be inconvenienced because of a mistake made by the airline. She then offered me a night at the double tree hotel and a food voucher for a 12.00 meal. Needless to say, I am very disappointed in the customer service received on this trip and not only that the huge inconvenience it caused. I plan to contact US airways next week and if they are not willing to offer me a refund. I will never use them again. There is no such thing as customer service anymore.

Dallas to Seoul. The first leg of this trip back to the States was good. The last leg returning to Seoul was horrible. The gate attendant was rude. The seat space was made for a shorter person. I asked to be moved to a different seat prior to the flight and the gate attendant was less than professional. He was more concerned about the revenue of the seat rather than my comfort. Furthermore, my seat was already a preferred seat. It would have been a one for one swap. This airline should treat military members better.

Chicago to Miami. When American Airlines says “tickets assigned at check-in” it means “members of the same family unit buying in a single transaction will be randomly assigned seats in plane without regard to being a family unit in order to generate artificial demand at the airport for purchasing seats.” But that they do not disclose when selling you the ticket. Not even in the fine print. In addition, their systems are unable to deal with Latino hyphenated last names and you will not be able to do online check in with one of those but will have to do it at the airport if using your passport as you will be told there is no identity match (there is no culturally competent IT provider to prevent them to get rid of hyphenation) so again you must end at the gate to solve it. As for the rest, same mediocrity as always.

Not Verified |  I will never fly AA again. Staff at Abilene unfairly confiscated my roll-aboard, which I have ramp-checked with them 5 times in the past 30 days. This time, they insisted I check it and charged me $30. Now I'm stuck transiting DFW with a heavy carry-on and no wheels. I am rebooking my next flights on Southwest into Dallas Love and I'll drive 2.5 hours to Abilene and back rather than ever set foot on another American flight again.

Chicago to Punta Cana. I just want to say that American Airlines on two separate occasions has earned back my loyalty. The first time was on a trip from Chicago to the Dominican Republic. My husband had his wallet in a backpack stowed under the seat in front of him. During the trip, it must have popped out. We exited the plane, made it through customs with his passport that was in his pocket and only realized upon exiting the airport and meeting our driver that his wallet was missing. We had no idea if it was stolen, lost, where it was, etc. The driver immediately encouraged us to go back to the American Airlines office in the airport which was quite a feat given the language barrier. By the time my husband got upstairs to AA, his wallet had already been turned in and was waiting for him there with nothing missing. You can imagine the heart-pounding anxiety of losing your wallet, which basically contains your life, in a foreign country. A real vacation killer. So thank you for whoever was involved in returning the wallet. You have no idea how grateful I am. Second, my daughter, a med student in the Chicago area, recently flew to Cameroon, Africa on a trip to bring medical supplies to a surgeon and work with him in the small towns and villages. As part of the trip, she was bringing a large duffle bag filled with prescription meds, surgical gear, etc. at her own expense. The baggage person at American at O'Hare grew very quiet and had to enter every item in the bag onto a form. She was very concerned about not being allowed to bring the items, as this was a requirement of the trip. She was amazed and surprised when the $360 baggage fee was waived by American Airlines because they had a heart and recognized the humanitarian mission in the trip.

Not Verified |  Newark to Ontario via Phoenix. Never flying this airline again, not only did it take a ridiculous amount of time to get in the air due to unorganized staff, half the people on my flight missed their connection flights. I almost missed mine due to a last second gate change, ran across the airport thinking I had 5 minutes to get on my plane like the first attendant told me, then get to the new gate to be told we’ll be having another hour wait because they are having a maintenance problem. Horrible!

Chicago to Orlando. Thought I’d write a good review. American Airlines I believe is the best at CS and accommodating there passengers. It’s a very challenging business to keep everyone happy. More people should stop and think before they write bad reviews? It still beats driving! Give them a break.

San Francisco to Charlotte via To Orlando. Plane was delayed due to “uncontrollable circumstances” so we missed our next flight and it couldn’t be rescheduled til the next day 7 hours later. They gave us a new flight “for free” and a “discount coupon” to a hotel for 120$ per night plus we had to pay 25$ taxi fares each trip. About 50+ people or more seemed to have the same problem. They told us and everyone else it wasn’t their fault and that there would be no compensation for our lost time or our troubles nor would they pay for a hotel for us. What terrible customer service.

I bought 2 tickets 02/02/19 for non stop flight from New York to Las Vegas at 05/04/19 and back 05/09/19. Approx 2 weeks prior depature, I got a notice my flights canceled by email. As a result, I and my wife had 1 stop flights in both directions. It was my Birthday, and I was very upset. Never use American Airlines!

Flight 2616 from Oklahoma City to Dallas late on 5/17/19 - can't make connecting flight and no additional connectors available that day. Either rebook for next day or stay the night at DFW at our expense as per AA customer representative. So we rebook for same flight 5/18/19. Flight is subsequently cancelled the eve of flight. At this point I've given up on AA to get a plane in the air. Paid significant money to get a one way flight on Southwest Airlines and made it home only a day late. I would still be in OKC or DFW as of 5/20/19 if I stuck with AA as their 5/19/19 rebook was also too late to make connecting flight. Very poor service - at least between OKC & DFW. Can't recommend AA for getting to and from OKC.

Birmingham to Lubbock via Dallas. I had a flight at 5:40 AM, I was contacted the night before and told my flight had been cancelled. I did not receive a explanation as to why. Weather was beautiful all day! They rescheduled it for 5:40PM, the flight was then delayed because American airlines did not have enough ground men to bring the arriving plane in. The plane sat there well over 45 minutes until finally assisted. Not to mention those passengers had to sit on that plane with no AC. So when we get on the AC is still out so we have to bring a mechanic and it delays it by another 20-30 minutes. I miss my connecting flight and try standing in line to reschedule another flight, we stood there around 30 minutes before anyone ever assisted us. Finally someone assisted the lady in front of me, when it was my turn he walked away. I asked where he was going, which I had about 10 people behind me, and he said I gotta go! No explanation, so I waited about another 30 minutes before I was finally helped, and when I was helped they acted like I was the one causing the problems. It’s just all around an awful experience! Wouldn’t recommend it for anyone! Customer service is the worst of any airline i’ve ever been on!

Barcelona to Washington via Miami. I will avoid flying American Airlines. May 19th, my wife and I arrived at the Miami from Barcelona, Spain in route to our final destination of Washington,DC. In Barcelona, we were asked to check our Carry On baggage due to the expectation that the overhead storage was already full. Upon arrival in Miami, our connecting flight to Washington was delayed from 3:53 pm to 5:20 due to issues with the two bathrooms on the plane. The pilot gave everyone the opportunity to step off the plane until the problem was resolved my maintenance. One of the AA gate attendance began arguing with customers for leaving the plane even though we explained to him that this was something approved by the captain. We arrived in Washington, DC to be told that our carry on bags did not arrive with our plane. Even after over an hour delay, the bags didn’t get placed on the plane. This is unacceptable. On May 20th we were contacted by American Airlines that so far they only have 1 of the missing bags in Washington, DC even though the bag tracker shows they both did in fact arrive in DC. We were also told that it would be as late as 4pm today (the next day) that we would receive the 1 bag. I am currently on hold right now with American Airlines after waiting over an hour to speak with a representative to find out the status of my 2nd bag. This is by far one of the worse flight experiences for my wife and I. I will add that much of this is also due to the overall poor customer service given throughout the entire Miami, FL airport. But, unfortunately American Airlines is a Primary flight provider there. I will go with other options going forward. This is a poorly run organization and it continued all the way to Washington, DC

Nashville to Charlotte. Only fly American if you don’t mind not making it to your final destination on time. I had a flight out it STL that was cancelled, they couldn’t get me on another plan until a day later very late at night. I stood in line to talk with the attendants for over an hour only to be talked two for 2 minutes and basically forced out of line after being told “I was lucky I even got the (rebooked) flight I did get.” The attendant was beyond rude for someone who is just trying to reach their destination after their flight being cancelled due to an unknown delay.

I purchased an upgraded, more expensive round trip ticket from American Airlines to Yuma, from Phoenix AZ. When I arrived at Phoenix/Mesa I was shocked to find myself at the wrong airport. My flight to Yuma would be leaving from Sky Harbor, 35 min away. Luckily, with the help of an amazing security guard at Mesa, who helped me find the app and get a Lyft ride, I made my connection. However, my return flight schedules would not allow for that 35 min ride between flights. So I went to the desk at Sky Harbor and asked for help. They told me, no problem, I should be able to fly standby on the 6:30 am flight in Yuma so I could make my connection. They said it would cost an extra $75. Not so bad. Three days later I arrived before the Yuma AA agent and asked to fly standby on the 6:30 am flight. The agent and supervisor said, "No" I did not purchase an upgraded ticket and "No", I could not fly standby, I would have to purchase another ticket for $230. They were flat out unconcerned, bordering on rude, and unwilling to find a solution for me. I was absolutely stuck and had to purchase the ticket. The worst part of this is that everyone I spoke to from the security guards to desk agents, said of the airport confusion, "This always happens," and from a relative of an American Airlines family member, "American Airlines is in trouble for the terrible customer service." It does seem that it's all about money. I will never fly American again, and it's unfortunate because they are the only airline in Yuma, I will never fly through Yuma airport either.

❎ Not Verified | Toronto to Baton Rouge via Dallas. This airline is so poor. They have cancelled my flight at the last minute which has made me miss my meeting in Baton Rouge, and when I tried to call customer service, the wait was more than 3 hours. What kind of service is this? Definitely would not recommend this to anyone. Avoid this at all cost. Zero stars is all the deserve.

Gulfport to Orlando via Charlotte. The worst experience with this company, I have flown many time with American as well as with Delta and United but I have had the worst experience with American. Customer service reps don't care, they don't sympathize and it seems like they don't want to help. I asked a desk lady why my flight was delayed 3 times and she said that she just got to the job and she didn't know. My best bet was to go to AA.COM and find out. I did so but there is no info about why my flight is delayed. The time was 10:30 pm changed to 11:00, 11:30, now is at 2:30am. No apologies for no info just a yes it's delayed. The flight from Gulfport to Charlotte had wifi but you couldn't even watch a movie because it's very slow. Never again.

Phoenix to Santa Rosa. Last time I flew my plane was delayed until 2 in the morning. I didn’t have high hopes for this flight and it has now been delayed twice (2 hours each.) I wouldn’t be surprised if I wait until boarding time and they cancel the flight. This is the worst airline ever! Don’t count on being reassured that you will depart on time or at all with this airline.

Nashville to Chicago. No customer service at the airport. AA employees are always frustrated and have no intention to help you. They toss you around 3 or 4 different queues. Different ones of kiosk, baggage, service. You have to go to all those queues in mysterious sequence. Staff wont really help neither there are any signs. Missed or delayed flights every single time I boarded American. Best of luck. I am never taking AA ever again.

Montego Bay to Fort Wayne via Charlotte. I have flown with American airlines 4 times and this was the worst. Got notification that our flight from Jamaica to Charlotte was delayed by an hour. Once we got to the airport it was an hour and a half and we miss our connection in Charlotte by 5min. Couldn't just let me stay in Jamaica another day. Need to give more notice for this. I had to spend the night in Charlotte. Not happy at all. Couldn't hold that flight to Fort Wayne being it was their fault or book another one. I know they got enough planes. Had to wait until 1130 the next morning and of course it was over booked they said. But once on the plane there where open seats. I paid in advance for upgrade seating and of course with this flight my husband and i didn't even get to sit together. Don't think I will be flying with them any more.

Hong Kong to Portland via Dallas. American Airlines should be embarrassed with their International First Class product. I flew on their longest nonstop flight from Hong Kong to Dallas and the experience was mediocre at best. The few positives were a friendly cabin crew and the actual seat itself, which has a lot of room and adjustments. But these good points are overshadowed by miserable selection of food and drink. Upon boarding, we were brought cold, stale almonds and cheap champagne that cost maybe ten bucks a bottle. After takeoff, we were rushed thru our meal because of "upcoming turbulence." My beef filet was an inedible mass of gristle and the ice cream sundae was completely melted. The promised "Open Snack Bar" was nothing but a bag of chips and disgusting cold sandwiches. The breakfast served before landing was OK. The Purser on the flight actually apologized to the eight passengers in First Class for the sorry food and drink stating that "There have been some unfortunate cutbacks." The wifi did not work and the entertainment system was so slow that I gave up and just used the map. I will be cutting back my business with AA after this terrible experience.

Miami to Los Angeles. My original flight from CUN to connect in MIA for LAX was delayed 3+ hours and I was offered several alternate options. Once I arrived in MIA there was confusion amongst the staff with some telling us we missed our flight when it was actually delayed. Not one person empathized with my situation. I was repeatedly told there is nothing I can do because of the ticket type purchased. I was given a boarding pass for the following morning at 9am but was never told it was a standby until I realized at boarding time I had no assigned seat. Well didn’t make that flight either and still no one empathetic. No offers for options of which there were plenty just the same flight 2nd flt on stand by AGAIN was delayed from 1230 to 2pm. And then no on board amenities ie. charging station

Denver to Dallas. Worst experience ever - arrived 55 min before the flight and since we needed seat assignments the agent at the kiosks directed us to get in line for the main ticket counter. There were a couple of people ahead of us and the agent came out from behind the desk and started asking everyone why they were in line. I told her the window was closing for us to check in, but she continued to go person by person to see why they were in line, rudely asking why they were in line and condescendingly telling them to use the kiosk or that she couldn’t help them, instead of just taking customers in the order they were in line. She completely ignored us and the fact that the minimum 45 minutes was ending. She went back behind the counter and after a bit called someone from the priority line (they had a dedicated rep handling their line) she was incredibly rude and intentionally delaying helping us. When we finally were called up, she very coldly told us we were too late and that we should have used the kiosk. We told her that we were told to get in the line- were actually escorted there and she said, well I will have a talk with that agent. She put us on another flight leaving 2 hours later but did not tell us that we were on standby. We found out when we trying to get seat assignments. No go. Talked to a supervisor - no help. Told this is what you get with economy tickets - ridiculous how we were treated. Never experienced this with Delta or United. Finally got on a flight and were told as we were walking on that there was no overhead bin space left and would have to check bags-even made a lady get off the plane to check hers - when we got on the plane there were tons of open bins- some completely empty! Unbelievable- and so rude and the flight attendant said that’s what you get with an economy ticket- which is not true - carry ons are included. Will never get my business again - rather pay triple to another airline that treats all of their passengers like human beings.

New York to Washington. American Airlines used to be one of the better American (USA) companies. Now it is trash. They are absolutely incompetent. I was waiting for the screen to show the flight was boarding. Then a notice came up saying the flight was delayed 15 minutes. I happened to walk over to the counter anyways. If I had not I would have missed my flight! They never showed boarding. And the flight left on time. No explanation; only the typical American Airlines shoulder shrug.  You’re better off flying a budget airline in Europe than you are flying any American airline.

Not Verified |  Rochester to Orlando. Worst airline. We had multiple planes “break down” with mechanical issues which resulted in multiple delays. We watched as tons of people missed there connecting flights. The staff was incredibly rude and not helpful. We will never fly with American Airlines again.

Albuquerque to Redmond via Phoenix/Los Angeles with Skywest Airlines as American Eagle and Compass Airlines as American Eagle. The absolute worst customer service I have ever experienced. Thank you SW and Alaskan airlines for  incredible and helpful customer service, I will always fly with you, never American Airlines again!

LaGuardia to Pittsburgh. The employees of this airline are so bitter and angry. Their customers are a nuisance to them. They can often be overheard complaining about the customers and/or their schedules. On May 15 there was a customer who was made to check a bag when there was clearly space for her to bring it on. The flight attendant in first class referred to this customer as a bitch to her fellow flight attendant. Unacceptable.

Miami to Rio de Janeiro. If there’s an award for least child friendly airline, American Airlines wins by a landslide. Their website claims they have bassinets on long haul flights which are first come first serve at the gate. Correction; only if you want to pay an extra $120 for it or pay even more to upgrade your seats. When I asked if the bassinet was available, the answer was “oh, people are already sitting in those seats and they aren’t going to want to ask them to move”. Great customer service. I was then lied to at the gate and told the bassinet was already claimed, but when I looked on the kiosk at the gate, those seats were available for a paid upgrade. Really helpful for me on an overnight 8 hour flight with an 8 month old baby. The icing on the cake is that they don’t even have priority boarding for families with small children. Holding my crying infant, they told me I had to “wait for my boarding group”. By the time we got to our seats, the overhead compartment was full above us, where we needed to access bottles, formula, and toys. I can deal with my crying child because your agents clearly have no empathy for an exhausted mother and baby, but who really paid the price is the rest of your passengers who got to listen to it all night. Nice to know you care more about the money for the upgrade of the bassinet over every passenger in economy class. I didn’t choose  to fly your airline, I had to because of sick in-laws and getting to Rio in time. Emirates Airline offers 2  bassinets in every section of 777 economy class, 6 in total, for no extra cost. They will switch adults without kids seats to accommodate families with babies and have priority boarding. A little empathy goes a long way, because traveling with a baby is stressful enough already. All I received from your desk agents and staff was a quick “no” without any effort to try and help. If avoidable I’ll never choose your airline again.

Columbus to Phoenix . I understand delays. I especially want the airline to make sure the aircraft is safe. However, when I got to Phoenix they had already delayed the flight to Honolulu from 1130am to 2pm. They said it was maintenance. After sitting for hours they said the plane left Dallas but had to return there for some reason. So at this point they have moved departure time to 3.30pm. This is a special trip for me. I dont have the extra money for this kind of trip. I saved for months so I could fly out and see my son who is serving in the army. I havent seen him in over a year! At this point I have already lost 5 hours with him. I'm pretty sure there will be no compensation.

Not Verified | San Francisco to Dallas. Yikes, 2091 bad reviews?! Well, here goes 2092. American Airlines is the single worst airline I have ever flown. I bought an itinerary to fly down to DFW from SFO on Friday to Sunday of this past weekend. I then had to be down there on Thursday night, I called American to see if they could help me switch my flight, they told me it would be cheaper to just buy another flight. So I bought the second flight (also through American mind you) on Thursday night. While this was frustrating, I understood that I bought an Economy ticket and they would not roll out the red carpet for me, so I am not mad about that. I took my Thursday night flight, actual flight itself wasn't terrible. $9 cocktails is a bit high but nothing too ridiculous. After I thoroughly enjoyed most of weekend in Dallas, I tried checking into my Sunday flight on Saturday night. It said the system was down and I would have to check-in in the morning, which happened to be the morning of my nephew and Godson's baptism. I tried checking in before the service, same issue. So I called American. They cancelled my itinerary. They cancelled my itinerary because I was a "no-show on my initial flight to Dallas." So I was stranded after I had flown to Dallas via American because American didn't know I was in Dallas - starting to see why I am so angry? Anyway, I was forced to miss the baptism party to make sure I could get back to SFO the same night and had to be on the phone with AA customer service. The AA customer service line had zero empathy for my situation and functionally told me to "we cant help you." So I decided to go to the airport and try to explain myself. I have never been treated like less of a human. It seems as if American has a training to make their customer service people as cold and heartless as physically possible to the economy passengers. I was forced to buy an additional $600 ticket to get home. Then, when my co-rider had the audacity to try to get on my flight as a standby passenger they told her that she would need to buy a new ticket as well. I would rather drive than ever fly American again. Terrible people working at a terrible, unethical company.

Denver to Phoenix. Considering all of these poor reviews, American very clearly does not care about their customers. My experience was awful. I missed a very important meeting because of a delay for who knows what reason and all I was met with was a condescending Supervisor. Save your money and fly a different airline. This one is truly terrible and will only look at you as money, not a person with very real life obligations and schedules. Their schedule is the only one that matters, not yours.

Not Verified |  Chicago to Tampa. Fly this airline at your own risk of financial loss. I was stranded in Chicago due to random flight cancellation due to the Boeing 737 max planes being grounded. I was not offered a return flight until the following day so I arranged a different airline to get home same day and American would not issue a refund. This is quite unbelievable and unacceptable. I would not fly this airline when you risk financial loss due to circumstances beyond your control

After boarding, a flight attendant went around with less than ten earphones for the entire plane. Then he told a few seated people that he ran out of headphones before getting on his phone. We were then told by the captain that he was waiting for permission to get cargo tape on a pipe, which he assured us would not heavily impact the safety of the flight. We waited nearly two hours before they got permission to put cargo tape on a pipe (which for some reason, they couldn't resolve before we boarded). After an additional half hour, the airplane pipe was taped and we finally took off. The attendants were on their phone for most of this time. So, no earphones for more than half the plane's passengers for any way to pass the time and take our minds off the fact that most of us were getting dangerously close to miss our connecting flights (we were in Costa Rica, traveling to Miami on our way to our final destination). When we landed, no one from AA helped those with connecting flights get through the lines quickly or showed any concern or support for their customer's schedules. After waiting in long, stressful lines where all my family and I could do was watch precious minutes slip away (and watch other fellow passengers of our flight stress in line after also being abandoned by AA), we ran to our flight and arrived 5 min before departure time only to be told that the plane had left (we could see it from the window) and that we should go to customer service. 10 min later, I watched the plane carrying our checked luggage (and our clothes and toiletries) take flight. At AA's customer service, we were subjected to a 4 hour wait despite the numerous reps behind the counter (only one was receiving customers). Finally, at midnight, we were told that the next available flight wasn't until the next evening. 3 out of 4 of us had to call out an extra day of work because of this. When we bought a travel package through an independent company and saw that they had booked us with AA, I had misgivings. After my experience with them, I am regretful that I didn't listen to my own misgivings, the news, and the hundreds of voices against AA.

Not Verified |  Phoenix to Las Vegas. The gate agents are horrible. They asked for volunteers to get on a later flight and I was the second one to volunteer and they chose the others before me. I already had delayed flights and cancelled flights and the gate agent was knew I had volunteered. Why not give the vouchers to those by order of who was there first instead of whether you like the person or not. I’ll never fly with them again.

Phoenix to Salt Lake City. American Airlines sucks. They delayed our flight by four hours and since we were “group 9” we were forced to check our bags. They let so many people go on standby who used our compartment there wasn’t room for our bags. Only fly this airline if you want to feel like a second class citizen, like your money wasn’t good enough for them!

Memphis to Philadelphia. I was able to get on an earlier flight because I made it to the airport on time. Except they wouldn't let me switch because I wasn't economy. It's mother's day and now I'll miss the first mother's day with my wife after having our first child. Thanks American Airlines.

Phoenix to Sacramento. I do not recommend this airline. If you like unhappy and unhelpful crew,  then this is your airline. If not then please make your life easy and choose another. I felt sick on the flight and the crew member did not allow me to walk up to her to ask for water she just told me to wait. Anyway they are absolutely disrespectful and rude. Our next flight apparently my luggage was to big and she made a whole scene. How in the world?

Boston to La Guardia. Worst airline. Bad customer service. La Guardia gate staff is the rudest of all the airports I’ve been too ( I travel weekly). Planes are always late. Worst around trip I have ever taken. Went from Tallahassee  to Newport News VA for my daughter’s graduation. First flight got delayed for maintenance issues, so they said. Not thanks to AA. Return flight was delayed again! Customer service and attendants were rude and not willing to help anyone. But if you show some character here you go out of the plane. AA is there because Is a service needed, not because the good service provided.

Boston to Washington. This is the worst airline ever. Our flight has been canceled all day (today is 5/12/19). Dallas to Lexington. Arrived at the airport 42 minutes before my flight with literally zero people in the security line, but AA refused to allow me to board because I had a checked-sized bag. Despite having plenty of time, the agent first lied to me about why she couldn’t check my bag and said my only option was to go without my bag. I said it was no problem if my bag came late I just needed to make Mother’s Day dinner and wanted to board. She would not check my back on a later flight and said AA won’t do that. I had no option but to leave the airport since I was refused boarding for being 3 minutes late with no security line (and I’m precheck.) I missed Mother’s Day dinner with my family and will not ever give AA one single dime in the future. I’ll stick with Southwest even though it’s an hour from my family’s town. Denver to Tallahassee via Dallas Fort Worth. It all started when we first got to Denver. They forgot our bag in Tallahassee and had to wait until the next day to get it. When it comes time to flight back to Tallahassee, our first flight gets delayed twice, to the point that it arrived 8 minutes before our connection flight left for Tallahassee. Of course we missed it, it couldn't account for those who had a flight before. When we asked for a compensation, the people that work for American said that since it was due to "weather" they couldn't compensate. But, how are we supposed to know how the weather is going to look like? After that we had to wait at the airport for over 12 hours for the next flight to Tallahassee. We had to sleep on the floor, not even a single blanket was provided. What I don't understand is why did we have to be treated so inhumanely when it wasn't even our mistake. They just blame everything on the "weather" and not even respect people's rights. Will never fly through this airline again.

Dallas Ft Worth to Detroit. American airlines is the worst airline! I always flight Delta, every time I fly American Airlines the flight gets delayed many hours or gets canceled. Not Verified |  These guys just don’t get it! They cancelled my flight approx 10 hours prior to departure with no reason given. Dallas to Salt Lake City. What a joke of an airline. We bought our tickets in January and payed additional fees to select seats with more leg room. Raleigh Durham to Dallas Ft Worth. Flight out of DFW going to Puerto Vallarta cancelled due to “weather” but storms had stopped several hours before our second scheduled flight was supposed to leave. Dallas to Atlanta. Tampa to Vancouver via Dallas. Dallas to Hong Kong. I booked a ticket from DFW to HKG to RMQ for April 22, 2019, The first leg was Business Class and the second was First Class. San Diego to Detroit. Worst flight I have ever been on. Worst customer service I have ever dealt with. My original flight was supposed to take me to Chicago, then to Toledo. Not Verified |  Wow - what a way to tell your customer that you don't care about them. 3 flights within 12 months to the same destination to see our daughter at university in St. Kitts at Ross University and American tells me that they have the "right" to "scheduled changes" which seem to happen within 72 hours of the flight. American Airlines delayed my flight from Houston and when I got to Dallas, my connection flight gate was closed 12 mins before departure knowing full well I was running late from my other flight. Although we managed to check in online for this flight we were unable to select seats for our onward connecting flight to Heathrow with BA. So on arrival at the airport we joined the long queue for Customer Services. After several minutes a member of staff who was questioning people in the queue advised that our issue could be resolved by using one of the Self Service machines. So off to join another queue for a machine to become available. Unfortunately we were we unable to select seats or print Boarding Passes for our transatlantic flight. However we successfully managed to print off Boarding Passes for the MIA–YYZ sector. At the same time another piece of paper was output which stated that we could not print off our luggage tags as the connecting time in Toronto was too short. This despite the fact that the flights were booked over 6 months ago on the AA website. So back to the now longer queue for Customer Services. This queue moved very slowly and the number of agents dealing with passenger requests varied from two to five. Given the length of the line this was totally unacceptable. Well over two hours after arriving at the airport we actually managed to speak to someone who could help us. Our bags were eventually taken from us and tagged from MIA to YYZ to LHR. Once on board the flight was fine and departed and arrived on time. More stress at Toronto as it was not only necessary to pass through Immigration, but also pick up our bags, clear customs and then drop off the bags at the BA desk which had closed. Thankfully, a very understanding and helpful member of staff took pity on us. We managed to get to the gate just as the last passengers were boarding. The bottom line is that AA should never have booked these flights given the unacceptably short transit time in Toronto.

Not a first time traveler, however this may have been one of my first times on American Airlines. It was the worst travel experience of my life. We get to national airport and wait for the flight. I look up and notice, there is a delay. No big deal I’ve had delays before. So we wait. Finally they are boarding. We get on the plane and taxi out to the runway. We stop, pilot announces we are delayed again because we can not get air to the engine. As we sit on the runway, there is no air being circulated through the vents. It’s hot and keeps getting hotter. The woman behind me tells the flight attendant we need air, you can’t keep us on the plane like this. After an hour like this, people are sweating and feeling faint. Another woman asks if her and her infant child can get off as it’s not safe for an infant. The flight attendants reply was “sorry, we are all hot. You’ll just have to deal till we get going”. After 2 hours in the incredible heat they allow us to deplane. It was such a relief walking back to the air conditioned terminal. I wouldn’t even leave my dog in the car like that for 2 hours but I suppose American Airlines doesn’t care about leaving a whole plane in the smoldering heat. Shame on them! Another delay followed by another delay. Now I’m getting worried as I do need to be in Orlando by 8:00 that morning. I know our flight choices will be limited if they end up canceling this AA flight. I saw a flight leaving Dulles ( 20 min drive away ) 10:30 pm. I asked the gate agent should I head to Dulles or what is the likelihood this plane is leaving tonight? He said hold tight. I asked if I can get my luggage so I can have a chance at another flight. He literally said to me “if you were Nancy Pelosi or Oprah we could give you your bags”. Hmm? So because I’m not a politician or a celebrity I don’t matter? Nice AA customer service right there! So we wait. Like he said our flight did leave that evening. I think we took off around 11:00. I know we landed in Orlando by 1:30am. After getting rental car, and drive to our hotel we made it to bed by 3:00am only to be up again at 6:00am. I honestly wasn’t going to write a review for this part but what comes next. I will never again fly American... We end up enjoying our stay in Orlando. We are set to fly out Monday April 29 3:00pm. Sunday night we are all packed up and checked in. Only to wake up to a text from American 7:00am stating our flights have been canceled. They can rebook us for a flight the following day. I can’t miss another day at work, the kids have to get to school. What about the rental car and hotel? I have to pay extra for this too? Frustrated I dial AA customer service to be greeted by a machine and prompted to speak to a robot till I can finally get an agent on the line. The agent tells me we can book you Tuesday or nothing at all. She is apologetic, however can’t do a thing to help me. She basically tells me that’s all I can do for you, have a nice day. I ask to speak with a supervisor. After a brief hold the supervisor gets on the line to tell me she can book a flight with another airline. Well at least now we are getting somewhere. She tries to book with Delta but during the booking she says the seats sold out. She says she can get me an AA flight landing in BWI which is an hour from my home, so will AA pay for that Uber ride? She says no, we’ll have to figure that out on our own. Again, maybe if I was Nancy Pelosi or Oprah!

New Orleans to Miami. Very good flight. Departed and left on time. Seats are decent, Wifi is acceptable and so is the complimentary inflight service. Nice crew (smiling, which is the key..). Still, check in was smooth and luggage arrived fairly as on the belt. AA has worked just fine for us.

Not Verified |  Chicago to New York. Customer service at the airport was terrible. My flight was delayed and in the end got cancelled. Phoenix to Los Angeles. Ticket Agent checked me in & her service towards me was only OK, no eye contact, nothing. The customers in front of me that she checked in, concerned me a bit. The agent questioned her in a rude manner, “You don’t know what your seat number is!?” She asked her as if she was disappointed and frustrated. This staff seemed very disengaged, rushed and unpleasant. I understand that things get busy but it is not your job just to do your job. Customers deserve quality service.

Cancun to Milan via Miami. We were six counting a handicap person and an infant (2 years). Our flight took off delayed of one hour from Cancun, when we finally arrived in MIA we had only about 1 hour to the connection. So then the 1st soap opera began, no one came to take my stepfather (the handicap) at the plane, after 10 min some one came and left him at a place with others, then the lady from AA said we should reschedule our flight home for the other day, after a brief discussion she called someone and he and my mother went one way and my sister, niece and brother in law in another. We used the APC (Automated Passport Control) and went to the line, or should i say lines, i went one way. then security control. We all met after SC and went to the gate, there the second soap opera began. apparently some battery had to be changed and after multiple delays, emails, and texts and about 3 hours waiting later they decided to change the airplane, so we had to change gates too. more one hour waiting. So boarding began and after everyone were cozy (as much as you can be on a old AA aircraft) all kinds of excuses began. 1st was that we were waiting the green light from Dallas; 2nd the hours of the pilots were over so they had to call other, then it was the time of the crew (they cancelled a flight to Rio so they came to our plane) all that took us about 4 hours inside the aircraft and all they offered us was a glass of water. i can say with certainty that i will never set foot on a AA plane again, i don't care how much more i have to pay,

Have never had a good experience with American Airlines. Whether it's technical issues, engine problems, or booking issues, there never ceases to be something that goes wrong. On this flight, I was 3 minutes late to check my bag and they would not allow me to proceed without checking it. Therefore, I got a seperate flight in order to check my bag, layover through Chicago, and have been put on standby with every flight to Boston. American Airlines overbooks most their flights, and they claim my only option is to continue on standby. When asked how long they can keep doing that, I got the reply, "that answer is immeasurable." Which brings me to another point, the customer service is awful! I've interacted with at least 10 different people here for help and only 1 has been nice/useful. I'm not surprised they are all in bad moods because I imagine their complaint level is through the roof. Moral of the story, I have learned my lesson to never fly with American Airlines again. Sincerely, A customer still waiting in Chicago

The workers were unkind, unhelpful, and deceitful. I had a bag that clearly qualifies as a carry on bag. That wasn’t a problem. The problem, even after the customer service was terrible, was that the supervisors said I had to check my bag because the flight was full, and there was no overhead storage. They said my bag has to go to Akron. I told them clearly that I had bought this ticket through NYC because I knew there was a chance I’d have to stay in NYC for work. As I continued to explain to them the situation they told me that I could see a supervisor in NYC and get my bag back there if I was willing to pay the fare difference (presumably the difference in the flight I just took, not going to Akron a whole flight less!). We went back and forth as to how silly what they were saying was, and here’s the kicker, I get on the plane and there are many empty seats and even a couple rows totally empty! And of course, storage space. There was plenty of space for my bag. Again, not helpful, rude, and at the end of the day deceitful. So, will I get to be in NYC for work with my clothing and toiletries? If they need me in New York, I will not be in anything but my travel clothes and my bag will be lost in Akron and I will have to pay for a flight I don’t take and pay for the bag to be shipped to me. That’s absolutely poor American Airlines. If you’re looking for was of travel, honesty, and transparency, do not fly American Airlines. I will not fly that airline again.

Dallas to Ontario. Zero stars if possible. Closed out from the restaurant, they took a little longer than they should have. Walking up to the gate, literally shut the door in our face 10 min before our departure time. Ugly attitudes and horrible service. They could have waited 30 seconds and could have walked on. I will stay away from American Airlines as much as possible.

I usually fly on American Airlines, because I live near one of their hubs and am an Admirals Club member. I have been battling cancer for the past 2 1/2 years and American took away my status and did not allow me to put my Admirals Club membership on hold. They have all this publicity during October for Breast cancer awareness but they don't support the people actually battling cancer. I am going to do some research and possibly take my business to Delta.

The past 26 hours have been hell. Not Verified |  San Francisco to San Jose via Dallas. Absolutely terrible customer service. Flight attendants were downright rude, did not take the initiative to help passengers, and did not dress or act professionally. Worst airline I've ever taken.

I was flying out of Atlanta, GA this past Friday on a flight to Miami, connecting to Houston and the trip was cancelled hours before departure. I was placed on a standby flight for 6:50am the following day (in which that flight was full) & i could not board.
