She let every passenger board standby except me. I then had to catch a flight to DC from Atlanta, just to get to Miami. 24 hours spent in an airport with the utmost rude and unprofessional people I've ever encountered.. oh it gets better... my flight (AA1545) from Miami to Atlanta was not only delayed again , but AA then told me that my carry-on bag was now "too big" and forced me to pay the check-in bag fee, only for me to arrive to my gate & AA was checking in bags complimentary.

La Guardia to Orlando. Horrible service! Will never fly American again. We usually fly Delta to Europe. We traveled with 4 kids early in the am. The staff was rude, unhelpful. Not Verified |  Raleigh/Durham to London. One off the strangest flights i have been on; one cabin crew member very rude and snappy with passengers. Dallas to Salt Lake City. Horrible. I had a connecting flight from DFW airport to SLC. Not Verified |  Raleigh Durham to Tuscon. I am blown away by how dumb this airline has gotten. I'm on a plane right now with half of the seats empty. We will never fly American Airlines again. The customer service was non-existent. I would avoid any layovers in Philadelphia as the airport is understaffed with AA personal and extremely lazy. Omaha to Dallas Fort-Worth via Las Vegas. American Airlines has the rudest, most uninformed workers I've ever seen. Austin to Miami. We will never fly American Airlines again. From the very beginning it was the most rocky turbulent flight I have ever been on. All the people around us was commenting on the turbulence.  The plane then drops and then shoots up again. Not Verified |  I had a great one way trip with American Airlines beginning with the curbside baggage and boarding pass agent at the Atlanta airport, a very patient and helpful young man. Philadelphia to Las Vegas. Since most airlines have flyers right where they want them, the front of the plane is the only place left with enough seat to actually sit in for a 5-hour flight. I forgot to mention we only boarded after being chased to 3 different gates, the last being from one end of PHL to the other. Not Verified |  Detroit to San Antonio. After Air Tran went out of business I have flown American Airlines. I am handicap. They always go over and above anything I expect. From the time I book until I return home I am treated exceptionally well. Love to give credit when its due. Thank you American

Washington to West Palm Beach. I was planning to take my bag as a carry on and they had no more room up above the seats, so we were told to check our bags at the gate. New Orleans to Vancouver via Dallas. My husband and I had an extremely frustrating experience today. We were flying from New Orleans to Vancouver, via Dallas. The flight to Dallas was delayed. We were afraid we’d miss our connection to Vancouver and were thinking of getting on a flight to Dallas with another airline, but we talked to an agent at the gate, and he kept assuring everyone that “all connections are fine.” They were anything but. We departed late and arrived late. We still had a chance of making our original flight, but when we got to the gate, it was occupied. There were many passengers who had connecting flights on the plane, including international ones. One would have thought that knowing this, the airline would try to secure an unoccupied gate (how many gates can be occupied at one time? hard to imagine that the answer is “all”). But one would be wrong. We had to stay on the plane for more than an hour. We missed the original connection (as did many other passengers). Unfortunately, there were no other flights to Vancouver from Dallas tonight. We decided to take a flight to Seattle, rent a car, and drive to Vancouver. There was a flight with American Airlines leaving shortly after we arrived. We asked the agents at the gate for the Seattle flight to put us on it, but apparently, they had no authority to do that. We went to the rebooking counter. There was a long line there. We called customer service while standing in line. They called back shortly before our turn came. We managed to get rebooked on the flight to Seattle, but when we got to the gate, the agent told us that the gates were closed. The plane was sitting there and continued to sit there for another 20 minutes, but we could only watch from outside. We are not going on vacation and have to be in Vancouver for a conference at 9 am tomorrow. If we cannot make it by then, there is no point in going at all. We’ll do our best to avoid traveling with this airline in the future.

Very terrible airline. We were getting ready to fly back to Chicago from Las Vegas when our flight was cancelled because of weather in Chicago. Flew with American Airlines to San Francisco from Fort Lauderdale. As there were no direct flights we had to transit in Dallas. Lexington to Norfolk via Charlotte. I would ride a horse to my destination before I ever fly American Airlines again! Total disaster from the start! Not Verified |  Miami to Dallas. Very friendly and professional staff but I will probably never fly American again. Due to weather conditions my flight was canceled on Sunday evening (4/14/19), I completely understand weather delays, and did not complain in regards to the reschedule. However, when sending confirmation details American Airlines asks the flyer to confirm the new flight. Everytime, I tried to confirm through their website - it would crash. But! Their is the mobile app! Which also was unable to confirm and stated a call was necessary. No problem, I can call customer service. It was a 7hr wait for a call back when their own service stated 2hr call back times over the phone. When I finally got through to a representative - her first question was to ask if I had booked through a third party and to try to tell me the flight was voided. After, begging her to look up the flight via the record conformation number she was able to confirm me on the flight. Onto, Monday(4/15) one of the flight legs on the rescheduled flight has been canceled. They cannot even get me to Chicago without adding an additional day, possibly leaving me stranded in LaGuardia, NY. I am uncertain of the conditions of American Airlines flying to other cities, my case was from Boston to Chicago - two large airports, but unless you are flying to their major hub in Texas. I would avoid American Airlines until Oct 2019 when it seems they might have more planes in circulation. While the front counter staff were kind and tried to help as much as they could, American Airlines simply does not have enough resources to guarantee you a flight. If your flight is cancelled they do not have enough flights for a reschedule, all flights are overbooked and they do not seem to have any relationships with any partner airlines to help you get back on track. As of this American would of gotten me back to Chicago from Boston three days after my scheduled depart date. At this point I chose to book another ticket with Southwest Airlines who will get me into Chicago tonight. I know a lot of good folks work at American, but they simply do not have the most basic functionality down. Get to point A from point B on a plan within a reasonable amt of time. The only thing that seemed to work was at some point in time they will give you a call back to try to deny your flight's existence. I will take my business elsewhere going forward.

I purchased a ticket last minute to visit my Dad who is in the hospital due to complications from a surgery. The flight was delayed several times due to bad weather in the connecting city. They have strict internal policies that do not allow them to upgrade / book other airlines if they have an opening. This is primarily driven by American Airlines not wanting to pay the difference in cost. Instead they decide to put the passengers life on hold in a poor hotel for two days. Note the delay was not weather related, but a maintenance problem with their aircraft - they should have a better back up plan. One day delay is acceptable- two days is not! In some cases passengers were delayed 3 days. Also note there are no exceptions made, even if you have a medical issue.  Also the front counter attendant was extremely rude. While trying to work thru the problem the attendant just walked away and shut down her computer left me to figure it out like my own problem. Do not fly American Airlines.

Avoid this airline like the plague. Flight from Mexico City to Dallas delayed two hours for technical issues and thus caused the connection time to be shortened in Dallas. No assistance was provided on arrival and I was told that I had been put on another flight to Tokyo. However my initial flying class was Premium Economy but was told I was going to fly coach. After much arguing, I was put back on my initial flight that had not left yet. Because of severe thunderstorms this flight was cancelled and had to be changed to a later flight in Economy. While I understand weather issues are beyond airlines control, the rude and dismissive way American Airlines staff on the ground handled this was not worthy of an airline that prides itself of going for great. Lastly, the service on board the flight was non existent, the flight attendants looked tired and in need of proper grooming and the food barely edible. I will not fly with this airline again.
Houston to Managua via Miami. Very bad services, delayed the flight twice in one day and also they couldn’t have a connection flight to our final destination. They ruined our spring vacation.

Jacksonville to Dallas Ft Worth. One star is high rating. Zero communication. We found out that our flight was cancelled when we arrived at the gate. They couldn’t get us on another flight home  until two days later. If we were informed in advance (an hour and a half would’ve worked, I doubt they decided it the last 30 minuets) we could’ve rebooked our room or stayed at the resort until we figured how to get home but instead we dragged our two-year-old around the airport in zero comfort. Later we found that the airline had severe hail damage the previous day which explains the cancellation but also means they had plenty of time to inform affected passengers.

Not Verified |  Dallas to Norfolk. Word of warning to anyone planning a trip on American Airlines. They do not care about their customers. Yesterday my flight was delayed for hours in Dallas due to weather and because they had no flight attendants. Had to spend the night and they did not help me with a hotel or transportation or a meal. Total out of pocket was $180. Today I am back at the airport and my flight is again delayed because the crew is somewhere else. I’m not even going to my original Airport. There are Delta flights that would get me where I need to go but American won’t rebook me on one. This American trip has been a disaster.

Minneapolis to Phoenix. Awful, the back of the plane smelled of fume. It snowed so we were delayed for four hours and the flight did not have any food. All they had were pretzels and cookies. The plane was super hot as well and the ac fan on top of my head barely blew any air out. I was starving by the time I got to Phoenix but could not get anything to eat either because I was rushing to my next flight.

Not Verified |  My flight got delayed because of a reroute due to weather. Then it was delayed 5 more times (and the weather was only in one state which was behind us-the weather ahead is good). The last delay due to the plane needing repairs. Supposed to arrive at 8:50am, now hoping to land at 7:50pm. No accommodations. Have never had this problem with any other airlines.

Not Verified |  I will never fly American Airlines again. Every time I book with them my flight is cancelled. Tonight my flight was cancelled and their solution is to book me for a flight on Monday. That's 2 days after I am scheduled to arrive at my destination. I waited in line 2 hours for this solution and their solution is a cot in the airport.

I’m from India, travelling to NY via Boston. My first flying experience with American Airlines. My flight has been delayed for 3 hours, but the lady at the counter was kind enough to assist me to see if I can get onto an earlier flight. I walk up to gate B20 of American Airline at Logan Boston Intl airport; and wait for 10 mins for these 2 airline staff to stop chit chatting at the gate. And when the chatter was unending I decided to excuse myself and ask for help. Me: “Excuse me Ma’am” The tall lady : barked back “ I’m not talking to you! Can’t you see we both talking! U better wait! Don’t you got no sense?!” Such poor reception, extremely rude!

After purchasing my ticket and they offered me extra insurance so that I can change my flight or cancel without penalty. After finding out that my business has concluded early I attempted to get on standby status. After finding out that I was plenty of seats available they informed me that because I have economy class ticket I could not change my ticket without a $200 charge. So basically I purchased the extra insurance and wasted my money. I will never fly American again.

Atlanta to Los Angeles. We chose American Airlines because of the comfort and entertainment provided. We paid higher prices than with other airlines for the amenities. However, our flight was changed with no explanation other than it being cancelled. We had to rearrange everything. Then the new flight was a one stop (which we hate) the reason we paid more for non stop. Then there was no entertainment on either flights. 6 hours to the east coast, it sucked! We were so disappointed that we didn't take our return flight back on American. We paid for non stop on another airline since we received nothing we originally wanted with American.

Gulfport to Dallas. The plane was less than 50% booked. The flight attendants allow people to move seats as they like backwards and forewords throughout the plane so the will not have to sit next to another passenger. I was unable to sit in any exit row, all of which were empty. “You have to pay for those seats.” You also have to pay to sit further up in the plane instead of the back where I was. So I cannot move to a paid seat but others can? What is the purpose of this? Yes, normally you would have to pay extra to sit in an exit row. Since absolutely no one paid to sit there because the flight was more than half empty what is the issue with sitting there? If I had paid for a ticket and not picked a seat, if it was the only seat left I would not have to pay more for the flight, they would automatically put me in the exit row. Not like it hasn’t happened several times already. I fly often for work. Thanks for nothing American Airlines. Next time I’ll drive.

Not Verified |  American Airlines states they’re “Going for Great” when they are far from it. After my husbands graduation ceremony dates for the Air force changed a few months after purchasing our tickets, they refused to change the tickets to one day prior, even when I offered to pay extra if necessary. They told me all I could do was void my ticket and buy a new one. I asked if they do anything for active duty military and basically came out and said NO.  So now I’m left scrambling trying to make other arrangements so I can be there.

San Diego to Puerto Vallarta via Phoenix. They had a glitch in their system that made my TSA Pre-check not showed up on my boarding pass. So I got sent back to a very, very long line. After getting through TSA I still had more than 10 mins before departure, and the gate agent literally didn’t want to turn the door handle to let me in and told him this is because of the missing Pre-Check and he told me “it does that sometimes.”   Anyway after discussing some options with him or a few minutes, two other agents came out. Then after departure time, the plane didn’t even budge. I went back out to the check in kiosks and the agent was able to put Pre-check on my new pass. The AA agents I encountered gave me attitude for their mistakes. They lied about the situation and tried to make me think this is my fault. I would board my flight, with time to spare, if it wasn’t for their glitchy ticketing system.

Not Verified |  Wilmington to Los Angeles. My daughter missed her flight this morning in Wilmington NC because security too 47 minutes to assist 4 Handicapped adults through security. Now she has been in Charlotte for 7 hours waiting standby. She suffers from anxiety, the airports fault she missed her flight!! Now American is saying no availability until tomorrow morning.

Not Verified | It took 10 hours to get me from Santa Rosa to Santa Ana on a 423$ ticket. Alaska Airlines on time. American cancels and delays flights so you are packed in hours later like sardines with zero empathy. This is the psychopath of all air travel! Never ever again!

Minneapolis to Dallas. Solid customer service. Food not great, but it's airline food. Good website and check-in process. Flights were on time, and the planes were clean. Good selection of movies on the individual screens

This awful experience is happening too Often with American Airlines. Passengers have to wait for about 3 hours or more for maintenance issues. What’s going on with customer service and great experience? Why is maintenance happening after passengers are already on board? Straight flight to Bogota, Colombia from Dallas was scheduled at 5:50 pm. Its being delayed 5 times already. It’s 8/04 and still waiting. Who is responsible for this poor customer service? The same exact situation occurred on March 10th to my daughter and grandson with the same flight

Palm Springs to Chicago. Worst airline ever, they made us wait on the plane for a extra 30 minutes so we missed our flight. We went to the rebooking place and they said they cant give us anything! No rental car. And no hotel vouchers. Absolutely unbelievable. Now we have to wait at the Chicago airport for 11 hours to catch the next flight. Do not fly with American Airlines.

Customer service isn’t about how bad you mess up it’s about how you fix it - well American Airlines can screw up big and then make it worse. probably the same old story most travelers have gone through at some point but in the end the luggage was in the back literally a wall away from us and they refused to get it. The people they screwed with the delays did not take precedence over people that booked much later. The list could go on. Long story short if you need to fly don’t use them unless you must. If they are cheaper you get what you pay for.

Our flight from Oklahoma City to Dallas delayed 2 hrs. Our flight from Dallas delayed multiple times (still here). Now it looks like we are going to miss next flight also. My company purchased our tickets with American Airlines. I have always flown southwest or Delta and never experienced delays more than 5 minutes. Not a weather problem; it’s April and weather is good! Seriously, this is bad business.

New York to Chicago. This airline will treat you worse than an animal. After a 2h delay, we are “parked” in the plane and waiting to depart. No information is being communicated, no food/water is being distributed. Below minimum human standards! They also wouldn’t accept volunteers who were ready to give up their seats for other passengers to fly - worst customer support ever. They also claimed that WiFi for entertainment was available on this flight, it is not.

Dallas Fort Worth to Milwaukee. My gate was changed 4 times in an hour and a half America Airlines team members were rude and dismissive of my family and 8 other travelers. At the gate desk they then told me to go complain at the information desk but it wouldn’t help America Airlines is indifferent to customer service This was reiterated to me by 2 AA captains  and ground staff. The steward took blankets away from my 85 year old mother when I asked for some more she came back and threw them at me after telling me she didn’t appreciate me telling the captain that I gave my mother a 83 year old grandmother my mother’s wheelchair and that she had been in airport 12 hours. I told stewardess I don’t appreciate her customer service and attitude while watching other passengers jaw drop at her aggressive and unprofessional behavior. There was another great steward aboard that tried to my my Birthday flight home better.

Savannah to Dallas. We arrived at the airport 2.5 hrs early to get checked in. I travelled with my 80 year old mother who lives in a different state than me, and who does not know how to use the kiosk. There were 3 ladies behind the check in counter huddled up talking and giggling like school girls. We stepped to the counter and asked to be checked in. A rude woman said, did you try the kiosks?! I stated, "No. My mother is 80 years old and does not know how to use them, so we would like to check in here". She gave us a bad attitude while her friends still stood there doing nothing to help other passengers, by maybe calling them over to their empty check in stations. There used to be something we called "customer service". Apparently, American Airlines would rather pay staff to stand around and *watch customers use the kiosk*, rather than offer assistance to elderly passengers, who remember the days of checking in at the counter with a live friendly agent, not an robot?! I was furious my mother was treated this way. To top it off, they also put us in separate seating rows at checkin, yet when I booked our tickets, I had chosen seats together online. I had to have another agent at the gate correct the seating arrangement, where we were then sat in the very back row against the toilet walls where seats did not recline, not the prechosen seats we paid for and were ticketed to sit in on our reservations.

Detroit to Chicago. As I sit on the tarmac for an hour because of a weather delay in Chicago I felt a need to say how kind and compassionate our flight attendants have been. I wish all my flights have been this good. Now let’s hope we make it to Chicago on time for my connection

Chicago to New York. Having read the relentless negative reviews on American Airlines on this forum, I was wary of flying with them. However, I found my experience exceptionally satisfying. On this Saturday afternoon flight, I was upgraded to a business class seat which was spacious and comfortable. It did lack personal entertainment system on the back of the seat in front of you; instead you had the drop down from the ceiling screen where the safety video was played and a show screened which I did not bother. Rather outdated system. Fifteen of the 16 seats in the cabin were occupied and serviced by two very attentive attendants. Pre-take off drinks, bowl of warm nuts, a hot towel, a full dinner with a vegetarian option - I had the beef with mashed potatoes — and a good selection of alcoholic drinks made the smooth flight in a clean and bright cabin go very quickly. Pilot provided just the right amount of information in an amiable manner including letting us know that a cat was a passenger on the flight in the cargo hold. To top it all, the flight arrived at the gate several minutes ahead of schedule. One could not ask more. Good job, American!

Dallas to Charlotte. My flight was delayed because “they didn’t have a plane”. The delay was only explained that way. I missed my connection and have to fly out the next day. I will miss a very important meeting as a result. They offered no accommodations for there screw up. I will try to avoid flying them in the future

Pay close attention to the type of ticket you purchase or you will be penalized. I bought a ticket from a third party online, Cheap-o-Air, to attend my sister's funeral. I thought it was strange that they didn't give me a seat assignment. Then a window popped up, telling me that if I wanted to pick my seats, it would cost an additional $25 per seat for the 4 flights, an extra $100 cost. I called the airlines to find out if my flight was confirmed, since I didn't have a seat assignment. They said yes. Then, a few days later, I needed to make a change, so I called the airlines to see if I could fly stand by on an earlier flight. They told me that my ticket was a Basic Economy ticket, which means no changes, no seat assignment, no carry ons, and I must board last. Wow! Talk about treating me like dirt. I honestly do not recall seeing any of these restrictions listed when I booked the ticket. And they didn't care that I had extenuating circumstances, a close family member's funeral. I had not encountered such punitive measures before. Maybe that's because I usually fly JetBlue. In the future, I will rent a car or take the train before I fly American.

Not Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Jacksonville. Trying to join friends for a weekend of golf and fun at Sea Island. So we booked the 10:50 from Dallas to JAX in first class. When we arrive at gate C30, I see the worst possible thing, a Super 80 at our gate. Perhaps the worst passenger airline plane of all times. For some reason, American can not rid itself of these dinosaurs. At 10:45 they tell us there is a problem with the 30+ year old plane. The part will arrive in 10 minutes and it will take 20 minutes to install. Then after numerous departure update texts, they send us down to gate C19 changing to another Super 80. We finally board and while waiting for fuel and catering, the crew times out, seriously! They deplaned all passengers while we wait for the replacement crew. The new crew arrives check out the plane and we board. We finally leave the gate at 2:45. Taxi out to the runway and while waiting to take off the captain announces that we must return to the gate because there is a problem with the navigation system. So here we sit at the gate waiting for maintenance (an interesting name for this airline). They are offering us to leave now because we have been at this so long. Passengers are laughing at this announcement to keep from crying. We will see how this goes now. At least the gate agent brought food and drinks while we were between crews-cudos to him. You really cannot make this stuff up. 3:25 now. Another safety demo too!

Sacramento to Mazatlán via Phoenix. First leg delayed, second automatically rescheduled a day later. This is a 4 day trip, now a 3 day trip. I’m told there is no other way to get me to MZT, that if I go home and try again tomorrow I’m out of pocket for the RT Lyft (c.$50) and if I go to Phoenix, I may have to pay for my own hotel and seek reimbursement! Last business trip, AA stranded me in O’Hare for 8 hours. No food voucher, no lounge access, no upgrade, no nothing. American is awful.

Charlotte to Orlando. My flight was to leave at 1030am in it got delayed over time I stop counting. I didn't get leave the first airport until 6pm at night my seat was taken that i paid for in was told i would have to buy a upgrade if to get it back. The staff was very rude when talking to them especially on the second part of the flight in North Carolina. I didn't get to my destination until almost 11pm at night was place in middle seat after my aisle was taken from me in was told I would have to pay a extra 50 dollars when there was lots of empty seat on the flight. This was the worst experience I have ever been on. I will never use this airline again they have drop off service

Chicago to Las Vegas. I booked a round-trip flight (as I do every year with American) from Chicago -> Las Vegas for the opening weekend of March Madness. My return flight was 8am on Monday March 25th. Right before boarding, the representative mentioned we would have a 15minute delay. Ok, not a big deal, this is typical with large airlines. 15 minutes later the representative then told us "We're sorry, this flight has not been cancelled. Please call AA.com to choose a different flight at no extra charge." As you would expect, all of the other flights out of Las Vegas on American were the next day. They wanted to switch my flight from Monday at 8am to Tuesday at 10am with a layover in Phoenix, arriving in Chicago at 10pm. (36 hours later "free"). I called American Airlines and told them this was unacceptable and needed to be switched to a different airline since I had to work the next day. They said I could book through a separate airline and request a reimbursement. I chose to fly on a Delta flight that got me home around 11pm on Monday (8 hours after my original plans, not a huge issue). I then requested a reimbursement through American and they said "We're sorry, if a flight is cancelled, please use a representative and we'll switch you to a new flight. Since you booked yourself, we cannot reimburse you." I did exactly what they said and am now $600 out-of-pocket for a 1-way flight. I will never  use American airlines again. I was a once Platinum Pro member with them, but this is a new low to me. Avoid at all costs. Delta and Southwest are significantly better. I will pay $50+ more for a flight that is not American moving forward. Hope this helps save someone a future headache.

San Jose to Chicago via Charlotte. Terribly disorganized. Overbooked several flights and had people panicking. They gave my friend someone else’s ticket with his information on it. They gave myself and another person the same seat, then kicked me out because they said I didn’t have priority. They were rude over the loudspeaker and nagged us the entire flight about seatbelts, turning our phones off and giving their pens back after borrowing them for customs forms. We felt like cattle being herded not like paying customers. Food was also less than average. My animals are fed better. I will be avoiding AA in the future even if it means paying more.

Boston to Tucson. The worst flight. First our scheduled trip from Boston to Dallas to Tucson was changed to Boston to Los Angeles to Tucson. The seating was inexcusable, absolutely no room. Why make people so cramped and uncomfortable. Even the stewardess mentioned that the bathrooms had gotten so small if you go in the wrong way you cant turn around. The newer plane had tiny air vents that produced virtually no air, its was way too hot and there was no way to get fresh air. Mst planes have actual cool air that you can feel. Got to LA and next flight was delayed. Unfortunately have to return on AA but will never fly again using American.

Boston to Chicago. Terrible service. Forced to check in my bags because I was told there was no overhead space. What’s the point of selling carry on tickets to economy group only to be forced to check in bag. On the flight From Philadelphia to Boston had a bad experience with some air hostess harassing me because of putting my suitcase in the overhead bin. If you have a choice don’t choose American Airlines.

Baltimore to Austin. I am again disappointed with American Airlines. While waiting for my plane I heard that the plane before us was having maintenance problems and could not take off for at least three hours. Then they were rerouting customers and changed our gate. I went to my new gate and learned that my flight was delayed as well and I was not able to make my connecting flight. Again it was because of maintenance problems on the plane. Is there no one checking these flights before they’re pulled up to the gate? American Airlines continues to go downhill and has been doing so for years. I am now connecting a flight in Dallas Fort Worth And was just informed that that flight as well is delayed! How can this happen on such an established airline? The planes are in disrepair. People are angry and service people have the attitude of “oh well” American Airlines is fast becoming a joke, it is a wonder that they are still viable. I have been a loyal member but I am fast turning my sites to Southwest who has a superior service reputation all around.

Charlotte to Las Vegas. American Airlines is the worlds worst airline company. I had the worst experience of my life. I held in the airport from 5am to 2pm. We got on a flight only to be sitting there for 20 min before taken off for maintenance issues on a plane that was supposedly sitting overnight. Why would you not have your mechanics looking at the plane prior to boarding time? The the flight was suppose to leave at 7:30 am only to be sent to another gate to board another flight only to be told 5 different boarding times and 2 hours later that that plane had mechanical issues as well. We were told it was due to maintenance and unable to fix. We did not board our flight until 1:30pm. How do you sell tickets without proper working planes? I also purchased an upgraded seat for the first flight, which I never sit in. What a waste! I had to miss 2 business meetings. Customer relations is refusing to set me up with their manager telling me they don't have one. American Airline you need to really do better. This is not the way you conduct business, especially when your dealing with my time and money. You really need to get yall act together and give your employees a proper training. The attitude that your staff have is so unprofessional. The sad apart American Airlines you do nothing to make sure your customers are feeling at ease after all the issues that you cause. I am very disappointed in your company.

Again with American it is a continuous fight to keep your luggage as a carry on. After fighting for it on three other flighs the final leg they got me. Only to discover on the plane they had empyt bins all around. I demand for my luggage and they tell me once it’s tag the law states they cannot give me my stuff back. How about american airline stops taking luggage from their customers or start making a checked bag free to eliminate the carry ons. I will be sure to never go on American again. The airline has no customer service care and creates a hostile environment for people with carry on luggage. Two years ago this airline did the same thing trying to grab luggage out of my 8 year olds hands. They have no personal space or care and will take your stuff. Beware.
Phoenix to Los Angeles. Booked ticket 2 months ago. Got to airport 3 hrs early and were told that they could not seat us together unless we paid $25 extra. That is a scam or extortion take your pick.

Disappointed From Miami to Guatemala. I've never been too satisfied with my flights with American Airlines and also this was not a good flight, even if the airplanes we used was quite new and the pitch was quite resonable. The flight looked as it was carried out by a low cost airlines: food on purchase and with no IFE (it was expected to have a Personal Device Entertainment, but it was no working even if I've got the app downloaded before the take off)

San Jose to Miami. Not so bad From San José de Costa Rica to Miami. I have never been too satisfied with my flights with American Airlines, but that time I was partly surprised. It still to be a no frills flight with food on purchase, but that time the IFE was working. It was a Personal Device Entertainment so you can watch free movies and TV shows right from your personal device if you had downloaded on your device before your flight the AA app. I really appreciated this service.

A flight to forget. From Milan to Miami. Unfortunately, American Airlines still  using old aircraft on the routes between the US and Milan. My aircraft was not only old and in not good conditions, with an old-fashioned IFE system (overhead TV, no power), but it also had old and ruined seats. My seat was tilted outwards and it was not possible to change seats because the plane was full. The flight staff was quite good, but not always attentive to passenger needs as in others airlines. Poor quality food and beverage compared to those usually offered on transoceanic flights by European or Middle Eastern and Asian airlines. By the end, that 12h flight was an experience to forget, also because the ticket price was definitely overpriced compared to the services that AA was offering

San Antonio to Dallas. 4th time flying with American. Also 4th time they’ve cancelled flights on me. Every time I fly with them there are delays and cancellations. Additionally, there are never enough support people to help and they’re always sorry for the problems. I feel bad for them but someone in management needs to be held accountable. If you fly, use any other airline. American seem to take no pride in making the customer experience a positive one

We recently flew Detroit to Philadelphia return and both flights the airline stated that only 25 passengers would be allowed their carryon bags. All others would be checked. My husband had a heart attack not long ago and had all his medicine. They refused to allow him his bag stating that we had to take his meds out and put them in a bag on our lap. This happened on both flights. When we boarded the plane there were many overhead bins with room for carry on bags. This is misleading as they sell their tickets as you can have a carryon and a bag. Then the attendants were very rude. Very disappointed in this airline.

Not Verified |  My family traveled to New Zealand recently, and I cannot say enough good things about our experience with American. Long haul with a 5 year old is not something that I look forward to, but the American Airlines crew and ground staff were so warm and kind to our family. I was very impressed with the international flight’s in seat features like entertainment, cell phone charging . Meals were great and the snacks were a welcome reprieve. I travel like Guinness - not well - and i dread the bumpy landings and descent to Denver. I must compliment the pilot of our flight into DIA yesterday for the most gentle landing and descent I’ve had to date. My son was so excited for his first international trip, and the people at American made it so very special for him. Thank you all for all that you do!

American Airlines is the worlds worst airline company. I had the worst experience of my life. My wife and I were held in the airport from 4pm until 1am. We got on a flight only to be taken back to the gate for maintenance issues on a flight that was already delayed. Then the flight was delayed 7 times (it was clear we weren't going anywhere) 6.45 to 7.00, then 7.45 to 9.20, then 10.00 then 10.30 then 1.15, then nowhere. We were told it was due to maintenance and not having a crew. How do you sell tickets without having a crew? We also were told we can't take our bags and that they would be on a flight that we were practically forced to take the next day into Manchester, NH. Sure enough the bags were never on that flight. I had to miss work the following day in order to make sure I got my bags. Customer relations is refusing to set me up with their manager telling me they don't have one. I promise on everything I love I will never fly American Airlines again, I will make sure my family and everyone I talk to doesn't step foot on an American Airlines plane. The planes are gross and outdated and missing upholstery, no TV's just won't make for a good day and possible could delay your plans. I had to miss work and a wedding because of them.

Miami to Freeport. A few months back AA upgraded my status to Platinum for 3 months and I was able to get the free upgrade to business on this 45 minute flight. Needless to mention that the only business experience you can get on such flight is the pre takeoff beverage and a snack. The seat was nice and comfortable, the aircraft look and felt brand new and I got to work with no major hassles. Thank you AA, now if you could also fly out of ACY and give Spirit a run for their money that would be awesome!

Philadelphia to Miami. This was an early flight to get to work, AA had recently sent me an email that they would upgrade my status to Platinum for 3 months so that I could experience the benefits of it. On this flight I did not make it for the business class upgrade, I believe I was like 10 on the list, however I got a seat with more leg room for no extra cost. I got to Miami from Philadelphia with no issues, the plane was clean and the crew professional. Good job AA!

Not Verified |  Kansas City to Philadelphia. I honestly wouldn’t fly American if they didn’t go everywhere I have to go. They are over priced for what you get. They are just as bad as Spirit as they charge you for seats. How dare you! What am I suppose to do, stand? If you’re not first class they make you feel like nothing. Thanks. Delta, Southwest, Virgin, JetBlue are so much better! These are my last flights on this airline.

Have not flown American Airlines in the past however, did connect thru Philadelphia Airport on a US Air flight 10 years ago. We left Minneapolis no issues, smaller plane. Landed in Philadelphia with plenty of time for our connection to Rome. Airport incredibly hot but that is not the airlines issue. Plane boarded fine (love with they put up sign queues for those who hang out in front of the gate). Plane was pushed back and proceeded to sit on the tarmac for over 3 hours waiting for our assigned place and then de-icing. Pilot was becoming irritated as apparently he could not turn on the ventilation (why I don't understand) and finally came on the intercom stating that the airport has run out of de-icing fuel. I guess they had to run to the store to buy more. In any case, our connection now in Rome is screwed but I don't blame American for that. I find fault with the initial flight crew who never once in those 3 hours made themselves known. When right before take off they came out with water and proceeded to serve the first 3 rows never to be seen again until food service (hour later). Not sure if they were new or what. When asked if they had milk to help settle my stomach the flight attendant said yes she'd be right back (never saw her again). We were towards the front of the cabin, not sure who was getting service here. I have been on many many international flights, so many lost opportunities to show better service. Not once during the overnight flight did they come around with water. No wake up towels (which are a really nice treat on some flights). Basically it was like no one was there. The only redeeming point was that upon landing a flight crew guy got all of us (7) to our connecting gate in time to board from Rome to Tel Aviv. Of course our bags never made it. Overall very disappointing picture of this airlines, and I guess $1000 is nothing to some service industries.

I’m sitting on this flight now. This is the worst experience I’ve ever had with an airline. They got delayed while on the plane. With no explanation whatsoever. Staff are extremely rude. There is no power supply and my daughter who is two years old is getting restless. I will miss my bus and have to wait additional time because I am still sitting on the ground. This is my first time and last time using American Airlines. Also, I had to pay for my two year old who they wouldn’t let me sit her on my lap. So far while writing this, 1 hour and a half. Terrible.

Tampa to Philadelphia. Horrible experience. Flight overbooked, forced everyone with a carry on to become checked bag. Pilot said 15’minutes remain, ended up being 45. Once we got off the plane, checked bags were sent to wrong pickup location.

Orlando to Miami. Rude completely unhelpful at desk. Almost missed flight. Then disrespectful again when another passenger cut the line for the second time. Bet if I was a man or traveling with one he wouldn’t have snapped at me. Worst flight experience ever. Won’t be returning!

American Airlines squeezes every cent of profit out at expense of customers and employees. My roundtrip has been nothing but delays and cancellations. I was stranded in SFO overnight after flight was bumped 10 hours because AA "ran out of room vouchers". I have to now wait 12 hours in Charlotte to take my final one-hour flight leg. I can drive faster than that by 8 hours! Even the supervisor in charge of the 2 employees at the ticketing desk last night said to complain to the airline because their policies are making it hell on employees too!

Not Verified |  Phoenix to Minneapolis. Worst customer service ever. Was traveling this evening (see picture - no one was allowed into the check in area despite no line). Stood next in line to check in bag for 40 minutes and was 3 minutes late to check my bag and told I couldn’t board my flight. When I asked for an explanation, one was not given. I was put on a standby flight with no guarantees seat for the following day again with no explanation. The lady helping me laughed when I walked away - clearly this was a joke to her. Now I’m stuck without a reservation despite paying for a ticket and waiting NEXT IN LINE for 40 minutes. Will never fly American again. Highly recommend flying southwest. American air lines at Phoenix sky harbor ALWAYS has customer service issues. Do not support this airline.

Charlotte to Tampa. I was on flight 1773 and my seat was 18B. We had not taken off yet and I had a seizure. It was the first seizure I had in a year. The staff was great and the people around me were great. The steward in particular that stands out whose name I did not get because we just boarded and it was so crazy. He was so amazing and patient and helpful. He got all my stuff for me and made me feel comfortable during my seizure. I wasn’t rushed off the plane or felt embarrassed. The staff and other customers on the flight were so understanding and great. The flight was already delayed and my situation was making it worse and everyone was really great with me. Thank you and please tell that flight attendant from the bottom of my heart thank you!

Dallas to Lexington. I would recommend paying a little more money to fly with someone else. I’ve had problems every time I’ve flown with American and this past time has been a nightmare. First they do a surprise landing somewhere else, making all of us miss our other flights. They wouldn’t let me on my next one until I argued with them for a while and after they let me and others on they take us all the way to a 30 min take off spot only to take us back bc they decide to cancel it. Had to stay the night in the airport and was supposed to take off on another flight at 12, but only to have them have us get off bc technical issues. They get us another plane, we board, and they tell us to get off again bc technical. They obviously don’t care about their customers bc they won’t pay attention or do anything for wasting 2 days of our lives.

Grand Cayman to Denver via Charlotte. I have not flown with this airline for 15+ years. Now I remember why. The absolute worst service in the industry not to mention targeting passengers. Completely incompetent employees in ticketing with no communication to outbound passengers was the beginning almost causing us to miss our flight. Then there was no food service or even the ability to purchase food on an international lunchtime flight not to mention the trash talking by the flight attendants during the flight. Make sure you do not question them because they will target passengers and force you to check your carry on luggage because of a “size” issue even though other passengers with a later boarding group and LARGER luggage were allowed to board no problem. What a disgusting level of service. Never again. Save yourself the problems and spend more to ensure this doesn’t happen to you.

We booked a round-trip fare for direct flights. When we were leaving Eagle airport we were told we had to stop in Denver to get fuel. How ridiculous to send a plane with not enough fuel. We were not offered a beverage or any food for free and got home over 2.5 hours late. No explanation or apology. The flight attendant, he said either we land in Denver or we have to let a third of the passengers off and he said it happens all the time if the flight is full. Why book a full plane then. We suffered and the airline benefited. Last time I’ll fly American. Four of us in our family. All unhappy!

Pittsburgh to Phoenix. Horrible customer service. Due to business I called in to move a flight back willing to pay as I have always done with Southwest Airlines. American was unable to accommodate me in any matter and advised me to buy another round trip ticket as my entire trip would be a total loss. There was no credit or any type of refund offered and on top of that they were the rudest people I have spoken to.

Cancun to Omaha via Miami. Absolutely dreadful experience. A nightmare. Flight delayed 5 times without any explanation, stuck in the airport for 6 hours, spent 80$ on food and internet to let family know. On arrival in Miami they throw us on the street without explanation how to get to shuttle to Holiday Inn hotel in the middle of the night. I was forced to take another flight to Chicago, arrive to Omaha a day later, miss my work. I didn’t pay for this. I paid for 5 hours 52 min flight with one connection. It was cattle treatment at the airport. I truly hope they go out of business.

I was traveling with my wife and two sons from Dallas to Phoenix via El Paso. I had a boarding pass in hand as I went through the long (25-30 min) security line at DFW. When we arrived at the security desk, the TSA officer scanned my boarding pass and told me it was "invalid." We then tried to scan it from my wife's smart phone in case it was a printer error. Still invalid. I was told to exit the security line and go to an AA kiosk to print another boarding pass. Well, the reserved seat with my name on it was no longer available, so I was forced to make another seat selection. In addition, I was forced to pay an extra $6-7 for the seat. Since I really wanted to join my family for our spring break vacation, and did not wish to miss my flight, I went ahead and bought the new seat. Fortunately the TSA officer allowed me back to the front of the line and I was able to join my family in the terminal, narrowly making the flight. The whole thing seemed like an outrage, even by AA's deplorable standards. Since this is a long review I will spare additional complaints about the long delay de-boarding the flight, the rude AA gate personnel who pretended not to notice my teenaged son while he waited to ask them a question, the long delay getting gate checked bags, etc.. Just awful.

Dayton to San Diego. I have never been treated so rudely. I have been a Delta flyer for years and I know why. I was flying to San Diego for an important business meeting I arrived at the airport 47 minutes before the flight by the time they were to weigh and load my bags there was 41 minutes until departure, they stopped mid check in and said oh you’ve missed the 45 minute minimum. I said I fly out of this airport all the time and this is my routine. I’ve never heard of such a thing and never missed a flight. Long story short they were less than helpful and suggested I go to the delta desk which I did. I had to book another round trip fair at $2000 just to get to my meeting. The Delta people were very helpful and said they have a 30 minute cut off and so did the rest of the airlines apparently not American. Horrible horrible customer service and poor manners. Never no matter the cost difference will I fly American.

St. Louis to Dallas via Tampa. They never let me know my flight changed. The people at the desk were rude and unhelpful. Now i will miss a very important business meeting because I can't get a flight until the morning. I will never catch an American Airlines flight again.

Left Cleveland for Dallas on time, when we arrived to Dallas flight was delayed 2 hours then delayed another 3 hours. American Airlines were really great about trying to make customers happy. They offered rooms for customers who didn’t want to wait and had food and drinks at the gate complimentary. I have flown for years and American is my choice of airline. These things happen and we all know the risk when traveling.

Oklahoma City to Tampa. It is very frustrating that the majority of flyers take on 2 and even 3 carry on items. Most of them are large and need to be checked. We check our bags everytime we fly and are charged 25 bucks per bag. But, the people that don't check their bags and are forced to check them at the plane don't get charged a dime. There was a girl on our flight 3 days ago that carried on a duffle bag that was bigger than her. It didn't fit in the overhead compartment and it didn't fit under her seat. She had her feet on top of it the entire flight and no one said anything to her. All of this "not checking bags" also holds up the entire plane and with short connection times we have made very close calls of almost missing our connecting flights. This is a very frustrating and unfair system that needs to be taken care of immediately.

I flew with American Airlines from Manchester, UK to Philadelphia. I didn’t find the flight crew rude, however my mom sitting next to me said the man serving food was grumpy. While I didn’t find him especially friendly I didn’t think he was rude. The food was below average. The inflight entertainment didn’t have the biggest selection of films although I did find something to watch. This isn’t the worst airline experience I’ve had but far from the best.

Absolutely horrible airline. Flew from Cleveland to philly to Punta Cana, got a 5 hour delay to Punta Cana ended up getting to our resort at 8 at night. On way home we landed at 9 o clock they held us on plane till 10 and missed our flight home which was at 10:15 and wouldn’t even accommodate us to a hotel room for the night told us it wasn’t there fault we got held on the plane for an extra hour after landing had to spend an extra 130$ for a hotel room.

New York JFK to Sao Paulo and back in business class was a flawless flight. AA's lounges on both ends have been renovated, while they won't win design awards, they are spacious and comfortable. At JFK, there is actually real champagne (let's hope that won't be cost reduced); at GRU, it's a Brazilian sparkler, surprisingly drinkable. Hot food at both ends looked dubious, the cold stuff was upscale deli quality but varied and tasty enough to make for a pleasant light supper. Boarding both times was smooth, the flight attendants were personable and caring, AA's much reviewed C seat is really spacious and confortable. I slept soundly, both ways practically from wheels up to final descent. Flights arrived a little early both times. What more can you ask for?

Tampa to Charlotte. Absolute worst airline. Had to take emergency military leave to attend my grandfathers funeral. Was told by employee on the phone to buy a later in day ticket to save money and was assured multiple times that my ticket was available to be put on stand by for earlier flights. Arrived at TPA, only to be told by multiple employees that it wasnt eligible to be placed on stand by. So yes I know this is partly on myself for being ignorant enough to buy a later ticket. However, due to the dishonesty on the part of the sales representative and refusal to listen by the airport employees I missed my own grandfathers funeral. Really appreciate that AA. If I could give you a negative 10, I would.

Not Verified |  I had a flight leaving out of Washington DC to go to Arizona (layover) then to California. Raleigh Durham to Dallas Ft Worth. Terrible. It was round-trip both flights was delayed and don’t have space for cabin bag. Seriously this not acceptable everyone have their own time they shouldn’t ruin it. I am so disappointed.

Kona to Phoenix. Awful experience on an aging, dirty poorly equipped plane. Seat had almost no room, very narrow. The legroom even though I paid for extra was awful and inadequate. Charlotte to Boston. Was supposed to leave at 10:20 pm, got postponed three times without any information. This airline is getting much worse, this is not my first bad experience, I am considering even canceling the credit card I have with American Airlines, not interested in their miles, very disappointed and frustrated. Not Verified |  Gulfport to Dallas. I am sitting at the airport with another delayed flight. It has become way more normal for a flight delay than on time. Particularly with AA! Ruined my vacation! Flight to Jacksonville delayed, rerouted to DC with a connection flight to Jacksonville. Los Angeles to Chicago. There is too many seats in the airplane and no one have any space. Everyone is sitting and touching another person every time you want to move. Oklahoma City to Tampa. The absolute worst airline. Customer service leaves a lot to be desired. I was transferred 4 times. I will never fly American again. The staff in customer service for Dallas airport was very belittling to me. So he cancelled my flight because I told him to go back home.

New York to Dallas. Every time I've flown through them, my flight has been delayed. We had a 1 pm EST flight from LGA to DFW, which was cancelled eventually after several delays due to mechanical issue. Austin to Durango via Dallas. Well we made our flight to Dallas barely on time. St. Thomas to Detroit via Philadelphia. Honestly, this airline provided me the worst experience as far as flying goes, I fly somewhere usually once or twice a year, and I’ve been traveling via air travel for as long as I can remember. Every flight and connecting flight I rode on was delayed by hours, the last trip being the longest of the delays. I found out some customers were given extra miles or credit towards another ticket at the airport, so I decided to call AA customer service to try and get the same credit. Instead of receiving help, I was talking to an extremely rude “customer service” agent who at the end of our phone conversation was literally screaming and yelling at me and reduced me to tears of frustration. I spoke with a supervisor who apologized for her co workers behavior, but I was still offered no other help or credit. This airline is a joke, and you are way better off saving over 150 bucks per tickets and fly spirit or some other airline before you consider this one. At least when spirit delayed my flight they offered us meal tickets and partial credit towards another ticket. I never say this about a company, but I hope AA goes under because they are truly terrible. I feel bad for the cabin staff, because they were the only ones who were kind and supportive and they work for a bad company.

Not Verified |  Knoxville to Charlotte. I was late (my fault) I tried to check in at the kiosk but it wouldn't let me, thinking i missed my flight. St Thomas to Huntsville via Charlotte. I arrived at my gate on a 2 hour lay-over. Sat there all this time. They boarded the flight to Huntsville. San Antonio to Wichita via Dallas. I’m traveling with a service animal, not an emotional support animal or a therapeutic animal but a service animal. I’m also traveling with three small kids. That is a long time for a service animal. She was starting to show signs she needed to go to the bathroom. They had moved us over to terminal C. I asked where the pet relief station was. I was told there are none in C. They are all located in A and D. They repeatedly failed to mention the one in B. Even then I wouldn’t have enough time to go to B and catch my flight. Before I flew I called and asked about flying with her and pet relief. I was advised in thermal C they would have someone escort me out and back in. The gate agents refused and said there is nothing they can do. I requested a supervisor. A guy name Kip, who did not introduce himself came over. The only reason I know his name is I asked someone else. I repeated what the gate agents said. I asked what am I expected to do when she goes to the bathroom. His reply was as an airlines that is not their responsibility’s i replied back how shitty American Airlines customer service is and how you guys are the worse airlines. He told me I didn’t need to us profanity, which I did not. He just stood there and I told him bye. He wasn’t helpfully so what was the point of having him stand there. He left and went over to a computer and started to type. They finally got ready to preboard. I was waiting in line and while he was typing he would repeatedly stair me down giving me a very dirty look. Finally I asked if I could help him with some thing. Not Verified |  I booked a flight to Tampa through budgetair which consisted of a connecting flight. Toronto to Charlotte, NC to Tampa. The aircraft was having maintenance issues which lead to the airline saying they would update us once they recieved information in 45 minutes. The A.A representatives were extremely rude to all concerned passengers. Following cancellation, the airline was forced to rebook everyone to the following day. They sent emails with hotel & food voucher but they were for Charlotte), not where I was stuck (in Toronto). Since it was late no one could get a hold of a representative. No one was there so I was stranded with no where to go, having to sit in arrivals all night and morning until the flight the next night. It was a devastating night. The following day when I made my second attempt to get to Tampa. The tickets they issued were a massive downgrade from my previous flight. I WOULD NEVER FLY with this company strictly based on the terrible experience with all staff. Delta is the way to go if flying to US destination. Hartford to Dallas. My 4 year daughter and myself were flying with our pet, and right from the rip, the customer service/baggage check in woman was super nasty. Needless to say, by far the worst airline customer service we have ever encountered, and we will NEVER fly American Airlines again!

Raleigh to Miami. I just want to start by clarifying that the rating is exclusively for the agent to check us in at Durham airport, who had a choice to be or not to be hospitable with my wish for an extra seat for my lap toddler, if available, and he chose to be hospitable and do his best to accommodate us. My recent trip to Jacksonville (JAX) was plagued with problems the minute I became an American Airlines passenger. I want to be clear that the first leg of my journey from Seattle to Dallas (DFW) on Alaska Airlines. I can’t say enough good things about them. I continue to be a very loyal Alaska consumer. My American Airlines 8:35pm flight from DFW to JAX backed out from the gate on time. Before entering the taxiway, the pilot came on saying there were mechanical problems and we had to return to the gate. A bit later we were told to deplane. No one was able to provide any information on whether the flight was going to continue or not. Around 930/10 pm, American announced the flight was canceled. I then headed with the 200 other passengers to the American Airlines Customer Service desk where I waited in line for over an hour. By the time I reached the desk, it was midnight. I was “automatically” put on a 5AM flight from DFW to Charlotte (CLT) then on to JAX. The customer service lady and I agreed that a hotel room would be worthless, since the flight was scheduled for 5AM. She offered me a meal voucher, which I accepted. A whole $12 voucher. $12 to spend in the airport. Unfortunately, the stores were closed and there was nowhere I could spend the $12. I spent the night in DFW waiting for a 5am flight, all due to American Airlines’ mechanical problems. At some point, I called American’s customer service to see if I could get better compensation. I was told no, $12 is it. Nothing else. Have a good night. My early AM flight was also grounded due to mechanical problems on American Airlines. While we waited on the plane, several people deplaned. Some spread out. Finally, over 2 hours after our scheduled departure, the gate agents came on to do a final head count. The count was so far off, that they made us deplane and replane. Again, more passengers abandoned the flight for other options. I was now going to miss my connection in CLT due to American Airlines’ mechanical problems. By this time, my last meal was over 24 hours ago. I was unable to eat in the airport because I either had to stay at the gate, was captive on a broken American Airlines plane, or nothing was open. The snacks American offered I could not eat due to being gluten intolerant. I finally made it to CLT, the plan leaving over 2 hours late. Fortunately, my connection was also late due to weather and not a mechanical problem (what a refreshing change). I arrived in Jacksonville 18 hours after I was supposed to and after a journey that took 36 hours instead of 12. All of this due to multiple mechanical problems on American Airlines. To add insult to injury, American clearly demonstrated that my value as a paying customer is worth all of $12 to them. However, since I was never able to use the voucher, my value to them is actually worth $0. Which is exactly what I will be giving them in the future! Journey took 36 hours and should have been 12.

Atlanta to Chicago. The flight was smooth. I will definitely be back to purchase flights again. Wish it was more leg room but the flight and snacks we're great. Thank you American airlines for my smooth trip.

American Airlines is a hot mess! Do not fly this airline. We flew from Philly to Jax hole  via Chicago, a route we have done 5 other times on other airlines with no problems. Further evidence of american’s incompetence is that they put us up at a spring hill suites in Jax hole where the hotel had no rooms. The poor people at the hotel desk had to shuffle all kinds of things to help us. American said mechanical issues caused our first cancellation and then a “multitude of problems” caused the second delay and cancellation. Take care of your planes American and get a handle on your scheduling! If you want to get your flight cancelled and scramble go for American. They do that really well. I am never ever flying American again and will go out of my way to not fly this horrific airline. They just don’t care. A gate agent working for American told me “this happens to everyone” about all of my cancellations. That statement is so indicative of how they feel about its customers. No big deal, we will ruin your vacation, mess up your life on the way home and cost you tons of money. I should add that my previous 2 business trips were also a horrendous experience. In February 2019, I had a meeting in Orlando and American delayed the 8:55pm flight by 2 hours because the overhead bin doors were broken. How does this happen? I got to my destination at 1am. Great when you have an 8am meeting the next day. My other trip was to Indianapolis from Philly. American cancelled that flight because the crew timed out and made no effort to rebook us. I would have missed my important meeting if I relied on American. I ended up flying delta to Cincinnati and then Uber’d To Indy. Unbelievable. The last debacle that I will leave you all with is our vacation to Vail last March (2018). Also a route from Philadelphia to Dallas to vail airport. Our flight should have left at 1pm for Dallas, it was delayed 2 hours and then 2 more hours and then the flight finally took off at 7pm, so we missed our connection in Dallas to vail and as a result had to stay over in Dallas and then go to vail the next day. We got to vacation a day late. I should have learned from this experience! Never again, American. You don’t care about your customers and are a complete cluster. I fly a lot for work as well, and whenever I can, I will not be taking American unless absolutely necessary and it will be begrudgingly!

Dallas Ft Worth to Cancun. American Airlines is the worst airline I have ever witnessed. I had a ticket that they just disregarded and therefore I am pushed back to take a 1:45 flight which ruins my day plans and trip plans. The flight attendants made it completely unclear as to the volunteer and voucher program and therefore now that I did not volunteer but was forced to not board my flight, I am not getting a travel voucher and am not guaranteed to be on the next flight. I am now waiting for 5 hours at DFW on my birthday still unsure as to if I will get in the next flight. The communication in this airline is terrible. Flight attendants are uninformed and are incompetent at giving customers information as to why 60 paid customers who bought their tickets 6 months in advance are now forced to take a later flight that we are not even guaranteed to go on. Overall, a horrible experience that of course I have to deal with on my birthday and am now missing and entire day of my three day trip. I wish that this airline would compensate for all the issues this has brought me for their lack of supplying seats to customers who have had a seat on this flight for over 6 months. No one should ever fly this airline, you will end up missing your vacation and stuck in the airport with no explanation.

Denver to St. Louis via Chicago. American Airlines is a complete joke! First they lose my email so it was nearly impossible tracking down my boarding pass. They do not care at all for making that easier on the customer. Then my flight was running behind (not delayed, just behind) so I was late for my layover and my ticket had me boarding at the wrong gate. I finally tracked down customer service and there was a huge line. People from different flights having similar problem. Customer service didn’t even care. The offered me a possible discount at a nearby hotel. They should have refunded me every dime and paid for my hotel in full. I had to spend the night at the Chicago O’hare airport which is not accommodating at all. Do not fly American Airlines! I’ve talked to so many others and I wish I knew before hand. Stay away from American Airlines.

Los Angeles to Miami. I was refused to be refunded for the airfare of the flight which had to be canceled due to my daughter’s illness. She was only 9-month old baby who was badly vomiting and at high risk to fly. As advised by the AA airline, I provided an explanation and discharge papers from the doctor. However, it did not touch anyone in American Airline’s customer service because three weeks later, I received a cold statement that refund is not allowed. I’m so greatly disappointed that will never consider American Airline again and definitely discourage my relatives and friends from considering their service.

I have been flying AA for over 20 years, 10 of which I have been Executive Platinum. I travel nearly 200,000 miles/year on AA. It seems AA have seriously gone down hill in recent years. Their on time record due to equipment troubles have been so poor that it's become unreliable for a business traveler. As an example, in just two recent weeks I've missed a connection in London due to a 2 hour delay because we had to switch planes for equipment problems. Then my flight from DFW to SEA was cancelled over 24 hours before the flight, again due to "equipment problems". How can you not get a new plane in place over the course of a day when they already know the plane has problems. This has become more the norm for AA than it should ever be. I am so disappointed with the drop in quality level of the on time performance and random cancellations that I am considering switching airline loyalty.

Dallas Ft Worth to Phoenix. The gate agent in Dallas was not checking the size of the Carry-ons. Once he realized space was an issue baggage started being checked for size. I was forced to check my brand new bag, his response was "I should've gotten to the gate earlier" well if my connecting flight was delayed i wouldn't me in this situation. Who speaks to customers like this? When i boarded the plane it was obvious that no one checked to see if there was actually room for carry-ons. 3 empty overhead compartment. The agent showed no compassion in regards to my situation. i was flying for business and did not have the time to check a bag. i also had very expense components within my suitcase for work in which i was told "the airline insures it". long behold when i received my luggage from the carousel one wheels were broken off.

This wasn't my first time flying with American airlines but it will definitely be my last. For starters, I have had more than one bad experience with them. This time, I was flying from Lafayette to a connecting flight in Dallas and then to Toronto. I always check my flight status ahead of time and there were no reported delays or changes. But for some reason, the agent at the boarding gate in Lafayette was not letting us board at our scheduled time. They gave us no information as to why we were waiting and told us we would be boarding shortly. Well, 'shortly' became at least 40 minutes. After landing in Dallas, my party and I found out the gate and terminal had changed from what was on our boarding passes and switched to the other side of the airport. After running through the crowded hallways and shouting apologies we made it to our gate which was already closed and unstaffed, about 10 minutes before our scheduled flight. At the next American airlines customer assistance counter, we were told the next available flight would be the next day. Myself and at least 10 other customers were trying to figure out how this happened as we all arrived to our first flight well ahead of the scheduled time. The agents at the service counter were saying it was coded in the system as 'delayed due to weather' ... but why then were the other similar flights, one of which departing just 10 minutes before ours, not also delayed due to weather...? How was this one flight in particular the only one delayed due to weather? Why was the online flight tracker not updated? And why was it listing our first plane as 'landed on time' in Lafayette... ? We took a step aside, and called the customer assistance number and agents over the phone were saying there was no reason listed for the delay. I took my phone back to the counter and had both agents speak to each other, who could not agree on the information they each had available. After they decided to agree-to-disagree, they informed us that their policy does not offer any accommodations for room, food or necessities. We were told the reason being that it was coded as a weather delay... Now, I was never rude or took a tone with the service agents, but they were still not helpful or empathetic to the situation, I guess they are just too used to delivering bad news. They also never offered any information about the area such as what hotels are nearby, even after we asked. At this point, I asked for a supervisor who could offer more assistance in this area, yet we were told that a supervisor would tell us the same thing, and we would be 'wasting our breath'. The only alternative we were offered was the website to American airlines, where we could send an email. This whole experience has left me quite skeptical about the information being given from American Airline and its service agents, who may use these 'codes' to protect themselves from obligations and policies they advertise to its customers. Please consider my experience as a warning for anyone looking to book any flights with AA online, and please exercise caution especially when booking connecting flights with them as they allow a minimum window of 30 minutes between connecting flights and will not accommodate you if your next flight is missed, even if they are solely responsible and the situation is out of your control.

Cancellations and delays are part of air travel. However customer service reps with attitudes are ridiculous. It wasn’t just one, but each individual we encountered and observed in both airports seem to not have a concern in the world if we enjoyed the flight.

The worst airline. On my trip from Nashville to Dallas they made us wait more than an hour inside the plane for maintenance problems, which caused me to lose my connection to Mexico City. They offered me the next available flight. To make this experience more terrible, this second flight, ALSO had technical problems. 40 minutes of delay have passed and we are still not taking off. I missed a great date for your poor service. I always use United, but for wanting to arrive 30 minutes earlier I decided to use american. What cost me until now more than 3 hours more! ES:   La peor linea aerea. En mi viaje de Nashville a Dallas nos hicieron esperar mas de una hora dentro del avion por problemas de mantenimiento, lo que hizo que perdiera mi conexion hacia Mexico city. Me ofrecieron el siguiente vuelo disponible. Para hacer esta experiencia mas terrible, este segundo vuelo, TAMBIEN tuvo problemas tecnicos. Han pasado 40 minutos de retrazo y seguimos sin despegar. Perdí una gran cita por su mal servicio. Simpre uso United, pero por querer llegar 30 minutos antes decidí usar american. Lo que me costó hasta ahorita mas de 3 horas MAS!

Not Verified |  Washington to Charlotte. I had three flights, and they wouldn’t give me a seat on the first one. Finally managed to get on, then the flight got seriously delayed so I missed both my layovers because of it. Don’t buy from them because you’re not guaranteed the seat you paid hundreds of dollars for.

I was flying from Lubbock to Dallas Ft Worth via Houston. My flight landed on tarmac at 605am. I was at the tarmac for 30 min flying American Eagle flight. As soon as it reached the jetbridge, i was out of there making my connection to the other terminal so I wouldn't miss my flight to Houston. After running hard and fast, I managed to reach my gate. I was stopped and asked for my id and boarding pass. I showed it to them. The lady remarked she was too busy at the starbucks to come sooner, looking at my starbucks bag. I was so shocked at the way she looked and assumed it was my fault somehow. I don't need terrible customer service at the gate as well as in flight to start my day bad. Please be courteous to your customers and try flying your flights on time rather than assuming your customers are late.

Denver to Garden City via Dallas. 4 flights on American Airlines, and late 4 times. That's a 0% on-time rate. This is a terrible airline. Average time late: 1hr. Don't fly American! Any airline is better than this.

Reno to Long beach via Phoenix . We booked a flight departing Reno airport at 9.29am which was to land at LAX 11.09am (AA 6018). AA 6018 got cancelled due to weather conditions (other airlines like Southwest didn't cancel their flights) and were booked on a new route which had a layover at Phoenix. The flights were AA 546 departing Reno at 12.45pm and landing in Phoenix at 3.28pm and AA5896 departing Phoenix at 3.56pm and landing in Long Beach at 4.15pm. You can already see how tight this layover is. The first flight was late in Phoenix by just minutes but we arrived at gate A7 and were supposed to depart at gate B16, running took 10 minutes. My sister and I caught the plane before the gate closed and were checked in but the employee who checked us in held on to my ticket in her hand while she assisted other travellers, answering their questions and letting them through. The other passengers on our first flight (AA 546) who were running towards this connecting flight (AA5896) arrived at gate B16 and the employee realised there were so many other passengers who had to board and decided to close the gate. She and the subsequent managers and other AA staff insisted that it was standard procedure to close the gates 10 mins before the flight and there was no communication from the first flight to hold this connecting flight. They even called security when one of the passengers who arrived later than us (but before the gate closed) started crying. The AA staff had us booked on the next flight from Phoenix to Long Beach (AA5899) which was delayed by 1.5hrs. The flight duration between PHX and LGB is also 1.5hrs.
