I am shocked that multiple delays and hours spent in airports waiting for their mechanics to get the planes in fit condition to fly amounts to $100 on an airline that I have no intention of ever flying again if there is any alternative. I've flown Spirit airlines multiples times and had better customer service than American provided. I advise you to steer clear and avoid American Airlines if at all possible. I could have driven the 1200 miles and gotten home before I did by flying.

Savannah to Miami. Flight delayed repeatedly, for more than five hours, how is it possible to make any connections. Extra fees for everything, checked bags, drinks, snacks, headphones. How does this airline compete on the global market.

Kauai to Detroit via Los Angeles / Charlotte. We used our loyalty program to book tickets with American. United is the hub where we live, but we have chosen American for what used to be its service. The program apparently has so many rules that when we arrived in Charlotte, NC trying to get back to Detroit, there was an earlier flight. American would not allow us to get on the flight even though the plane was half full. The company preferred to make its loyal customers wait for six hours until its next, probably half full flight leaves for Detroit. I waited at the gate for the agent who never showed. The pilot, who was waiting too, politely told me that I could go to the customer service desk to get help. When I arrived there, two of my original five passengers were somehow on this flight. Interesting that they had to fly back already allowing American to resell their seats, saving them two 850 vouchers at our original departure city. The agent at customer service told me I had to call a number to get help. The agent at the number couldn't help. But her supervisor at Dallas Fort Worth asked why I hadn't talked to a supervisor at the gate. I politely told her that I was told to call this number. She told me we could fly standby but the agent had to reset her documentation which is fine print for not wanting to take the heat. Every single time each employee said they couldn't break the rules - he/she was not going to get written up for breaking the rules. I wonder when helping loyal customers became breaking rules. Sounds like this organization needs to reorganize around its central service orientation: people. Looks like I wont be choosing American over other airlines anymore. Loyalty program beware.

Dallas Ft Worth to Corpus Christi. Our plane couldn't land because the taxi runway was still taken up, because of this I missed my connecting flight, I was supposed to be home before noon, instead I'm spending my entire afternoon in the DFW terminal having to buy overpriced food and American Airlines refused to refund any portion of my trip even though it's their fault I didn't make it home on time.

Guadalajara to Dallas Ft Worth. Flying AA in economy (Booked using BA Avios) you must purchase your checked in luggage at the check in. This caused insane mess and it took ages. Check in agent then informed us that we are not seating together and offered to seat us together at the cost. This is a blatant extortion! Besides, this is completely unsafe practice, as in case of an accident split families will look for one another putting the whole evacuation at the jeopardy, but i guess for AA it's only $$$ that matter. Safety is overrated. Staff ground as well as flight crew, not a friendly bone in their body. Service is fast and efficient though, but might as well be performed by robots.

Los Angeles to London. Another deeply disappointing experience with American, and this time it involves an illegal, deceptive sales method. Purchased a so-called "basic economy" ticket from LAX to Bucharest at a not so basic price. This allows me to check in 24-hours in advance and obtain the best seats then available. Was unable to check-in online and was told it is because I am flying on BA to Romania. Romania is a EC member-country just like France, England, & Germany and also does not require a visa of US-citizens, so I do not understand this pretext. I was told to drive out to LAX and check-in tomorrow when there is nothing left but middle seats in the back. I protested and then learnt the real reason my check-in is restricted: they advised me to purchase seat assignments online for more than $100. When I protested further the agent told me it was my own fault for buying "basic economy," but I responded that the real error here is patronising American Airlines. This is what is called by the FTC "bait-and-switch" and it is illegal. I am dreading this trip now because of this and the 3-hour connexion on BA - the last time I flew AA to London and then a BA flight to Düsseldorf my suitcase was delayed for two hours but it took BA five days to bring it to me and by that time I was on my way back to the airport to continue my journey - they then tried to negotiate me down on my modest interim expenses. I advise you to save yourself anguish, headaches, and "American-"style service (that means discourtesy all around and bitter stewardesses with chips on their shoulders) and fly a foreign carrier like KLM, Swissair, Lufthansa, or Austrian. You'll arrive happier and in good condition.

Montego Bay to Denver via Dallas. Worst customer service of any airline I have ever flown! Stark curtness and pure rudeness from the ticketing staff to the attendants. Must be a bad company to work for because every single staff member, on all legs of our trip, behaved like it was the worst day of their life. We felt as if we were inconveniencing everyone just by existing. This in turn, made this the most uncomfortable and unenjoyable journey of my life. We will continue to patronize our current favorite airline, Southwest, and avoid American Airlines at all costs! We will also be preaching to anyone who will listen about how horrible our experience was.

This is the first and last time I’d consider American Airlines. Flew San Diego to New York JFK. I was extremely uncomfortable this full 6 hour ride. The seats are extremely conjested and I felt very claustrophobic. I usually sleep any time on a plane but in no way could get comfortable on this flight. The seats are terrible, the TV screen is touching your nose, you get a coffee (drink) and cookie for you whole (6 hour in this case) flight (everything else costs something), and they said I’d have to pay another $70 if there was a free seat open next to my friend so I could sit with them. Any other air carrier easily allowed me to switch my seat for free if something were open the day of the flight in my same class. I paid the same price for so much more on Delta and Jetblue.

Portland to Phoenix. Disappointed with policies. Paid to upgrade to premium class, sat next to a big guy who was stuck in middle seat. All exit seats were open, asked to move back to the exit seat so we were all a bit more comfortable, but nope "against the policies". Won't fly this airline again if there are choices, clearly a corporate decision to take customer service and reasonable accommodation out of the employees hands. Disappointed with how far this airline has fallen!

Seattle to Wilkes-Barre via Chicago. If you are able to, I would avoid American Airlines if it is possible for you to. First, the flight was delayed because their defroster wasn't working, which could have been avoided by them warming it while we were boarding, rather than waiting till we had been sitting for awhile to defrost it! So we sat there for about twenty minutes until they finally got their defroster out and then we had to wait another hour for them to fix the defroster. Because of this, I missed my connecting flight in Chicago. The only positive thing about American Airlines is that they re-booked my flight automatically after the delay. But the next flight wasn't for another seven hours! Then, once I boarded the next flight, we sat for an hour again because there was "traffic" from the other airplanes. American Airlines was just a mess as you can see. Not to mention, completely unprofessional. While on the first flight (flying to Chicago), I saw the flight attendant on his phone while he was supposed to be handing out refreshments to people and they were very lazy. Two of the three flight attendants sat for most of the flight. The woman who was in charge of boarding was very rude, and I ended up having to check my second carry-on bag because they are very strict about the dimensions. My bag barely was over the dimensions. Overall, it was a very bad experience and such an unprofessional environment, filled with many incompetent people.

The worst traveling experience I have ever had. The flight started of by being delayed for about an hour then when I reach in Miami for my connections I had missed it due to the original delayed flight. Following this when I tried to go to the costumer service line it took them about an hour and forty five minutes to deal with the 8 people that were in front of me. Finally I make it to talk to the customer service desk and they tell me that they are not providing accommodations and that I will be stuck in Miami till the next morning. Although there was a flight leaving for Toronto in 45 minutes that they could’ve put me on which they didn’t. All in all this was one of the worst experiences I’ve had flying and I believe that it was handled very poorly by the people working at American Airlines, both in Miami and in Trinidad.

Not Verified |  Detroit to Dallas. Horrible experience. I had to jump through many hoops in order to pay for my bag, and the agent helping me with it took so long that I almost missed my flight. When rushing to security I accidentally left my backpack at the counter and when I came back minutes later it was gone and the agent at the counter was extremely rude and unhelpful when I asked her if she had seen my backpack. At my gate I was practically yelled at by customer service for asking if they knew where my bag was. I also tried to call the airline to speak to someone in customer service to see if they had my backpack and was left ringing for 10 minutes before I finally hung up. Wish I could give them negative stars.

After two weeks staying in Albuquerque, on Jan 2, our family of 6 was flying back to the East Coast on American Airlines. A snowstorm unexpectedly hit Albuquerque and Dallas, and the evening before our flight we got a phone call that it was canceled. I was very thankful for getting this information prior to arriving at the airport the next morning, and American was able to rebook us the following day on the exact same flights. Weather delays and issues arise, and as regular travelers, we understand this. My husband, four children, and I arrived at the Albuquerque airport about 20 minutes before 5 AM for our flight to Dallas that was at 6:45 (we like to hit security about an hour before our flight). There was already a very long line of about 150 people waiting to be checked in. Almost all of the kiosks were broken and not working and the ones that were working would not process our tickets because of the prior day's last minute flight changes from the airline. Our kiosk actually asked for us to get a worker to help us process our tickets at the kiosk, and when I asked the woman checking in kiosk bags if we should wait for her to help us, or if we should get in the line she started yelling at us to get on a different kiosk, that they don't all work out it wasn't her fault. I think they were maybe 3 working kiosks at that point. Only 2 workers were checking in standard tickets, 1 was 1st class only (and mostly standing doing nothing), and another was checking bags from the few who got the kiosks to work. After waiting in the line for over 2 hours, as we approached the front of the line, 1 of the desk workers began yelling at the crowd that it was our fault that we had missed our flights and we should have been there hours earlier. My husband responded to her and told her that the crowd had not all missed their flights because of being late but because of the inability of the airline to handle the delays from the day before. She began screaming at us that we should all know to arrive over 3hrs early for any flight. That maybe recreational travelers don't understand these things. The entire crowd of now 250 people behind us yelled wow at her and she proceeded to turn to the security guard and make a comment about having my husband removed. Thankfully the security guard shook his head no at her. She told us that it was all over the website that we needed to be there over 3 hrs early. When looking at the website to verify, there was no mention of needing to be there 3hrs prior and nothing under the alert section either. I believe there were well over 300 people waiting in line to check in at one point. Once we got to the counter almost an hour after our flight was supposed to leave, we were refused ticketed seats for the 6 of us on flights and put on standby rather than give a new tickets because this was "our fault" for missing the flight. They also tried to make us pay $250 a ticket to get new flights because again it was "our fault" and not theirs. The six of us entered security at 7:40, (exited it less than 8 minutes later), after being at the airport almost exactly 3 hours. While I'm very thankful for the gate workers along the way who found creative ways to get us home, ABQ AA needs a new ticket counter staff. We will not fly with AA again.

Amsterdam to Philadelphia. On the way to Philadelphia : - entertainment system old fashioned monitors - none of the handsets worked so we were unable to listen to the shown movies - food that was distributed was below any quality - leg space for my length 1 meter 90 a disaster in the aisle seats on the floor there are boxes for the non working communication system that take 25% of the space to put your legs. The way back with even older 767-300 - entertainment system did not work at all - we skipped the meal - we tried the “continental breakfast “ which is just a complete joke how can you screw up yoghurt? - seats are uncomfortable and old.

Lafayette to Portland via Dallas. Absolutely terrible, poorly organized staff and files, will lie on reports to ensure you cannot get compensation for issues they caused. My first flight was delayed by over an hour due to another plane making an emergency landing on my flights runway, and they wrote it down as 'weather delay' because they knew if they did I would not get compensation for a hotel when I inevitably missed my connecting flight. They also constantly demand you check your carry on because they don't allocate enough space for them on flight. Overall the worst flying experience I have had to date, I would steer clear of them if you value your time and money.

Not Verified |  My husband and I were flying to our tropical honeymoon. Our flight was supposed to leave at 5:38 AM so we had to be the airport by 3:30 for international flight. Our flight was extremely delayed and we missed our connection to our destination. They tried to reroute us however every time the flight got delayed and we missed every connection. Sitting on the tarmac for over 5 1/2 hours waiting for the plane to be fixed. Finally after it was fixed we got to Charlotte where they directed us to Miami and then to our destination. However we were supposed to arrive at 3 o’clock we didn’t arrive until well after midnight. we missed a complete day at our resort and I was out a lot of money. The next few days we tried to recuperate we were on able to experience any of the excursions we had planned. Upon my arrival back home to the states I contacted American Airlines where they have the following to say “ we apologize for this inconvenience however we will give you $100 credit each for this inconvenience please note they do expire within a year”. My husband and I almost never travel and we blew all vacation time to do this trip with one another. I am beside myself with regret and anger towards this airlines and the fact that they would not help me beyond this hundred dollar credit voucher.  It would’ve been better if these would never expire since in 2019 we cannot take anymore time off. They should’ve put us on a different flight to begin with or had a top priority to get the flight fixed.

Not Verified |  New York to Nasville. I was not notified until just a few hours before my flight that they had too much weight on the flight. So instead of notifying me earlier, it was more so last minute. Then, they let us go down the terminal ramp to the plane, and another American airlines employee rudeley told us to go back up the ramp. The employees were very slow at rebooking and we even saw them send another couple to baggage claim to get their bags instead of checking the gate they were at, (which the bags were actually at that gate). Very disorganized airline. This will be the absolute last time flying with them ever again.

Reno to Phoenix via Yuma. I paid over 1,100.00 for 2 round trip tickets for my son and I to visit my husband living in Reno for work. The dates were Dec 26th - Jan 2. I was bumped off both directions to a later flight. Luckily, I purchased flight insurance for this possibility. I still paid even more to check 2 bags each way. That is a ridiculous amount to pay and get bumped off both flights. I arrived this morning at Reno/Tahoe at 5 Am for a flight after 6 Am and there was nobody at the counter to check me in. That's not acceptable. Specially paying over $1,100.00. I could have bought a used car and drove home for that much money.

Not Verified |  Albuquerque to Rochester via Chicago. Our initial flight home was booked for 1/1/19 on AA1431 at 6:54am. American Airline canceled our flight on 1/1 gave us a rebook on 1/2. Then once again canceled our flight 1/2 as well. These cancellations provided us with hardship. No place to stay. No reimbursement or food voucher or free tickets. They canceled us twice and we are stranded fending for our selves. They did not even give us option to fly sooner than. 48 hours is way too long to be stuck somewhere unplanned with children in tow!

Cancun to Dallas Ft Worth. Due to bad weather in the US, our return flight from Mexico to DFW was cancelled - this is not what I'm upset about. My concern is how we were treated. There was NO airline rep at the gate, and we were told over the PA to go to another gate for "more info", which they never communicated what was going on or how we would book another flight. We had to go back through customs and they transported all passengers to different resorts for the night (I do appreciate the accommodation), but still, no information on how to secure new flights. Not everyone had international phone service if they even had a personal phone, and, the resort didn't have a way to get online and book a new flight. The app said "no flights available", and if you tried calling AA, you would get hung up on. After 1.5 hours on hold, we were able to secure a flight. AA should have re-booked everyone before we were transported away from the airport. I was traveling with a group of 10, including 2 in a wheelchair. Once we made it to DFW, our flight to Kansas City was "oversold", even though we had tickets and the agent at the gate was very rude and not empathetic, nor did she communicate what was going on. I was told "you should thank this man for giving up his seat for you" - really? This is not how you treat customers. I submitted a compliant, and they said they were "sorry for the weather, outside of their control", and I responded that is not what I was complaining about, and they sent another response back saying "it's not their policy to compensate"...again, that is not what I was looking for. I just wanted to provide feedback so they have an opportunity to not lose any more customers. I will never fly with American Airlines again. I should have stuck with my old faithful and reliable Southwest Airlines

London to Montreal via Chicago. American Airlines do not respect schedule, they made me miss my flight to Montreal through Chicago, no support no nothing on new years eve. I will never travel this airline again.

Dallas to New York JFK. After working nonstop to be able to fly for New Years to see my family and friends. I was meeting a friend in NY for a day and a half to spend there. American Airlines decides to canceled my flight less than 12 hours before. Their explanations was because the plane of my flight was canceled at his first destination. They scheduled me for 2 days after and I changed it for the next day. I missed my day in NY, the whole reason I did this trip. Never getting a flight with American Airlines.

American Airline is the worst for seating. We purchased tickets from San Francisco to Charlotte over a month ago and our flight on the way and returning, did not have seats next to each other. When parties book very expensive plane tickets, they assumed they’ll be set together. Don’t count on it with American Airlines.

Kona to Washington via Los Angeles. I really enjoyed my flight with American Airlines, everything that could go right did go right. My plane left on time for both flights and the staff seemed to go out of their way to make sure everyone had a great flight. They frequently made rounds throughout the cabin but could tell if you did not want to be bothered. My seat was pretty comfortable and I had enough space to be comfortable. I was surprised how comfort the seat was since I am 6 feet tall and usually find economy seats to be very cramped. The only problem I had with my seat was, the USB port on the A321 did not work.

New York to Kingston via Miami. Horrible customer service. Want computers to do their job for them. 4 hour delay for maintenance. Slept in Miami airport overnight for them to tell me I have to pay $150 for my carry on bag after it was already carried on to my first flight. All about money. No respect from either rep at airport or supervisor. Demanding more money. Had to throw out my brand new carry on bag. Called 1-800 rep she said for me to keep receipts for refunds because supervisor at airport is incorrect. Most frustrating service ever and I fly often.

Burlington to Pensacola return via Charlotte. We attempted to check in on the kiosk only to find we were not seated together. We had to pay $60.00 to get seated together and they would not assign seats for our connecting flight or give any gate information for our connecting flight! So at each Gate we had to ask for seat assignments only to be told to wait and wait and wait until just before boarding! At one time we were told we were on standby, yet we were holding tickets. All the gate attendants treated us like we were an annoyance to them (with the exception of the BTV attendant). We will never fly on American Airlines again. We even observed them split of a mother and two small children, a father and two small children and many couples - placing them randomly throughout the plane and telling them they would have to barter to sit next to each other! The most inefficient way I have ever seen to assign seats and board people.

Boise to Phoenix. Let's put a screen in the back of every seat. And, just as passengers begin to fall asleep let's pump loud, obnoxious ads into their faces preventing from sleeping because we won't let them be allowed to control the screen or volume and be forced  to continue to listen to our ads for credit, food and movies over and over. And don't forget the bag of broken up stale pretzels. I'll never fly American again.

Charlotte to Tulsa. American Airlines is the worst airline to fly with. Everytime there is a 1-5 hour layover. They overbook the flights and have 0 customer service. I will be choosing a different airline in the future because this airline is never going to get me to my final destination on time!

Knoxville to Charlotte. I missed my flight due to the slow understaffed check-In and TSA. I got to the airport more more than an hour in advance and was forced to stand for an entire hour. The TSA line was unreal and none of the staff was kind. Along with my self 9 others missed this flight. The staff was so rude and they closed the door in our face.

Not Verified |  Las Vegas to Dallas via Columbia. I don't know where to begin because I had so many problems with American Airlines. Flight from Las Vegas to Dallas canceled. Was given alternate flight to Chicago - Charlotte - Columbia. Landed in Chicago only to be told flight to Charlotte had also been canceled. I did not have a carry on bag due to AA's policy for economy travelers, I asked that my checked bag be brought to me so I could get my medication. My checked bag was located in Philadelphia even though I had no connections in Philadelphia. The next day, my flight to Columbia, SC was diverted to Charleston. Finally made it to Columbia after 28.5 hours only to find that my checked bag had made it to Columbia hours earlier. So AA can get your checked luggage to destination sooner than passengers. Makes absolutely no sense.

Not Verified |  Seattle to Aruba via Philadelphia. I was at the airport early. I checked in with no one in front of me. My luggage was checked in right away with no issues. Well the next day it was till in Philly and it was going to be sent from Philly. I finally received it about 7:00pm . Really disappointed in AA.

Not Verified |  Dallas to San Diego. The day after Christmas, there was a storm in Dallas so our plane was delayed. Flew American Airlines from Dallas to Boston. My flight has been delayed for the past two and half hours. We aren’t getting proper reasons for the delay and still they are asking us to wait. This is our last flight for Boston from Dallas after which we may need to catch new flight the next day in case of cancellation. Very poor response from the team. Also they keep on changing terminals.

Philadelphia to San Diego. Very disappointed! My flight was from Philadelphia to San Diego on Thursday December 20th, gate A2. We were a group of five, my mother (a senior), me and my 2 children ( age 6 and 4) and my youngest sister. Unfortunately our seats were randomly assigned and not close to each other, so I decided to speak to the agents at the gate to help me sit at least with my kids together. I approached the guy at the gate in a very nice way and I asked him if he can help me with seats. I was shocked because of his unprofessional attitude! Instead of answering my request, he pointed at me with his fingers and asked to go ahead and board to the airplane! I repeated my question again and he started yelling at me.  I boarded with my kids and family, me and my 6 years old  had to sit by ourselves in different places, I asked the flight attendant if they had any open seats, she said yes, we have 20 open seats so I managed to sit at least with my son! I don’t usually post bad reviews unless it’s really bad! I was shocked by his attitude and poor behavior. American Airlines are losing hundreds of customers due to bad customer services. They really need to work on training their staff on how to do their job in a professional way. This person could’ve been able to help me but instead, he decided to act like this with a customer. Last time with AA for sure! I don’t recommend them, instead, Jet blue are much better and more professional.

Chicago to Knoxville. I am appalled at the service American Airlines offered. They canceled my flight from Chicago to Knoxville at the last minute. We were literally about to board, 20 minutes later than they originally told us. After the cancellation, they offered us zero help. They said our flight could not be rebooked and that we would have to leave Mmuch later than expected. They also refused to pay for a room for us to stay in, even though it was their fault. There were also little to no seats on the flights we needed; therefore, our traveling group had to be broken up and we had to make complex arrangements to get back to where we actually needed. For example, we wanted to fly to Knoxville but we ended up having to fly to Chattanooga. We then had to ask someone to drive all the way there to pick us up and bring us back to Knoxville. There workers/company has given us no help and is pretty much clueless about most of our questions. They didn't even know how we were supposed to get our luggage back. I am very disappointed in this and I plan on only using Delta flight services in the future.

Austin to Phoenix. My original flight was for Friday around 6 am on December 28th. The customer service swore there were no other flights to get me out on that same day so they got me on a flight for the 29th. Already one day taken away from my trip I was made but was willing to work with it. They have now delayed my flight on the 29th by 5 hours and are hesitant to work with me in getting onto a quicker flight to get me out of here. I have spoken to many people and no one has been helpful. I will never fly this airline again and will stick to Southwest Airlines which is always faithful and I have never had any issues with.

Not Verified | Dallas to Atlanta. Horrible experience. Delays after delays and on top of that a bunch of attitude. Made us check our small bag in when ones clearly larger than ours was put overhead. Never again. Thanks American for reassuring me that Delta is the way to travel. Never had delays or snobby employees with Delta.

Not Verified | London Heathrow to Mexico City via Dallas. Our trip was a shocking state of affairs. Understandably there had been terrible weather which knocked everything back. So we took off 4.5 hours late, went to New York instead of Dallas and missed our connecting flight to Mexico City not great but I was happy to chalk it up to a bad luck. And admittedly the staff on the flight were brilliant, very kind and tried everything to help everyone on the flight. The ground staff however were absolutely vile. I’ve never seen people treated like that in my life let alone in airport related problems. The attitude from the AA staff on the desks as well was unforgivable, they had absolutely no urgency and not a single iota of warmth. AA need to send each and everyone on a customer service training course. No point risking with this airline as if anything happens you’re in for a torrid time.

Knoxville to Dallas. Will never be flying with American again. This was my first experience with them. Flight was cancelled due to weather and then due to their mistakes I was not able to board the flight that I rescheduled for. For the third time that I rescheduled they scheduled me for the wrong time. Now I am having to reschedule my flight but no agents are getting back to me. 0/10 terrible service. Unprofessional and incompetent staff. Poor experience.

Memphis to Denver. The day after Christmas, when all i wanted to do was go back to Denver, when a startling email, caught me asunder. My flight had been canceled due to lack of a reason, I should have known not to fly American this season. I rebooked my flight for the morning of tomorrow only to find I was again stranded, cancelled. There's nothing we can do the lady told me, no customer service to my disbelief. I said give me a refund, they said no way. I said fine, I'm flying southwest. Have a good day.

Denver to Miami. I am glad I am home and the flight was safe. However the customer service of American Airlines is so bad, nobody really cares about you, as a matter of fact it’s quite the opposite. After canceling our flight at 1 am for reasons not valid since they said it was due to weather but the gate across the hall from us departed to Miami half an hour after and our plane was sitting there the entire time, nobody cared to give us assistance with hotel, and in order to book another flight home which happened to be on my birthday, we had to wait 4 and a half hours on hold, and were able to get on a flight for 2 days later. The worst part is that once we arrive at the ticket counter after all we went through they make a big deal about 4 pounds over weight of my luggage and we purchased the main cabin seats so we can be more comfortable and guess what? Seats don’t recline! We pay $50 for seats that don’t recline! I was exhausted and for a 1:20 am flight you want to sleep, you figure they will tell you seats don’t recline!

Chicago to Newark. Our flight was delayed from Cancun to Newark and American Airlines put us on a flight from Chicago to JFK . I was just curious to know if there were any other flights closest to our destination since I saw one available to Newark, but the people at the kiosk were extremely rude and annoying. I sincerely request American Airlines to please incorporate courtesy training with the staff at American Airlines.Its really annoying and insulting for people who wait for 28 hours for the flight and then have to face such annnoying comments. I don’t mind to some extent to wait for the flights due to whatever delays but I at least expect the customer service to be decent enough not to treat people in this way. Especially the staff at Chicago of American Airlines sucks. However we did find one person out of the lot who was courteous enough to put us on a a flight. Thanks to him but for the rest I call out to American Airlines to please deal with in a strict manner.

I typically don’t write bad reviews but I am extremely disappointed every time I fly with AA. Not only do they completely ruin my holiday plans but they do it without caring. They literally are always putting the blame on something other than their company when really it is the results of poor maintenance and poor flight/booking management. I have been at the airport for going on 12 hours now and I still have a 3.5 hour flight in front of me... and that’s if I’m lucky and they don’t cancel this flight after I wait god who knows how long. Think long and hard before booking a flight with AA, it’s very likely you will have a terrible experience.

Wichita to Milwaukee. Did not let me pre board with my infant and stroller. No hot water available for a bottle. I called AA twice before my flight from Milwaukee to Wichita and they assured me of pre boarding and that I did not need warmers because hot water was available. My checked luggage was also damaged. After my bad experience I called agents after my flight who were so rude, would not give me their name and then disconnected. She was snarky and insinuated that I was too incompetent to write a formal review on the AA website, which I told her I had already done. I purchased insurance with my first flight and switched flights coming home to be on the same plane as my husband because of the awful experience I had from the beginning. We had to pay for an entirely new ticket instead of just the difference. Cheap, rude and none of our family and friends will ever fly with American Airlines. I would give a 0/10.

Dallas to St Louis. What a nightmare trip on American Airlines. We have had problems on every flight this trip. We have had every flight delayed or cancelled and have had to spend an additional two days in hotels and we are still not home. The way they handled the changes we're ridiculous. I have never flown on AA before and recommend that no one else does either.

Not Verified |  Hartford to Chicago. Extremely upset with the service of American Airlines. I’ve been in customer service for a while and that was the rudest encounter especially with the holidays.

Not Verified |  Los Angeles to Dallas Ft Worth. We visited LA for Christmas. We were scheduled to fly back to Dallas 12/26/18 at 7:45. I was to check in online for that flight and received our boarding passes through email. After we returned our rental car, I then received a text message that our flight back to Dallas has been cancelled. We headed to the airport and out flight was rebooked for later that night 10:30pm LA to Reno then to Dallas. My husband had to miss work. We had to ride the bus going to our assigned gate, as soom as we arrived at the gate I received another text message that Reno to Dallas flight has been cancelled. We approached the staff and they told us to go back to ticketing counter to get our flights rebooked as there is nompoint for us flying to Reno if our final flight to Dallas is cancelled. We stood in line for quite sometime to get our flights rebooked. So our flight got rebooked again to depart evening the following day. We asked if a hotel will be provided, they said no hotel because it is cancelled due to weather. We had to pay extra for our hotel. We also had 1 checked baggage and we were told to go to baggage claim area to get it. When we got there they told us they can’t locate our bag, that it might be being loaded going to Reno. Staff advised us to come back at 5:30am and said since our flight from Reno to Dallas has been cancelled they will send the bag back to LA. All our clothes and toiletries are in out checked baggage. We came back the following day and another staff said it would be a miracle if out bag will be sent back to LA, when she checked the status it said that it is headed to Dallas from Reno. Now we are here at airport, our flight back to Dallas is supposed to depart at 5:59pm 12/27/18. Few minutes after we arrived on the assigned gate, I received a text that our flight is delayed amd will be departing at 7:50pm! The delay Is not about the weather this time. American Airlines is horrible! Won’t be flying with this airline ever again!

Tulsa to LaGuardia via Dallas. We will never ever fly this airline again. They left us stranded days before hurricane Irma hit the florida Keys, canceled our flight back from Austin Tx and we had to drive the last leg from Dallas airport, have made us late several times on business and pleasure waiting on a pilot to show up or maintenance. Now, they have ruined our wedding which is planned in NYC because of they cancelled our hours before for maintenance and then they changed their mind and said weather related. They were nice enough to book us a flight 2 days later! though! We have friends leaving the same airport which is Tulsa with different airlines and neither of them were cancelled nor delayed! My fiance wanted to try and stick with American since they headquarter in our local city (Tulsa), She finally said never again! We will cancel our American Airline credit card as well since we will no longer need their frequent flyer miles. Good riddance American Airlines.

Not Verified |  Indianapolis to Cancun via Philadelphia. I flew American airlines out of Indianapolis we were the first flight out of the Airport 5:15 a.m. We boarded our plane and the pilot informed us the Co- pilot was nowhere to be found and they could not reach him. They eventually found a replacement we flew to Philadelphia we landed 10 minutes before our connection flight took off. We ran through the airport only to have the door closed in our face, plane still attached to the jetway. Along with 20 other people who were on the First flight with us. So the group of us marched to customer service to try to catch the next flight which none of us did. We were all rerouted onto multiple other flights. We were rerouted to Dallas ( this flight they also boarded the entire plane they took everyone off because they forgot to do a security check even know the plane had been sitting there for 30 hours and no one though to do that before it was suppose to fly. ) People missed cruises. My wife and I missed an entire day of our honeymoon by the time we got moved around and reached Cancun it was midnight. All because a pilot didn't show up and they couldn't hold a plane for 10 minutes to allow 20 plus people to make the flight. To top it off the airline tried to cover its ass by claiming it was a mechanical malfunction when we talked to customer service deposited the gate agent , captain and flight attendants saying the co pilot didn't show up. Never flying American Airlines again.

Not Verified |  Corpus Christi to Baltimore. Flight canceled just hours before takeoff with only reschedule possible 2 days later to a different airport. Missed reunion, although made reservations 60 days in advance. Much anger. American staff also seemed angry with customers. I don't envy them.

Not Verified |  We arrive at the Tallahassee airport just for them to tell us our flight is delayed due to the crew. That delay was 2 hours. San Antonio to Dallas. I have been sitting on a plane for 8 hours and it should have been an hour and a half flight. I was originally scheduled to leave at 7.50pm front SAT, and around 5.30 I received a call informing me my flight had been cancelled and that I was going to be on a new flight departing at 6.27. Now, finally after boarding and waiting four hours to take off due to adding 360 miles to the trip, having to fuel up with 2,000 more pounds of fuel and maintenance problems, here we sit. Not Verified |  San Francisco to Columbia . I arrived Christmas Eve at 11: 45 p.m. to Columbia. My bag did not arrive. I received a text from American Airlines that my bag was on a later flight. I am extremely disappointed in this policy. I am being charged for a mistake made by the airlines.
New York to Charlotte. Horrible disorganized service! Half of staff tried to be nice and helpful other half have given up.

Not Verified |  Detroit to Miami with American Airlines. Extremely unhappy with the customer service and flight operations. American Airlines from Chicago to Miami. Seriously, probably one of the worst airline companies. Pretty comparable to Spirit. 3 days of cancellations, missed connections and horrible service. Completely unorganized. The staff looks like they seriously dislike their jobs too. What a terrible experience. This airline is sinking quick!

Dallas Ft Worth to McAllen. American Airlines has by far the lowest quality planes in the fleet of any airline. The planes are old and in bad shape, the customer service is far below any customer standards. Customer satisfaction is not a priority for AA, not even close.

LaGuardia to Chicago. I was appalled to find out that unlike every other airline I have ever flown, American makes passengers with infants wait and board at the back of the plane. Clearly they care more about their premium passengers than families and is no longer a family friendly airline. I will never fly American with kids again.

Not Verified |  Absolutely horrible experience! Started at 3am when nobody shows to check our bags - almost missed our flight except our 5 am departure gets delayed until 11am! Missed our connection to DFW and following connection to Belize City - now waiting at DFW on our lost baggage. I could go on and on about courtesy and such but that was a total flop as well - never again American Airlines!

Washington to Baton Rouge via Charlotte. Awful. Flight was eventually delayed about four hours, though that information was only fed to us in hour-long chunks. The initial information concerning the delay came an hour before my scheduled departure. The cause of the delay was equipment malfunction, which American admits is entirely within its control. I was re-booked with a flight late the next day that involves an additional hour of layover, and an additional two airs in the air, in a middle seat. All escape row seats were available at the time of my rebooking, but I was explained that these are still only available for a fee. Further other earlier, direct flights, were available and offered to other travelers. No meal vouchers were offered. They offered lodging at the nearby Econolodge and Ramada, the shuttles for which were so small and infrequent that it took me 45-minutes to get from the airport to the hotel. A trip that should have taken three hours will now take 18, directly and solely as a result of American's ineptitude, and the only compensation they see fit to offer is a budget hotel, the commute to which detracts a further two hours from its use.

Newark to Orlando. We have just had bad experience with American Airlines and had to cancel our vacation, the flight was delayed and we missed connecting flight, and instead of helping and find some solution they told us to cancel our vacation. I was trying to find another person but they did not even talk to us, they were so rude and ignoring, they said they can not put us to another flight because it is overbooked and no compensation, no hotel or free meal, no sorry, will never fly with the company ever again. Stay away from them if you don’t want to ruin your vacation!!!!

Miami to Newark. I’ve never experienced such a disgusting flying experience. I was asked to tip the curb side check in by one of the attendants. I was then told my carry-on despite compliance was needed to be checked. After asking for my jacket to be hung up in an empty coat rack, they denied me. They didn’t add my TSA pre - check upon board with a child. I will never fly with American Airlines again.

Terrible airline. I flew from Boston to Toronto via Laguardia. The plane was delayed for 2 hours in Boston, then they said that I would miss my connection from Laguardia to Toronto. They rerouted my to a flight from JFK to Toronto. When I arrived in Laguardia, they lost my bag and it took me two hours to retrieve it. Airline staff at Laguardia was rude and not helpful. I took a cab to JFK from Laguardia, when I arrived at JFK, I found out AFTER going through security that my flight to Toronto was cancelled. They sent me back to Laguardia, made me standby for two flights, neither of which materialised. There is no apology, no explanation, no compensation. I had to catch a flight from Toronto to Asia, and obviously I missed that and had to take care of the changes, and hotel stay at NYC.

Not Verified |  Philadelphia to Tampa. They gave away our seats that we paid for when we had checked in 20 minutes prior to them boarding plane. Airport security held us up! We arrived at airport on time! First time “flying” American Airlines and we will never fly them again!  Let us remind them that - American Airlines’ conditions of carriage specify that passengers must be at their gates and ready to board 15 minutes before a scheduled departure from the US.

Charlotte to Chicago. Complete incompetence. After a 2 hour delay they have us all packed on a plane just sitting here 40 minutes and the pilot says he has no idea how much longer. Anyone that flies with American Airlines should have their head examined.

Miami to Bermuda. American Airlines did a horrific job today. First one of their flight attendants did not show up on time to depart so we didn’t load up until 45 minutes after we were supposed to start. Then after boarding some passenger was not supposed to be on this plane and they had to get his or her bag from under the plane to let them off. They did a terrible job with this as it has taken 2 hours now and we are still sitting here.

Washington to Syracuse. I said the last time I flew with them, that I wouldn’t again. I should have listened. I was on a flight that not only children, but adults were screaming on. There were thunderstorms the entire flight there, in which I got videos of lightening right outside of our window. Even before the flight, my fiance had clothes that made a bulge in his bag, and they made him throw away a Polo Ralph Lauren T-shirt (60$), a pair of Nike socks, and a pair of Tommy Hilflager boxers ($40), and did not give us the option to check his bag or anything like that, the agent literally pointed at a trash can. That is unacceptable on its own but let me go on. They destroyed my brand new $360 luggage set. And on top of that, My fiancé needed to use the bathroom, and everyone behind us were using it no issue, we paid extra for our seats, but when my fiancé got up to go to the bathroom he went to the one ahead of us ( we were in row 10 I believe, and was denied restroom service) “I’m sorry, can you not read the seat belt sign?” Is the exact words used by the flight attendant, he tried using the bathroom at the front of the aircraft ( irst class bathroom). What I am saying is, American Airlines is at the bottom, but one ahead of United. I fly 4-6 times a month, and they don’t care about their guest at all.

Not Verified |  Have not flown American Airlines in over 5 years now I know why. So cramped, no leg room, dirty planes, worn and full of germs. I fly a lot for business and pleasure more then 50 trips a year. Recently return from Asia booked budget airlines on outer island that experience was much better then the cramped, hot, dirty American Airlines flight I took. Think again about booking economy class, better off with Southwest, Spirit or Frontier new fleet of planes. American is keeping old planes retro fitting them with more economy seat which means those extra seats take leg room away from somewhere, maybe your seat! Plane was so darn hot asked 3 times to turn on air, sick people around me tons of Babies on flight so could you imagine all the germs the poor kid were exposed to because the lazy flight attendant did not lower temperature! If you want no leg room and a dirty plane book American they no longer have the standard they were known for, they are now a low budget.

Not Verified |  Charlotte to South Bend. Flight left on time. Although advertised as allowing a carry on bag, there was an effort to get folks to check bags at the gate. Question, if it is allowed, why do they need to be checked - if the plane is small, allow free bag check before getting to the gate. Based upon the way the industry is geared, it seems that the best thing to do is always take the bag with you and allow it to be checked at the gate for no cost. In order to check a bag it required the removal of any medication, batteries, personal items, etc, the items one specifically packs into a carry on bag because they want to have it when they land. Also the cost for the seat (booked last minute) was extremely high (>1000) for a flight of approx. 2 hours. The service on the plane was good. I have decided to not recommend AA due to the gate experience, cost, and poor frequent flyer program.

Nashville to Ontario via Dallas. Flight was over an hour late leaving Nashville due to mechanical issues. It happens, but, this was my 4th non weather delay on 6 planes just this month. I missed my connection at DFW (after rushing to get to the gate that is always on the other far side) so they put me on a later flight. That was also delayed because the crew was late. I always try to pay extra for seats with leg room due to being a little claustrophobic and did so on both flights. My BNA to DFW seat was 16A an exit row seat. So I thought and so it said on my boarding pass. I get on the plane and it is in fact not an exit row. Okay, I’m irritated at this point, but, still going with it. The lady who helped with the flight (she was nice) from DFW to ONT put me in seat 10-A. No biggie. Window seat right(?) and I understood that I was a late passenger. I get on the plane and although it is next to the fusulage, there is no window AND the there was less leg room than the normal seats. It literally looks like there was an exit door there at some point and they just covered it up and threw a row of seats in.  I’m done with AA period.

San Antonio to New Bern via Charlotte. American Airlines has always been less than courteous when it comes to customer care. I’m a doctor by profession and have been taking frequent flights recently for my interviews etc. Almost every flight I take with them is delayed and the delay happens to be more than 12 hours every time. I end up missing my connection flight and it affects my job. Their attendants are less than helpful when it comes to updating the customers on flight updates. I have had delays with other airlines like Southwest and delta. Their staff is courteous and they make sure they are updating the passengers every 20 mins or so. The delays that I have faced in American airways are for ridiculous reasons. Like on this recent flight, they had all of us seated on a plane flying out from San Antonio. And right before take off they announced that they just realized that they don’t have a pilot available to fly the plane. Another time, they kept delaying the flight every 20 mins for a total time of 8 hours because ‘a seat on the plane was broken’ I realize unexpected things happen all the time but with this frequency and the attitude of the employees of this big company, is very disappointing.

Boston to Washington DC. My flight this morning was late to take off from Boston due to unexpected snow. Because of this I was worried I wasn’t going to make my connecting flight to Sarasota so I had asked a traveling flight attendant a quick question about it and I was beyond amazed by the response. Cynthia for AA went above & beyond helping me out! She walked me thru Washington terminal & even gave up her seat because it was closer so I could make my flight (I didn’t) but it was her kindness and thoughtfulness that made the whole process not as stressful. Thank you Cynthia & Lisa. Because of your kind act I will always look to fly American Airlines first going forward.

Miami to St Maarten. Worst ever treatment by an airline company.  You can't carry a carry-on for your 75 years old father unless paying additional fee, you can't carry a hat on your head, you can't have 1/2 pound over 50lb until repack, but carry it on your body is OK. Total weight will be the same, and more stuff inside cabin.

Amarillo to Dallas Fort Worth via Corpus Christi. The worst experience I’ve had with any flight. Delay after delay. Then when we finally get to Corpus we can’t even get to our gate to get off the plane! Unorganized, and uneducated on their job. Lied about tires in Amarillo.  Never again.

I came to the Albuquerque airport to pick up my daughter and had my TSA credentials with me so that I could go through TSA security. Thanks American for the terrible customer service and not  allowing me to use that to get through security to get my daughter. I would have preferred to use the expedited security line because I am allowed but agent didn’t want to fuss and gave no explanation. United is the worst airline, and American Airlines have become a close second.

Phoenix to Newark. They've taken to splitting everyone up just to charge 80 dollars a seat to get back together. Their customer service sucks, their planes are uncomfortable and are, generally, an awful way to fly.

Not Verified |  Dallas Ft Worth to Baltimore with my 6 month old baby and my mother in law for an event. Had a good flight. Plane left in time and we got there on time. Sadly enough our bags did not arrive. My baby’s food (which at the airport they won’t let me carry in my hand luggage), diapers, bath, clothes etc I was mad frustrated because the  attendants were not help matters. They asked me to buy and mail receipts for refund. My bag only came next day at noon. When I mail the receipts it took forever. I started calling to find out it was from one excuse to another. Some customer service said the file has been closed. Thank God for one staff who took my case personal and helped out. She is the best specialist for central baggage.

Nashville to New York. I’m highly disappointed by the ground service of American Airlines. I had to check in and drop luggage at the front. I waited in line for 15 min then agent asked to go to the kiosk and print boarding passes and bag tags. (Isn’t that suppose to be their only job in first place to get us checked in?). Anyways I went to kiosk (another line), waited there for another 15-20 min. Finally I started to check in and it didn’t allow me. I asked for help and guess what I had to go to the another counter, and another queue. Those two old ladies were the slowest people on earth, didn’t had any clue how to handle computer, they had to ask for help for every customer and took them at least 5 mins to address each customer. I had to wait for another 15-20 min. I was very anxious by now as I had a flight in less than 45 min and had to go through security and all. Finally I managed to get my bags checked in, she didn’t make it any easy, I had to take off few items as I my bags were overweight by 1 freaking pound. She started to give me lecture on how it can make flight imbalance and all. I was gonna ask what do you do about 400 pounds people? Do you ask them to distribute their weight across flight? Anyway god bless bna security people, I cleared security check in less than 15 min and was able to make to the flight in time.

Madrid to Miami seat 13A. Premium Economy Seats on the Boeing 777 are located in a very small area about 21/24 seats next to the business class. Seats are great, service is excellent except for the lavatories. PE passengers are not allowed to use the business class bathroom in any circumstances. The flight attendants treat the 21/24 premium passengers like they were not human beings that have spent much more money to have the comfort they need and make them to walk about 60 rows in a very narrow aisle completely packed of people and stay in a endless line to use a very dirt and super small lavatory which is really a challenge and return to their seats at PE that means walk back 60 rows in a very narrow aisle with a lot of people standing. I have been traveling in a PE at Virgin Atlantic and also in Air France where PE passengers are treated as a priority class. Next time no more American Airlines, there is better service out there!

Norfolk to Dallas Ft Worth. Overall experience as far as customer service at the counter, flight attendants, comfort, and flight was good. But when something goes wrong they go to their little policies and leave you hanging dry. My flight got canceled due to weather no obviously that’s out of their control which I completely understand, but then they book me to another flight in less then 24 hours to the same city where it currently is snowing at the time and where the weather channel is reporting heavy snow for the next few days. When they basically say that this is the only next available flight we obviously take it, but it also gets canceled. I’ve traveled with Allegiant and have had flights canceled due to weather, but they provided a hotel and even vouchers for our next flight. So we got stuck for two days paid hotel, food, and also missed work for two days. I guess every airline has a different policy, just some are better than others.

Springfield to Albuquerque via Dallas Ft Worth. Flew American today and I am so happy that I regularly fly Southwest!! My flight was delayed because of a ground hold, arrived late into Dallas, was told to ‘run’ to the gate to get my connection and they closed the door as I walked up. I’m then put on another flight, in a coach seat, even though I paid for extra legroom and get to board last. Thanks for your attention to detail American and for taking great care of your customers. Like they even care?

Ft Lauderdale to Philadelphia. The plane turned around very quickly to accommodate connections in PHL. I appreciate the captains concern. To make this turnaround happen, no food was put on the plane and minimum clean up was done. I paid full fare first class. Nothing but 2,000 points offered. I should have been refunded my fare down to a full coach fare. I will do my best to not fly American and to let the world know how unimportant the customer is to AA.

Not Verified |  Salt Lake City to Morelia. Very disappointed in our recent flight with my family. The flight never told us we might not get our luggage due to the passenger weight. When we arrived at our destination after a very long 23hours of traveling we go get our luggage and they tell us and about 10 more passengers from the same flight that our luggage had been left at a previous airport! Very frustrating we have been on our trip for 4 days now and our luggage is still not here. I have been calling our landing airport to see if they have them yet and they tell me we need to call our airline. We have had to spend more money now buying clothes since we don't have our luggage. I can’t get through to them and it seems as they don’t care about making their flight passengers happy. This is definitely the last time we fly this Airline. Let’s see how long it takes to get our luggage.

Ft Wayne to Charlotte. What helpful and pleasant customer service associates. I purchased a non refundable ticket 10 days before the hurricane hit North Carolina in September. American Airlines was kind enough to offer me a travel voucher. I booked for November and then my grandfather died and yet again American Airlines gave me a travel voucher. Above and beyond I love the direct flight from FWA to CLT! And now on will purchase travel insurance

Not Verified |  Los Angeles to Salt Lake City. My wife and I were to catch AA flt 6036 to LAX leaving at 11:59. Before 8:00 AM we got an E-Mail from AA saying the flight was on time. At 9:00 AM the baggage agent told us the flight was 20 minutes delayed. The inbound aircraft never left the ground! We were told at about 12:00 that the flight had been canceled but there was plenty of room on flt 3401 leaving at 2:30 PM (too late to catch the ship). The gate attendant knew that the flight had been canceled but waited until all competitive flights had left before the announcement. This was a clear case of canceling a lightly booked flight and consolidating it with a later flight to save money. A classic case of AA's "customer be damned" business philosophy. Never again with AA

Not Verified |  I paid for and flew first class from Cedar Rapids to Las Vegas on American Airlines on November 23 2018. On the DFW leg of the flight I had reserved a meal for this flight. Everyone in first class was served drinks and a meal before me. I thought it was rather strange, but I didn't say anything. After everyone had eaten the attendant told me that they did not have my meal. The meal that I had pre ordered! I was then given a snack box. They told me that there was no record of me ordering the meal. Even if I had not ordered a meal I think I should have been served with the other passengers. I received 5,000 frequent Flyer miles for my trouble, wow!

Atlanta to Miami. The distance was not long but I will never fly with them again they have bad delays. I took this flight from Atlanta to Miami to get on my cruise ship the plane had a delay which made me miss the boat after calling for several hours to customer service I couldn’t get no help. Customer service continued to hang up, be rude, was non caring they made me feel less as a customer saying it’s nothing they can do while there policy states “if we have delays we will accommodate you on the next flight” - they did not, all they said was sorry buy a new ticket which is inconsiderate while they mad me miss my next connection.

Phoenix to San Antonio. Changed boarding gate # with no announcement. Almost missed flight. Staff was rude when asked about it. Will never fly American again. There was no concern that I almost missed my flight and that others may have missed it all together. Horrible customer service.

Not Verified | Round trip from Fayetteville, NC to Chicago, IL. Departed 2/04 returned 12/05. Return flight from Chicago departed 2 hours late. Missed connection from Charlotte to Fayetteville. Had to stay in Charlotte over night. Flight home to Fayetteville next morning left 40 minutes late. American had 5 chances to get a plane out of the gate on time and failed four of the five times. All Delta due to equipment failure of maintenance issues. Never again!

Austin to Chicago. Have flown many other airlines in the last several years and I really can’t say I thought one outdid American. They have really improved a lot over the last several years. Better seats, better planes, better lounges, more routes and generally respond well to feedback. The basic economy and the choice to make status much more difficult are unfortunate and weak in their copy cat nature but we shall see how they play out.

San Jose to Nashville via DFW. The customer service of this airline has consistently been pretty terrible and rude. I was placed on standby for a flight and went to the gate desk a little early and told to come back after the current flight departed. Understandable, no problem (with the exception of the slight attitude the gate attendant had with my mere presence). I came back when my flight was supposed to be serviced, and again told the flight just needed to pull out of the gate and she could help me, again with annoyance that I was back. I stand back a couple feet to make it clear that I am ready when she is, and then proceed to listen to the gate attendant talk about vacation, travel, all other chitchat etc., for 30 minutes - ignoring that I’m clearly waiting for her. I approach and tell her I’d like my seat assignment, and she breaks from her social hour, and throws a boarding pass at me that was already printed! Why was she waiting to just hand it off? This employee had no interest in doing a key component of her job, in just being generally pleasant like a normal human being, and instead wanted to just loaf and chat with colleagues as her main job - all else an annoyance. Most American flights I’ve had were delayed, and I only reluctantly booked again because I have a lot of travel this month and wanted to stretch a budget. If you can, pay a bit extra for any other airline to get you to your destination and be treated with some semblance of respect along the way.

Not Verified |  
We have flown American Airlines in Business a number of times over the past years and found it lacking in comparison with other carriers. This trip, however, broke that pattern. The 789 from Paris to Dallas was a delight, comfortable and plenty of cubbies for storage. The service was very good and the food was excellent. Based on expectations, this flight got an A+ in every category. The DFW-SJC portion was good but limited by the service standards of domestic flying. Crew was nice but I fail to understand why US carriers do not put footrests in F cabins. It is a small thing but adds greatly to the comfort of the flight. Good job AA.

Not Verified |  Montego Bay to Boston via Miami / New York. Worst airline I’ve ever flown with. First could not get seats together with my husband. Was told & desk they don’t sit family members together because they want you to pay to sit together. That we buy the “air” not the seats. If we want to sit together more $$, even though empty seats together still available. Second booked our flight directly from Boston to Montego Bay Jamaica and back. Return flight from Montego Bay to Miami to LaGuardia NY to Boston. Left Sandals at 4 Am. Cannot for the life of me figure out Why they sent us this route when there were direct flights with empty seats from Miami to zBoston. For us to change was $400 additional. In LaGuardia now flight delayed 2 hours. We’ve been traveling since 8am will not arrive in Boston till 9:15 but every time we look at monitor delayed more. Horrible experience. Will never fly this airline again. Staff not sympathetic

In booking my round trip flight from XNA (Fayetteville, AR)to RSW (Ft. Myers) and back, when I printed the itinerary, the return flight was not to XNA but to FSM. Reservations wanted $400 to correct the return flight to the airport we originated from. It makes no sense that when booking online, I click on Round Trip and then enter from XNA to RSW and somehow the return flight gets mixed up and has us flying into a totally different airport. And they want me to pay $400 to make the correction to the airport that I was suppose to be returning to in the first place. That's what I call idiotic! I'll be looking for a different airline for our next trip.

London to Guadalajara via Dallas. I'm unsure if American used to have high customer service standards, but they certainly do not have them now. They are the worst airline I have travelled with, especially as a Business customer. The planes are outdated, I was given drinks tokens in the lounge, my screen broke from London to Dallas and it needed 3 follow ups from me to get a tablet instead. My flight from Dallas to Washington was deplaned due to an issue, I then wasn't allowed back into the Lounge I had already been in. There were many people on the plane who had already come from a cancelled plane. I get the impression that this is routine for American. In a week period I flew on 4 American flights, and each of them had an issue of some description. Their Business and First Lounges are dated, lack facilities and food (especially compare to Emirates which are brilliant). Giving it 3 stars because I made it to the destinations eventually, and I had a particularly good steward from Dallas-Guadalajara. However none of the trips were relaxing, despite paying for First or Business.

Not Verified | Houston to Los Angeles. Just the most horrible flight I have ever had. What more can I say. The seats are so small and hard, the service was terrible (what little there was of it), the toilets were putrid and not cleaned through the flight (even after the staff were made aware), and when I asked for water through the flight as I got very dehydrated and unwell, I got the royal eye roll. I had paid for the seat upgrade to the bulk head and the staff came barrelling through with the trolleys with not as much as a warning let alone an excuse me. The only positive thing was the current movies they had to view and the ground staff were helpful especially in relation to tracking my lost bags. I will never fly this airline again.

New York to London. It was a night flight. I hate the night flights because I am not able to sleep on the plane. There were two meals. A hot and a cold. My place was in the 24th row. The flight is 7 hours long it is acceptable.

London to Miami. My seat was in the 42nd row. For the 10 hours the seat and legroom is very uncomfortable. They offered a hot a cold food and an ice cream. They had given beverages very often. The food was average. The stewardess was very very helpful and kind.

Miami to Washington. The interior of the plane was brand new. The windows are very low, any other thing is perfect. Clean carpet, seat, restroom. Helpful and kind staff. Cheap price. Fast boarding. They offered free, water and biscuit. Legroom and seat is enough for this 3 hours flight.

Not Verified |  Portland  to Pensacola via Washington. Worst treatment ever. I expressed to the gate attendant that I will miss my connection since the first flight was late. Totally dismissed me. We arrived late then parked on the runway waiting on a gate. Spent forever in line for customer service. Then they tried not to put me up in a hotel for the night. They rescheduled me for the following morning. No dinner, no breakfast. Next day the desk attendant was rude to me when I asked to get a seat closer to the do so as not to have to walk for long. Treated me as a leper because I was flying economy! Very hurtful and condescending. Last time I fly with AA. I’ll spend some more I fly with a decent airline

Valparaiso to Lansing via Washington. Absolutely horrid excuse for customer service or an airline in general. Every flight delayed due to incompetence and not a single employee that can answer any question. I will never waste money on such a trash airline again. How pathetic that Spirit is now better than American. Save your time save your money fly anything but American 0/10

Seattle to Cancun via Charlotte. American Airlines has the worst customer service. We were flying on vacation from Seattle to Cancun - 1 stop in Charolette, North Carolina. I chose this flight because it was a red eye flight beginning at 10:30 PM to allow us almost a full extra day of vacation in Cancun. The A321 airplane they used on our first flight was horrible. No in-flight entertainment system, no charging area in your seats and the seat space was cramped.  On our second flight on our way to Cancun we were on the tarmac when the pilot notified us of an issue with the plane where we would have to return to the gate for a 20 mins fix. Once at the gate, we were told the paperwork would delay us longer and they would find another aircraft. After another 2 hour wait the flight was just cancelled. No notification at all. 280 people began scrambling to find another flight. Needless to say they sent us to customer service where they had major computer issues and just rebooked us all on another flight the next day.  This was after 2 hours of standing in line. They put us up in a hotel by the airport, with no bags, and a $12.00 per person food voucher only for use at the airport with no restaurants but a small Starbucks for food. They made a meager attempt to give us 15,000 miles for our inconvenience but that doesn't cover our lost day of vacation, hotel fees for a day in Cancun, and additional food and Uber expenses in Charlotte. In attempts to get additional reimbursement for our hotel fees etc, they declined and said we should have gotten travel insurance. RI am not going to accept their 15,000 miles because I never plan to fly this airline ever again.

Washington DCA to Chicago. I just want to express my gratitude to 2 American Airlines customer service employees at Reagan National airport in DC. I am dealing with a vision disability and the both went the extra mile to help me change my flight and get me the proper info and they did it with a great attitude. Thank you, your patience and kindness went above and beyond!

LaGuardia to Washington via Buffalo. Poor and horrible service, too many delays in one trip.It should be a one hour fly until Washington and one more hour to get to Buffalo. I took my flight at 4pm and finally got home at 2am, small seats, no food not even water. Horrible and very uncomfortable.

I had a terrible experience flying from Chicago O'hare to San Antonio. My flight was delayed 5 times due to snow but workers were not able to help you and they were disrespectful. I totally do not recommend you flying in this airline. Service is awful, we were waiting in the plane for 2 hours to depart and we just get a glass of water or soda in the whole flight.

Corpus Christi to San Jose. I travel quite frequently whether it be business or leisure and usually am very happy with my flight. This instance however is unacceptable. I am a US Soldier and had to fly out of Corpus to arrive at my final destination San Jose to having no bags. My flight did not change. I had all my uniforms to go to my next training site, and now have been held up due to the airline losing my bags, and telling me I am unable to receive them till after 11am today. This is totally unacceptable. I would understand if flights had been delayed or changed, but neither of this happened. I am a frequent flyer and used 75,000 points to get this flight, and now I will be attending a training late due to your irresponsible staff.

Chicago to Boston. American Airlines is the most inefficient and disrespectful airline out there. They are late, and today they got to my limit by canceling my first flight at 3pm for no reason, they also expected me to get on a different flight to Boston vía Florida. After I discussed for 20 minutes with a very disrespectful customer service assistant she proceeded to give me a ticket to a flight straight to Boston 3 hours later (keep in mind she said several times it wasn’t possible to fly straight to Boston today, disregarding the fact that I paid 700$ in order to fly direct). The 6pm flight got cancelled after many hours of delay and now they won’t give me my carry on bag which they made me check back, and the cherry on top is that they expect me to leave tomorrow to Philadelphia and on Tuesday to Boston. Of course I am expected to pay for the hotel because that is the American Airlines way! Do yourself a favor and stay away from this so called airline.

Charlotte to Philadelphia. The crew were late to get on board, we left over a hour late from CLT. Then once we arrived into Philadelphia there were no ground crew waiting. Sitting on the ground as we wait “for the ground manager to assemble a crew”, so the pilot said, “American doesn’t usually hold these standards". I took this same flight last Friday  CLT - PHL and no ground crew where ready too. It’s a huge same American. You need to get yourself sorted. Bad hospitality half the time, late the rest.

Not Verified |  Washington to Miami via Washington. The flight to Miami was pretty good. Staff were courteous and attentive. The flight back was extremely disappointing. The seats were smaller and on an older model plane, and the staff barely attended to us. The nuts were lukewarm, and our trays were not emptied until the flight was almost over. The staff was more interested in talking to each other and playing on their phones than assisting anyone on the flight. Needless to say, we will not be flying American Airlines ever again. The service and level of comfort is vastly different than what we experienced on United Airlines and we will not be choosing American Airlines for future travel.

Raleigh Durham to New York. My first flight didn't offer us so much as a pretzel for a snack, despite a travel time of over three hours. The onboard wifi didn't work, meaning we had no entertainment whatsoever for 3+ hours. Poor service all around. On my second (return) flight, the wifi was working but I was charged $12 for access to it, after which the "free" movies would not load due an an error with the American Airlines app. I watched YouTube instead. Avoid this airline at all costs!

Los Angeles to Honolulu. Good Flight, but nothing special. Flight was on time from push back to landing. Bags also arrived very quickly which is a nice surprise from AA the mainland operations could learn something from the Islands on how to get a plane unloaded and bags arriving quickly. Plane is showing it's age with well wore seats. IFE worked great. I did not try the WiFi so I don't know if it worked over water. My disappointment with the flight is it was only OK, nothing special like the Hawaii flights use to be. FA did the bare minimum to make it through the flight again, nothing special. Meal was again, ok, nothing great. If you want a special experience for your trip to the islands, I would recommend Hawaiian Airlines and stay off the big three.

Phoenix to Austin. My review is for my son who who bumped out of his seat on his flight home from Phoenix to Austin. He had early checked in online 24 hours earlier and already had his boarding pass on his IPhone when he arrive at the gate. He arrived at the gate 15 minutes before the plane was due to depart. The person at the boarding pass scanner told my son your seat was just given away to a standby passenger. The gate agent gave my sons seat away right at the time my son arrived telling my son he was late but he was not late. So the gate agent was looking to bump someone off the flight in order to accommodate a middle aged couple maybe because they had made some sort of excuse. It was not right for the American Airlines gate agent to give my son seat away as he already had his boarding pass and they could have let him board but would not. They claimed he was late to the gate but he was right there while the gate agent was giving away his seat to another standby passenger.

Not Verified |  Chicago to London. Food and service was good. Seats are comfy. Good flight overall. Airline needs to take better care of their passengers belongings, both mine and my fiances luggage were completely ruined. We now have to buy new luggage. My suitcase had only been used once previously. Very disappointed.
